text: Germany-based scientists have identified a molecule that helps in the chemical reaction between the sperm and the egg to form an embryo. text: Two youths lost their lives while trying to take a selfie near a moving train in Punjab's Ludhiana district on Sunday. text: The Mumbai Police on Monday used a 'Hulk' reference in its tweet urging people to wear helmets, along with the caption, "Everything may not work out with all the grave mistakes you make! text: Users are seeking plastic surgeries to look like Snapchat filters, according to an article in JAMA Facial Plastic Surgery. text: The Bombay High Court observed that asking one's wife to cook properly or do household work does not amount to ill-treatment. text: Illness, elections in their constituency and detention in jail were the three most cited reasons by MPs for their absence from the 16th Lok Sabha. text: After Canada said it was "gravely concerned" over the arrest of civil society activists in Saudi Arabia, the kingdom gave the Canadian ambassador 24 hours to leave the country and recalled its own ambassador to Canada. text: The road safety protests in Bangladesh began after a boy and a girl were killed by a speeding bus on July 29. text: India's 22-year-old cricketer Smriti Mandhana has scored a total of 338 runs in her first six matches for the Western Storm in England's Women's Cricket Super League. Notably, Mandhana is the fourth-ranked ODI batswoman and the 13th-ranked T20I batswoman in the world.

Hendricks became the third South African to score a ton on ODI debut. Hendricks helped SA put up a record 27th 350+ total.

text: Tesla's limited-edition $1,500 surfboards which sold out in hours, are on sale for over $6,000 on eBay. text: Economic Affairs Secretary SC Garg has said foreign firms keeping data copies in India while retaining offshore storage operations has emerged as a possible solution. text: The Mughalsarai Junction railway station in Uttar Pradesh was on Sunday renamed after late RSS leader Deen Dayal Upadhyaya. text: The Mughalsarai Junction Railway Station in Uttar Pradesh is the biggest railway station in India that was built in the British era. It was set up to connect the Delhi-Calcutta route via rail. The station was named Mughalsarai as it was one of the busiest routes connecting east India to north India during the Mughal era.

text: Former Chief Election Commissioner Navin Chawla on Saturday defended the Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) saying they are tamper-proof and have been used comprehensively in the 2004, 2009 and 2014 general elections. text: The trailer of Kajol and Riddhi Sen starrer 'Helicopter Eela' has been released. Kajol plays an "an over-protective but cool mother" who joins her son's college to spend more time with him. text: Senior IAS officer Varsha Joshi has accused Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot of "misbehaving" with her at a meeting on Friday. text: Uttar Pradesh government will give Ã¢ÂÂ¹4 lakh to families of people who die from snake bites after it expanded its list of tragedies eligible for compensation under State Disaster Relief Fund. text: A glitch in Air India's system led to retired crew and employees who quit receiving e-mails to report to work. text: Google has rolled out a '3D Globe Mode' on Maps which shows the Earth as a globe rather than a flat "Mercator" projection as before. text: A 20-year-old woman was stabbed to death by her alleged stalker in broad daylight near Mumbai on Saturday morning. text: Sonali Bendre, who is undergoing treatment for cancer, shared a picture from New York and wrote, "Nowadays I spend far less time getting ready as I don't have to fuss over my hair! text: Replying to a query on Maratha community's agitation for reservation in Maharashtra, Road Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "Let us assume the reservation is given. But there are no jobs." text: Delhi Police is on high alert after intelligence agencies warned of a possible terror attack on August 15 on the occasion of Independence Day. text: DMK President M Karunanidhi will return home from the hospital within 2-3 days as his health condition has improved, DMK Principal Secretary Duraimurugan said. text: India on Sunday formally submitted a request to Antigua for the extradition of PNB scam accused Mehul Choksi. text: Former Indian captain MS Dhoni spoke in Tamil after he was invited to toss a coin and watch a match in the Tamil Nadu Premier League. text: After scoring his maiden Test century in England in a losing cause for India in the first Test, Indian captain Virat Kohli said that in the larger picture the century "doesn't matter". text: Slamming Congress leader Kamal Nath for calling him a 'madari', Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "Yes, I am a madari." text: Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday asked the newly elected members of the upper house to leave politics outside and focus on people's welfare inside the House. text: Saudi Arabia on Saturday resumed exports of oil through the Red Sea shipping lane of Bab al-Mandeb. text: The Universities and Colleges Admissions Service (UCAS), a UK-based non-profit organisation, wrongly e-mailed 4,100 students informing them they had been accepted to study at Newcastle or Northumbria universities. text: Actress Deepti Naval who appeared in films like 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara' and 'NH10' filed a police complaint after hackers blackmailed her and demanded Ã¢ÂÂ¹3.8 lakh in bitcoin within 24 hours. text: A panel working on Indian government's cloud computing policy has proposed data generated in India should be stored within the country, according to a report by Reuters. If accepted, the proposal could be a huge setback for technology giants like Microsoft and Amazon that provide cloud services. Local data storage for digital payments and e-commerce sectors is also being planned.

text: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra has described the Congress Working Committee (CWC) as "corruption wali committee" (committee of corruption). The CWC meeting chaired by Congress President Rahul Gandhi was held in New Delhi on Saturday.
summary: कांग्रेस वर्किंग कमेटी है भ्रष्टाचार वली समिति: भाजपा

text: BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi said no woman will be safe in RJD's New Delhi protest over Bihar shelter home rape case. Speaking about Congress President Rahul Gandhi joining it, she said, "Look at what happened during Rahul Gandhi's previous candle march. Even Priyanka Gandhi felt unsafe." Lekhi was referring to Kathua, Unnao rape case protest in which Priyanka was shoved.n

text: One of the largest sellers on Flipkart, WS Retail, has stopped selling its products on the e-commerce major's online platform. Interestingly, WS Retail was founded by Flipkart Co-founders Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal in 2009 to sell products exclusively on the platform.

text: Sanjeev Sanyal, the Principal Economic Adviser to the Finance Ministry, on Saturday said that in the long-term, GST slabs may come down to three, in addition to the exempted category. The three slabs could be 5%, 15% (merging 12% and 18%) and 25%. Presently, there are four GST slabs of 5%, 12%, 18%, 28% and the exempted category.

text: A 35-year-old woman from Madhya Pradesh suffocated to death after her husband allegedly stuffed adhesive in her mouth, nose and eyes. text: The Bombay high court recently reunited a 14-year-old Hindu girl with the four-member Muslim family that brought her up after her biological mother abandoned her. text: A police station established in 2014 to deal with alleged corruption cases against Delhi Police officers has arrested only 18 of 121 accused personnel, without being able to convict anyone. text: Priyanka Vadra will replace her mother Sonia Gandhi as the Congress candidate from Rae Bareli in 2019 Lok Sabha elections, reports said. Priyanka, who has not fought any elections yet, regularly campaigns for her mother and brother Congress President Rahul Gandhi. Congress workers have reportedly been keen on Priyanka joining active politics due to her perceived resemblance with grandmother Indira.

text: Opposition parties will decide the Prime Ministerial candidate only after the results of 2019 Lok Sabha elections are declared, said a report quoting Congress sources. text: Five militants have been killed by security forces in an overnight operation in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir. text: A man was gunned down by security personnel when he forcibly entered and vandalised former Jammu and Kashmir CM Farooq Abdullah's residence in Jammu. text: The family of a man in Uttar Pradesh's Agra has alleged he was set on fire by two men after he refused to share a packet of gutka with them. text: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams is among nine astronauts named by NASA for its first spaceflight programme using US-made commercial spacecraft developed by SpaceX and Boeing. text: The Supreme Court will have three serving women judges for the first time, after the Centre cleared the elevation of Madras High Court Chief Justice Indira Banerjee. text: Michael Angelow, a merchant seaman, ran naked on to the pitch at Lord's during an England-Australia Test on August 4, 1975 to honour a ÃÂ£20-bet. text: A 29-year-old Australian climber trapped for nearly a week on New Zealand's Mount Aspiring was rescued on Friday. text: Pakistan's National Accountability Bureau has summoned PTI chief Imran Khan in an ongoing inquiry over alleged misuse of government helicopters. text: The government wants 22.5% reservation for SC and ST candidates in promotion in government jobs, Attorney General KK Venugopal told the Supreme Court on Friday. Venugopal also added that excluding the 'creamy layer', comprising relatively forward members of OBCs, from promotion was a "hindrance". In 2006, the Court had ruled reservation in promotion of government servants was not mandatory.
summary: सरकार नौकरियों में पदोन्नति के लिए SC / ST आरक्षण चाहती है: Govt to SC

text: Actor Anil Kapoor, while talking about working with his daughter Sonam Kapoor in the film 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha Toh Aisa Laga', said, "It's difficult to work with your own blood." He also revealed Sonam asked her why he "looked so relieved" after finishing the film's shooting. "Having your daughter in the same profession is very difficult," Anil further said.

text: A fan dressed as North Korean leader Kim Jong-un with a 'nuclear missile' toy in his hands was spotted in the crowd during the first England-India Test's third day on Friday. The man was surrounded with 'security men' wearing suits. He was also seen shaking hands with another spectator who was wearing a mask of US President Donald Trump.

text: After stepping aside to undergo a kidney transplant, Arun Jaitley is expected to resume work as Finance Minister at the end of August following a three-month break, reports said. Jaitley's office at the Finance Ministry was reportedly renovated and sanitized ahead of his return. Railways Minister Piyush Goyal was appointed acting Finance Minister in Jaitley's absence.

text: The GST Council is reportedly planning to consider a proposal seeking a Central GST exemption for small businesses with annual sales under Ã¢ÂÂ¹1.5 crore. However, they will have to continue paying State GST. Notably, small businesses were exempted from paying excise duty to the Centre under the indirect tax system before the GST regime was implemented.

text: The External Affairs Ministry has told the Parliament that it has asked the United Kingdom to extradite fugitive billionaire jeweller Nirav Modi, main accused in the $2-billion PNB scam. However, it did not specify how it knew Nirav Modi was in the United Kingdom. The international police agency Interpol last month issued a request to find and arrest Nirav Modi.

text: Haryana Police on Thursday arrested two of the eight men booked for allegedly raping a pregnant goat on July 25 at a village in Nuh district of the state. The accused are truck-drivers in their early twenties and alleged history-sheeters. Villagers had beaten up three of the eight accused after the owner of the goat caught them in the act.

text: Claiming that it never received Antigua's request on PNB scam accused Mehul Choksi's citizenship, Indian markets regulator SEBI has clarified that it did not give its clearance. This comes after the island nation claimed that it asked SEBI about two cases involving Choksi and that SEBI said one was "satisfactorily closed" and there wasn't enough evidence to pursue the other.
summary: मेहुल चोकसी की एंटीगुआ नागरिकता के लिए मंजूरी नहीं दी: SEBI

text: Emmerson Mnangagwa has been re-elected Zimbabwe's President after winning presidential elections held for the first time since the ouster of Robert Mugabe. Mnangagwa took over as President last year after Mugabe was ousted by the Army. Mugabe ruled over Zimbabwe for 37 years, having been one of the world's longest-serving leaders.

text: Russia is allowing thousands of North Korean workers to enter the country and giving them new work permits in potential violation of UN sanctions, according to reports. Over 10,000 new North Korean workers have registered in Russia and 700 new work permits have been issued since the UN imposed the ban last year, reports quoting Russian government records showed.
summary: संयुक्त राष्ट्र प्रतिबंध के बावजूद रूस ने एन कोरियाई लोगों को वर्क परमिट दिया: रिपोर्ट

text: The script of Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Super 30', a biopic on mathematician Anand Kumar, will be changed following accusations against Anand, as per reports. The coaching institute Super 30's former students have accused its founder Anand of lying about its success to gain popularity. The film will now reportedly showcase Anand as "the man who takes on the system".
summary: आनंद के खिलाफ पोस्ट के दावों को बदलने के लिए सुपर 30 स्क्रिप्ट: रिपोर्ट

text: Malayalam actor Dulquer Salmaan, while talking about co-star Irrfan Khan, has said he was "completely awestruck" by Irrfan and that he is a "huge fanboy". text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has said he rates his 149-run knock at Edgbaston second only to his 141-run knock at Adelaide in 2014. "Adelaide (knock)...remains very special...because it was second innings, and we were chasing a target," Kohli added. Further, talking about his first-ever Test century in England, Kohli said it was a "test of physical and mental strength".

text: Following Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli's 149-run knock against England in the first Test, former Australian captain Steve Waugh called Kohli a "global superstar" and an "ultimate competitor". Waugh further said that the 29-year-old Indian "will break all records in world cricket". With the ton, Kohli joined Waugh to record 15 Test tons as captain.

text: After India captain Virat Kohli smashed 149(225), his first-ever Test century in England, all-rounder Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Don't think after this knock (Kohli) needs to prove anything to anyone on his journey to greatness." Before his hundred, Kohli had scored just 134 runs in 10 Test innings in England, with his previous highest score in the country being 39.

text: Ex-world number one tennis player Andy Murray broke down after winning his Washington Open last 16 match against Marius Copil at 3.01 am local time today. The world number 832, competing in only his third tournament after prolonged injury problems, cried into his towel for several minutes. "Finishing matches at three in...morning isn't good," Murray said criticising the scheduling.

text: Italian football club Sampdoria used the monochrome graphical style used by their rivals Juventus to unveil five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo, to announce the signing of midfielder Ronaldo Vieira. "BREAKING: #Sampdoria sign #Ronaldo!" Sampdoria captioned the post. In the image, 'Vieira' can be seen written in a smaller font, just underneath the world 'Ronaldo'.

text: English spinner Monty Panesar, who last played a first-class match in 2016, has said he has written letters to 18 county teams in order to revive his career. "I'm hoping that one of the county coaches can give me a go...give me a trial," Panesar said. In 2016, the spinner had opened up about his struggles with anxiety and depression.

text: During Parliament's ongoing monsoon session, MoS for Human Resource Development Satya Pal Singh on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that more than 1,500 colleges were set up across the country in the last three years. He added that 150 universities were set up during the same period, of which the highest were in Gujarat at 19 universities.
summary: पिछले 3 वर्षों में 1,500 से अधिक कॉलेज स्थापित: मंत्री

text: A 51-year-old woman has been arrested for allegedly tearing two pages from the Guru Granth Sahib at a gurudwara in a village in Patiala. The woman tore pages 674 and 675 of the holy book and kept it in her bag. She was discovered when the gurudwara granthi noticed the missing pages and raised an alarm.

text: IIT Delhi professor AK Gosain has submitted a drainage plan to the Delhi government which can help prevent the city from waterlogging. "Complete desilting of storm drains is very important to prevent massive waterlogging," he said. Gosain added that rainwater harvesting at certain parts in parks could also be effective in reducing waterlogging.

text: A 35-year-old woman was arrested by Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Thursday for attempting to smuggle drugs, reportedly worth over Ã¢ÂÂ¹1.2 crore, in noodle packets. text: Michelle, a student of Class 3 was invited to visit DMK President M Karunanidhi, who's currently admitted in Chennai's Kauvery hospital, after she e-mailed a message for him to DMK. "When you are sick, I cried. I'm praying for you very much," she wrote in the note. The 94-year-old leader was hospitalised after his blood pressure dropped last week.

text: Contradicting her father US President Donald Trump's views, Ivanka Trump has said that the media is not the enemy of the people. "I've certainly received my fair share of reporting on me personally that I know not to be fully accurate...but I don't consider the media the enemy," she added. Ivanka is a senior advisor to the US President.

text: Marie Laguerre, who was attacked by her harasser in France has set up an online forum called 'Nous Toutes Harcelement' for others to share their experiences of harassment. The 22-year-old was punched in the face by her harasser after she responded to lewd comments he made at her. Notably, France outlawed sexual harassment on the street earlier this week.

text: After reports claimed that an Aadhaar helpline number was auto-stored on Android phones, Aadhaar's governing body UIDAI said the number was "invalid" and it did not ask any manufacturer or telecom provider to add it. Users shared some screenshots showing the number 1800-300-1947 auto-saved in Android phones under UIDAI's name, without their consent. UIDAI clarified their helpline number is 1947.

text: The Caribbean nation of Antigua and Barbuda has clarified that it has granted citizenship to the $2-billion PNB scam accused Mehul Choksi only after getting a police clearance certificate. Indian markets regulator SEBI and the External Affairs Ministry certified that there was no adverse information against Mehul Choksi, it added. Antigua had granted Choksi citizenship in November 2017.

text: Filmmaker JP Dutta, when asked about actor Abhishek Bachchan's sudden exit from his directorial 'Paltan', said, "Please talk to the Bachchans." "I don't know what exactly happened and what went wrong," he added. Bachchan, who had made his acting debut with Dutta's 'Refugee', also starred in his films 'LOC Kargil' and 'Umrao Jaan'.

text: After his film 'Mulk' was banned in Pakistan, director Anubhav Sinha has penned an open letter in which he has urged Pakistan's citizens to watch the film "illegally". "Please...give me your opinion [on] why...the Pakistan censor board [banned] the film," he added. Sinha further questioned why people don't watch a film that talks about the co-existence of Hindus and Muslims.

text: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Anil Kapoor and Rajkummar Rao starrer 'Fanney Khan', which released today, is a "slice-of-life film," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). "'Fanney Khan' taps to the fullest the...emotions inherent in the father-daughter relationship," said NDTV. Firstpost called the film a "comedy bogged down by melodrama". text: 'Bharat' director Ali Abbas Zafar, while talking about Priyanka Chopra quitting his film, said, "I'm... happy for Priyanka wherever she's in life right now professionally and personally." text: Assam Governor Jagdish Mukhi has called for updating the National Register of Citizens (NRC) in every state, stating that the Centre has the right to know about every foreigner living in the country. He further suggested that the citizen list should be updated with every census, arguing that it will ensure a foolproof system of security in India.
summary: असम के राज्यपाल हर राज्य में NRC को अपडेट करने के लिए कहते हैं

text: India captain Virat Kohli has scored more runs in one innings in the ongoing Test series in England than the entire five-match Test series in 2014. text: Speaking about Assam National Register of Citizens (NRC) draft in Rajya Sabha, Home Minister Rajnath Singh said that attempts to create an atmosphere of fear around it are condemnable. He added, "It's a draft and not final, everyone will get a chance to appeal. Unwarranted accusations are unfortunate." Over 40 lakh names have been excluded from the NRC draft.

text: Glenn Jacobs, best-known as WWE wrestler Kane, has been elected the Mayor of the Knox County in the US state of Tennessee. The former WWE World champion was running for the mayoral seat as a Republican and reportedly secured over 66% of the total votes. He will assume his responsibilities as the Mayor on September 1.
summary: पूर्व WWE चैंपियन केन ने यूएस 'नॉक्स काउंटी का मेयर चुना

text: Leaving Paytm and Google Tez behind, PhonePe has claimed the top spot on the UPI (Unified Payments Interface) network. The Flipkart-owned company, which works with Yes Bank for UPI, reached almost 95 million monthly transactions in July after Paytm claimed to process 94 million transactions in June. Catering over 300,000 merchants, PhonePe further claimed 40% share of the market.
summary: PhonePe ने 95 मिलियन UPI लेनदेन के साथ पेटीएम को मात देने का दावा किया है

text: American researchers have found that high-intensity earthquakes can trigger tremors on the opposite side of the globe, most likely within a three-day window. The Oregon State University study investigated after-effects of earthquakes of magnitude 6.5 or larger from 1973-2016. For instance, a figure showed a magnitude 8.8 earthquake in Chile in 2010, which was followed by 10 events in Asia.

text: Around 50 youths have left their jobs in Saudi Arabia and returned home to Kashmir's Salani village to join the Army and police in order to avenge the killing of their fellow villager, rifleman Aurangzeb. The 24-year-old jawan was en route home to celebrate Eid when he was kidnapped and later shot dead by militants in June.
summary: जवान की मौत का बदला लेने के लिए सेना में शामिल होने के लिए 50 लोग खाड़ी से लौटे

text: The Indian government will file an appeal at the High Court after an international tribunal rejected public sector oil company ONGC's $1.55-billion claims against Reliance Industries, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said. The tribunal had held that Reliance didn't need to seek prior permission from the government to extract natural gas that had migrated from an adjoining ONGC field.
summary: $ 1.55-bn रिलायंस-ओएनजीसी विवाद पर शासन को स्थानांतरित करने के लिए सरकार

text: Vaibhav Khurana, a 22-year-old B.Tech graduate from Delhi, was arrested after he duped a delivery boy of a Rado watch worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹90,000 he had ordered for his girlfriend. Khurana asked the delivery boy to meet him outside a metro station and then took him to his alleged house. Khurana ran away with the parcel while the boy rang the bell.

text: The Centre on Friday informed the Supreme Court that it was withdrawing its proposal to create a social media hub for tracking online content and will completely review its policy on the issue. Earlier, the SC asked the Centre if the proposal was aimed at tracking people's WhatsApp messages and observed that it would be like creating a "surveillance state".
summary: SC द्वारा नारा दिए जाने के बाद सरकार ने सोशल मीडिया हब की योजना बनाई

text: Chinese authorities broke into the house of retired dissident professor Sun Wenguang and arrested him while he was criticising the government during a live TV interview. Wenguang had written an open letter to President Xi Jinping last month that criticised China's policies in Africa. Wenguang had also supported late dissident Liu Xiaobo's manifesto that called for democratic reforms in China.

text: Richa Chadha, who will be seen portraying South Indian adult film actress Shakeela in an upcoming biopic on her, will be visiting Shakeela's ancestral home, as per reports. text: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan has revealed that she lived her college days just like any other ordinary teenager, adding, "I have done the bus and the train, everything, as a college kid." "I have done the [Mumbai local] trains. I know exactly what it gets like at Dadar station...The rainy season's not the easiest at all on public transport," she added.

text: Actor John Abraham, while speaking about the growing threat towards women in India, said, "We're one of the few countries where we disrobe a woman by just looking at her." "It's sad and getting worse. I'm scared, and this makes me question the society and the country I live in," he added.
summary: भारत में, हम किसी महिला को सिर्फ उसकी ओर देखते हुए उसे त्यागते हैं: जॉन

I said NO." The 36-year-old had sustained the injury in April 2017 and couldn't play for Manchester United until November 2017. IbrahimoviÃÂ joined Galaxy in March and has scored 15 goals.

text: Ex-Formula One world champion Niki Lauda underwent a successful lung transplant in Vienna, the Austrian capital's general hospital said on Thursday. The 69-year-old had cut short his holiday in Ibiza last week after developing a lung infection. Lauda, who had suffered serious burns in a near-fatal crash at German Grand Prix in 1976, won three championships (1975, 1977 and 1984).

text: During Parliament's monsoon session in Lok Sabha, senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Friday alleged that government pressure was behind the recent resignation of a managing editor and an anchor from a TV news channel. He added that they were forced to quit after running news critical of the government. He said the Centre was trying to suppress the media.
summary: टीवी चैनल पत्रिकाओं के इस्तीफे के पीछे सरकार का दबाव: कांग

text: Talking about the Muzaffarpur shelter home rape case, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said that he's ashamed of the incident. He added, "No leniency will be shown towards anyone, all those found guilty will be severely punished." At least 34 girls were raped at the state-funded shelter home. A CBI probe has been ordered into the case.nnn

text: Janata Dal (United) MLA Bima Bharti's son was found dead near a railway track in Patna on Friday. The police said the body was found with injury marks and a post-mortem is being conducted. Reports suggest that he met his friends on Thursday night and two of them have been taken into police custody for interrogation.
summary: पटना में रेलवे ट्रैक के पास जदयू विधायक के बेटे की लाश मिली

text: Pakistani Opposition parties will field their own PM candidate, challenging Imran Khan whose PTI emerged as the single-largest party in the elections. While PTI has secured 116 seats in the lower house, the anti-PTI alliance including Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz and Pakistan Peoples Party has won over 120 seats combined. A majority of 137 seats is needed to form the government.
summary: इमरान खान को अपने ही पीएम उम्मीदवार से चुनौती देने के लिए पाकिस्तान ने किया विरोध

text: Indian carrier Jet Airways has reportedly written to its staff saying the company might have to close operations within 60 days if it doesn't implement cost-cutting measures. It added that more employees might have to face pay cuts and job losses. It had recently cut salaries of employees by up to 25%, as part of "cost rationalisation measures".
summary: स्टाफ को 60 दिनों में बंद करना पड़ सकता है जेट एयरवेज: रिपोर्ट

text: In 1997, ousted CEO Steve Jobs returned to Apple and saved it from near bankruptcy by bringing in a $150-million investment from rival Bill Gates-led Microsoft. Mac got Microsoft Office support in exchange for making Internet Explorer its default browser. Jobs then famously said, "We've to let go of this notion that for Apple to win, Microsoft has to lose."
summary: Microsoft ने एक बार $ 150 मिलियन के पास दिवालिया हुए Apple में निवेश किया था

text: Irrfan Khan starrer 'Karwaan', which released today, "has very little [faults]," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). The film "leaves you with a warm fuzzy feeling in the heart," said The Times of India (TOI). The Indian Express wrote, "'Karwaan' is aiming for an...offhand charm." It has been rated 4/5 (HT), 3.5/5 (TOI) and 2/5 (The Indian Express).
summary: इरफान खान अभिनीत फिल्म 'करवाण' सिनेमाघरों में हिट रही

text: Vijay Gutte, director of Anupam Kher's 'The Accidental Prime Minister', has been arrested by the Directorate General of Goods and Services Tax Intelligence (DGGSTI) for alleged Goods and Services Tax (GST) fraud of Ã¢ÂÂ¹34 crore. He has been accused of "wrongful availment" of input tax credit using bills and invoices. Gutte has been sent to judicial custody till August 14.
summary: बॉलीवुड डायरेक्टर को ¢ .34 करोड़ की GST धोखाधड़ी के लिए गिरफ्तार

text: Responding to criticism over Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan's Vogue photoshoot wherein social media users commented that a child should not be sexualised, photographer Errikos Andreou said, "[She] is not a child. The sexiness...was natural." "[She is a] young woman who celebrates both her youth and her womanhood. She was just having fun entering her adulthood," he added.
summary: SRK की बेटी नहीं, एक बच्चा है, उसकी कामुकता स्वाभाविक है: फोटोग्राफर

text: Rishi Kapoor and Taapsee Pannu starrer 'Mulk', which released today, "is a hard-hitting...saga that...talks about...burning issues of our country," wrote Bollywood Hungama. 'Mulk' "throws light on how people fall prey to political agendas," said The Times of India (TOI). NDTV called Rishi and Taapsee's performances "outstanding". It has been rated 3.5/5 (Bollywood Hungama, TOI) and 4/5 (NDTV).
summary: ऋषि कपूर, तापसी पन्नू स्टारर 'मुल्क' सिनेमाघरों में हिट हुई

text: Responding to allegations that IIFA's video tribute to Sridevi has been plagiarised, Sridevi's husband Boney Kapoor said, "The clips... are owned by me or Yash Raj Films." "[We've the right] to use them as we like," he added. Earlier, a woman named Saba Arif alleged the tribute video used clips from a video which Saba made and uploaded on YouTube.
summary: IIFA में श्रीदेवी को दी गई श्रद्धांजलि, मेरे पास नहीं है क्लिप: बोनी

text: A video showing Trinamool Congress MLA Mahua Moitra shouting and pushing a female constable as the policewoman pleaded with folded hands at Assam's Silchar Airport has surfaced. The altercation took place as the TMC lawmakers protested their detention at the airport. The delegation was visiting Assam to review the situation in wake of the Assam NRC's final draft.
summary: वीडियो: एयरपोर्ट पर हिरासत में लेने के बाद TMC विधायक ने पुलिस को किया घेरा

text: After Apple crossed the $1-trillion market capitalization on Thursday, CEO Tim Cook wrote to 120,000 employees, saying that it was "significant milestone...to be proud of" but should not be the company's focus. Cook added that "financial returns are simply the result of Apple's innovation and values" while the $1-trillion valuation was "not the most important measure" of the company's success.
summary: $ 1-ट्रिलियन वैल्यूएशन एक मील का पत्थर है लेकिन फोकस नहीं: ऐप्पल के सीईओ

text: Started in the garage of late co-founder Steve Jobs in 1976, Apple became the first US company to hit a $1-trillion valuation on Thursday. Jobs sold his Volkswagen minibus while co-founder Steve Wozniak sold his HP-65 calculator to collect funds for the first Apple computer. Apple share prices have gone 11-fold since Jobs unveiled the first iPhone in 2007.
summary: Apple की शुरुआत गैराज से हुई थी, जो अब एक ट्रिलियन-डॉलर की विशालकाय कंपनी है

text: A white-coloured statue of Mahatma Gandhi has been painted saffron in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur. The local Congress leaders alleged the BJP and RSS workers were behind the incident and demanded that the 20-year-old statue be painted back to its original colour. "We are investigating the matter, proper action will be taken," Additional District Magistrate Bacchu Singh said.
summary: महात्मा गांधी की प्रतिमा उत्तर प्रदेश में केसरिया रंग की

text: Police have recovered condoms, sex-stimulating medicines and liquor bottles from a shelter home in Bihar while probing the disappearance of its 11 inmates. The shelter home is run by Brajesh Thakur, accused owner of Muzaffarpur shelter home where 34 inmates were raped. Reports said the seized items raised suspicion that inmates at this home were also subjected to sexual abuse.
summary: बिहार रेप केस के आरोपियों द्वारा चलाए जा रहे शेल्टर होम में पाए गए कंडोम

text: The Centre has reportedly approved the Supreme Court Collegium's suggestion to elevate Uttarakhand Chief Justice KM Joseph as SC judge. The Centre had earlier sent back Joseph's name to the Collegium for reconsideration citing unequal representation from other states. The Collegium later reiterated its suggestion and agreed to consider appointments of judges from high courts not represented in SC.
summary: केंद्र ने केएम जोसेफ के उत्थान को SC जज के रूप में मंजूरी दी: रिपोर्ट

text: An eight-month pregnant woman was allegedly gangraped by eight men in Maharashtra while her husband was thrashed and locked up in a vehicle. The victims were looking for a couple to work for their hotel business when one of the accused approached them with prospective candidates. He called them for a meeting with the candidates following which they were attacked.
summary: 8 महीने की गर्भवती महिला ने महाराष्ट्र में 8 पुरुषों से गैंगरेप किया

text: Gurugram Police has arrested three men, including a barber, after a Muslim youth alleged his beard was forcefully shaved and he was called 'Pakistani'. The youth had gone to a barber's shop reportedly for a haircut when he got into an altercation with two accused. The men pinned him to a chair and forced the barber to shave his beard.
summary: 3 को दाढ़ी काटने के लिए मजबूर करने के लिए आयोजित किया गया, उसे पाकिस्तानी कहा गया

text: Tens of thousands of students in Bangladesh have been protesting for the sixth day after two teenagers were killed by a speeding bus. Bangladesh's education ministry shut down high schools across the country due to the demonstrations mostly by students in their mid-teens. Students chanted "we want justice" and checked people's driver's licences, demanding reforms in road safety.
summary: बांग्लादेश में मास स्टूडेंट ने 2 किशोरियों को मार डाला

text: A federal jury in US' California has awarded Canadian patent licensing company WiLan $145.1 million (nearly Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,000 crore) in damages against Apple for patent infringement. The jury determined that Apple infringed two WiLan patents relating to wireless communications technology. Notably, Apple won a separate litigation in 2013 in which WiLan had sought $248 million in damages.
summary: Apple ने पेटेंट उल्लंघन मामले में asked to to 1,000 करोड़ का भुगतान करने को कहा

text: The first look of actors Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon from their upcoming film 'Luka Chuppi' has been released. Kartik will reportedly play the role of a reporter of a TV channel, while Kriti will be seen playing his love interest. The film, which will be directed by Laxman Utekar, has been described as a 'desi romantic comedy'.
summary: कार्तिक आर्यन का पहला लुक, लूका चुप्पी से कृति सनोन

text: BITSians' Day is celebrated on the first Friday of August every year by the alumni and students of BITS Pilani at multiple locations all over the world. This year will be the annual event's sixth edition, to be held on August 3 at 100 locations across the globe including maiden celebrations in Chile, South Africa, Russia, Oman, and Saudi Arabia.
summary: BITS पिलानी 3 अगस्त को दुनिया भर में BITSians दिवस मनाता है

text: After two more FIRs were filed against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee in Assam for her alleged "instigating" remarks, she said, "I am not scared...They can lodge millions of FIRs against me, I don't care." She added, "They have done such a great thing. I am sitting here in West Bengal. What will the FIRs against me in Assam do?"
summary: ममता बनर्जी के खिलाफ दो और एफआईआर, वह कहती हैं 'डर नहीं'

text: Slamming BJP leader BS Yeddyurappa for allegedly trying to create unrest through "malicious propaganda", former Karnataka CM HD Deve Gowda said a separate north Karnataka will not happen "during my lifetime and...my son's lifetime." His statement came amid a committee, which is fighting for separate statehood to north Karnataka, called a day-long bandh in 13 districts.
summary: मेरे जीवनकाल के दौरान अलग नहीं होने वाला उत्तर कोटक: गौड़ा

text: Southeast Asia's ride-hailing major Grab's Co-founder Hooi Ling Tan has said, "I hate the concept of getting stuck in traffic and I also get motion sick." Talking about the future of transportation, she also said, "A pipe dream of mine is teleportation". Further, when asked if she was working on the technology, Ling Tan added, "I wish."
summary: मुझे ट्रैफ़िक में फंसने की अवधारणा से नफरत है: सह-संस्थापक को पकड़ो

text: At least two students died and five were injured after a roof collapsed when they were practising karate at a private school in Hyderabad. All the injured students were shifted to a hospital and are undergoing treatment. Police said they have filed a case of negligence against the school and are probing if it had a safety certificate.
summary: स्कूल में कराटे क्लास के दौरान छत गिरने से 2 बच्चों की मौत

text: Seventeen opposition parties plan to ask the Election Commission to use ballot paper to conduct the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. "This is a matter on which all opposition parties agreed. We are planning to meet next week," Trinamool Congress leader Derek O'Brien said. Further, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee also urged opposition leaders to approach the EC over the matter.
summary: 17 विपक्षी दलों ने 2019 के चुनावों में बैलेट पेपर के लिए चुनाव आयोग से पूछा

text: Apple on Thursday became the US history's first company with $1 trillion market valuation, making it roughly worth two times of Facebook, seven times of Netflix and 42 times of Twitter. Apple's valuation is on par with Indonesia's GDP, the 16th-largest economy in the world. Apple was on the verge of bankruptcy in 1997 when its stock traded below $1.
summary: Apple अब 2 Facebook, 7 Netflixes या 42 Twitters के लायक है

text: PhonePe, India's leading digital payments app announces the Freedom Sale. Users can avail exciting cashback on bus, hotel & cab bookings from 3rd - 5th August on the PhonePe app. Users can also get 100% cashback on Redbus and Ola bookings, up to 50% discount on Goibibo hotel bookings. Also, one lucky winner gets flat 100% cashback every hour.
summary: PhonePe ऐप यात्रा श्रेणी के लिए स्वतंत्रता बिक्री की घोषणा करता है

text: An 18-year-old US girl was left critically injured with a fractured skull after she attempted the viral Kiki Challenge. She recently said that the last thing she remembered was opening the car's door. She was taken to a hospital after the accident, with a fractured skull, blood clots in her ears and bleeding in her brain.
summary: किकी चैलेंज का प्रयास अमेरिकी किशोर को खंडित खोपड़ी के साथ छोड़ देता है

text: In a first, a study led by Carnegie Mellon University has shown that a 12-year-old boy regained brain functionality after a third of his brain's right hemisphere was removed to control seizures. During three years of brain imaging tests, it was found that despite the inability to see from the left, his brain's left hemisphere eventually compensated for visual tasks.
summary: मस्तिष्क के एक-छठे हिस्से को हटाने के बाद 12-वर्षीय लड़का ठीक हो जाता है

text: The victim in the Kerala rape case retracted her statement during trial, saying she had consensual sex with the church priest whom she earlier accused of rape. She further added she was not a minor at the time of intercourse, and wanted to marry the priest. Her mother also changed her statement, and the court declared both of them hostile.
summary: पुजारी के साथ सहमति से किया गया यौन संबंध: केरल बलात्कार पीड़िता का बयान

text: Actress Sonali Bendre's husband Goldie Behl, while speaking about Sonali's health condition, said, "She is stable and following her treatment without any complications." "This is a long journey but we have begun positively," he added. Sonali, who revealed last month that she has been diagnosed with cancer, is currently undergoing treatment in New York.
summary: सोनाली स्थिर, कैंसर के उपचार में कोई जटिलता नहीं: पति

text: Blockchain knowledge company Dunya Labs is co-hosting IBC Hack, a 36-hour hackathon in Hyderabad on August 3 and 4, as part of its mission to build the blockchain ecosystem in India. Participants will build decentralized applications from scratch alongside experts. IBC Hack is part of the International Blockchain Congress, which brings together startups, enterprises and government bodies.
summary: Dunya Labs ने ब्लॉकचेन हैकाथॉन IBC हैक की घोषणा की

text: US consumer technology giant Apple's $1 trillion valuation is on par with the GDP of Indonesia, the 16th-largest economy in the world. Started in the garage of co-founder Steve Jobs in 1976, Apple's revenue has surpassed the economic outputs of countries including Portugal and New Zealand. Apple's stock has surged more than 50,000% since its 1980 initial public offering.
summary: एप्पल का मूल्य इंडोनेशिया की 16 वीं सबसे बड़ी अर्थव्यवस्था जीडीपी के बराबर है

text: Trinamool Congress said the country's situation is "worse than Emergency" after eight party leaders were detained at Silchar Airport in Assam on Thursday for allegedly protesting and creating a ruckus. The six MPs and an MLA have claimed that they were physically assaulted. The TMC team was in Assam to host talks with several Bengali organisations regarding the NRC.
summary: आपातकाल से भी बदतर: टीएमसी ने छह सांसदों को हवाई अड्डे पर 'हमला' किया

text: Police officers have booked 10 professors for allegedly "receiving money" from some engineering students and giving them extra marks during the re-evaluation of answer sheets in Anna University, Chennai. Some of the professors allegedly took Ã¢ÂÂ¹10,000 per student to forge their answer sheets. Of the over three lakh students who applied for re-evaluation, 73,733 passed and 16,636 got higher marks.
summary: नकदी के लिए छात्रों को अतिरिक्त अंक देने के लिए 10 प्रोफेसर बुक किए गए

text: Pakistan on Thursday welcomed PM Narendra Modi's phone call congratulating Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf chief Imran Khan and said it wants to resume bilateral talks with India which were halted in 2015. PM Modi had hoped "Pakistan and India will work to open a new chapter in bilateral ties" during the call. Khan had emphasised that disputes should be resolved through dialogue.
summary: पाकिस्तान का कहना है कि वह भारत के साथ द्विपक्षीय वार्ता फिर से शुरू करना चाहता है

text: Philip N Howard, director of the Oxford Internet Institute has told US lawmakers that Russia is attempting to meddle in the elections of countries like India and Brazil. While testifying before the Senate Intelligence Committee hearing on social media and foreign influence, Howard said the media in these countries needed to "learn and develop" to prevent spreading misinformation.
summary: भारतीय चुनावों में पदक की कोशिश कर रहा रूस: ऑक्सफोर्ड विशेषज्ञ

text: Antiguan authorities have confirmed that Gitanjali Gems promoter Mehul Choksi, one of the main accused in the $2.1 billion PNB scam, is in their country. The communication was received by the CBI in response to their queries on Choksi's whereabouts. Choksi had taken the citizenship of Antigua in November 2017, and an oath of allegiance on January 15 this year.
summary: मेहुल चोकसी एंटीगुआ में है, सीबीआई को पुष्टि मिली

text: Johnny Depp has alleged his ex-wife Amber Heard had 'punched him twice in the face' while they were married, as per reports. He claimed that Amber, who was drunk, physically assaulted him after he arrived two hours late to her 30th birthday party in 2016. Depp added he responded by 'grabbing (her) arms to stop her from punching him again'.
summary: डेप का आरोप है कि पूर्व पत्नी एम्बर ने उसे चेहरे पर घूंसा मारा: रिपोर्ट

text: Team India captain Virat Kohli slammed 149(225) as India managed to register 274 runs in their first innings of the first Test against England on Thursday. England ended the second day of the Test at 9/1 in the second innings, leading the visitors by 22 runs. Off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin dismissed Alastair Cook for the ninth time in his Test career.
summary: कोहली की 149 की मदद से भारत 274 पद पर; इंग्लैंड ने दिन 2 को 9/1 पर समाप्त किया

text: The Indian women's hockey team crashed out of the 2018 Women's Hockey World Cup after losing 1-3 in the penalty shootout to 16th-ranked Ireland in the quarter-finals on Thursday. With this, Ireland, the second-lowest ranked side in the competition, advanced to the semi-finals of World Cup for the first time in history. Ireland will face Spain the semi-finals on Saturday.
summary: अंतिम 8 में शूटआउट हार के बाद भारत महिला हॉकी WC से बाहर

text: Indian all-rounder Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter on Thursday to share a throwback picture of himself, Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag playing chess with Windies' legend Sir Viv Richards. Reacting to the picture, Sachin tweeted, "We're lucky that we were playing chess with Sir Viv and not bowling to him! Great memories." Notably, Richards scored 15,261 runs in international cricket.
summary: लकी हम विव के लिए गेंदबाजी नहीं कर रहे थे: सचिन थ्रोबैक तस्वीर पर

text: Facebook on Thursday announced that it will invest $4.5 million in programs that support news publishers. The company will invest $3.5 million in three-month Facebook Membership Accelerator program to help news companies with membership models. Facebook also said the remaining $1 million will go to NewsMatch campaign, which raises funds for nonprofit newsrooms in the US.
summary: समाचार प्रकाशकों का समर्थन करने के लिए फेसबुक ने $ 4.5 मिलियन का निवेश किया

text: Aerospace company Boeing has delayed its first major test flight for its passenger spacecraft to mid-2019. The delay seems to have likely occurred from an engine failure during a test earlier in June. The crew capsule, known as the CST-100 Starliner, was scheduled to perform two major test flights to the International Space Station (ISS) later this year.
summary: बोइंग देरी 2019 के मध्य तक पहली चालक दल के अंतरिक्ष यान परीक्षण उड़ान

text: Lip-syncing app Musical.ly is being merged with Tik Tok to form a new video app, according to Chinese company ByteDance which owns both the platforms. Musical.ly users will see their app switch to Tik Tok following an update, with their videos and settings intact. Further, the app will alert users if they are active for two hours in one day.
summary: Musical.ly नए वीडियो ऐप बनाने के लिए टिक टोक के साथ विलय करने के लिए

text: Silicon Valley company Zest Labs has sued Walmart for $2 billion, accusing the retail giant of stealing its technology. The lawsuit claims Walmart's "Eden" technology to preserve fruit and vegetable freshness "looks, sounds, and functions" like its own Zest Fresh technology. The company is seeking damages for Walmart's alleged trade secrets' theft, unfair competition, and breach of contract.
summary: कंपनी ने अपनी तकनीक चुराने के लिए $ 2 bn के लिए वॉलमार्ट पर मुकदमा दायर किया

text: As many as 26 cases of near misses were reported over Indian airspace in the first six months of 2018, MoS for Civil Aviation Jayant Sinha said. The number of such incidents was 28 last year and 32 in 2016. To minimise such incidents, a system ensuring flexible use of airspace and safety management was implemented at airports, he added.
summary: 6 महीनों में भारत में रिपोर्ट किए गए 26 मिड-एयर के पास

text: A 44-year-old private tutor was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly raping at least five minor students over two years in Deogarh district, Odisha. The man, who gave private tuitions at his residence, took the girls to a different room on the pretext of giving special classes and sexually abused them there. The students are aged between 8 and 15 years.
summary: 2 साल में 5 नाबालिग छात्रों के साथ बलात्कार के लिए निजी ट्यूटर

text: The German capital of Berlin has become the first city in the country to scrap kindergarten fees. The move is aimed at reducing the burden on working parents and improving the access to education to children from economically weaker backgrounds. However, parents will still have to pay a monthly fees for food and extra-curricular activities.
summary: जर्मन पूंजी बालवाड़ी शुल्क को काटती है

text: China has proposed to conduct military drills with the 10 Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) members in the South China Sea, a draft document has revealed. The document also proposed undertaking joint oil and gas exploration in the sea. China and ASEAN members including Vietnam, the Philippines, Malaysia and Brunei have disputed claims over the sea.
summary: चीन ने प्रस्तावित किया एस चीन सागर आसियान देशों के साथ ड्रिल: रिपोर्ट

text: State-run telecom operator BSNL's loss for the last financial year reduced by just Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 crore to Ã¢ÂÂ¹4,785 crore, Telecom Minister Manoj Sinha informed the parliament. BSNL's expenditure and income both fell by thousands of crores. Since BSNL has incurred losses consecutively for the last three years, it has been declared as 'Incipient Sick' as per government guidelines, the minister added.
summary: बीएसएनएल का वार्षिक घाटा सिर्फ ¢ to1 करोड़ से घटकर ¢ 854,785 करोड़ रह गया

text: Team India captain Virat Kohli smashed his first-ever Test hundred in England and his 22nd overall in Tests, in the first Test on Thursday. The 29-year-old has now slammed 15 Test hundreds as captain, with only former South African captain Graeme Smith (25) and ex-Australia skipper Ricky Ponting (19) scoring more. Overall, Kohli has now scored 57 international hundreds.
summary: विराट कोहली ने इंग्लैंड में अपना पहला टेस्ट शतक जमाया

text: World's most valuable company Apple on Thursday became the first company in the US stock market history to reach $1 trillion market valuation after its stock hit an all-time high of $207.05 per share. This comes after Apple reported its strongest-ever Q3 earnings. Notably, Chinese oil giant PetroChina was the world's first company to hit $1 trillion valuation in 2007.
summary: ऐप्पल ने $ 1 ट्रिलियन वैल्यूएशन, 1 अमेरिकी कंपनी को मार्क मारा

text: Daniel Salvame, an 11-year-old Philippines boy, has been dubbed 'Popeye' after a mystery illness left him with swollen biceps. Daniel noticed swelling on his right upper-arm when he was four. "My friends teased me because I look strange but it does not worry me," said Daniel. Popeye is a cartoon character famous for his spinach-induced biceps.
summary: 11 साल पुराने डब्बी 'पोपी' को बीमारी के बाद उसे बहुत बड़ा लाभ मिलता है

text: A retired couple from Scotland was on Thursday handed a Ã¢ÂÂ¹520-crore cheque for a jackpot they won with a lottery ticket torn into two pieces. Their ticket was mistakenly torn by a local shop assistant who misread the numbers while matching them. The couple then informed the jackpot company which checked the shop's CCTV footage and accepted the couple's win.
summary: दंपति ने दो टुकड़ों में फटे टिकट के साथ lot -520-cr लॉटरी जीती

text: A police complaint has been filed against actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan for "defaming" late CM Jayalalithaa by portraying her as a "dictator" on Bigg Boss' Tamil version. The complaint referred to an incident when a contestant referred to Jayalalithaa's rule as that of a dictator. Haasan, who hosts the show, was accused of using it to further his own political interests.

text: Dwipen Pathak, president of Assam's Trinamool Congress unit, quit the party on Thursday to protest party supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's opposition to the NRC's final draft. "What Mamata Banerjee said about NRC...it has been brought in Assam to drive out Bengalis, I don't agree with that," said Pathak. He said her views may create "disturbance" in Assam.
summary: टीएमसी की असम इकाई के प्रमुख ने एनआरसी पर ममता के रुख पर सवाल उठाए

text: A former Junior Commissioned Officer claimed he and his family haven't been included in the final draft of Assam's National Register of Citizens. Mohammad A Haq, who served in the Indian Army for 30 years, said, "I'm really sad...I served the nation with commitment." Earlier, former President Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed's nephew claimed his family members weren't included in the list.
summary: 30 साल तक सेना में काम करने वाले जवान एनआरसी से बाहर निकल गए

text: Talking about Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf chief and former cricketer Imran Khan's looks, Punjab Minister Navjot Singh Sidhu called him a "Greek God". "We've shared a special relationship since 1983. I had heard that he was a Greek God, but when I first saw him, I felt...if there were parameters to assess looks, he was ahead of a Greek god," said Sidhu.
summary: वह एक ग्रीक देवता से आगे थे: सिद्धू इमरान खान के लुक पर

text: Two Class 4 students in Hyderabad were killed and at least four others were injured after the shed in their school collapsed and they came under the rubble while practising karate. The police said that a case of negligence against the school authorities has been registered. The principal of the school is reportedly on the run.
summary: कराटे वर्ग में शेड गिरने के बाद हैदराबाद के 2 बच्चों की मौत

text: A ransomware attack at Alaska's Matanuska-Susitna town has forced the employees to forego computers and work on typewriters and hand receipts. The ransomware crippled the town's computer infrastructure, including computers, servers, telephones and email exchange. Nearly all of the town's 500 workstations and 120 out of 150 servers were affected.

text: The White House has confirmed that India has invited US President Donald Trump to be the Chief Guest for next year's Republic Day parade. However, no decision on the matter has been taken yet, White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders said. India had reportedly extended the invitation to the US President in April.
summary: अमेरिका ने ट्रम्प को गणतंत्र दिवस के मुख्य अतिथि के रूप में आमंत्रित करने की पुष्टि की

text: The main building of UP's Mughalsarai Junction station, which was recently renamed Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Junction, is being painted saffron ahead of BJP president Amit Shah's visit on Sunday. Signboards carrying the junction's new name will be inaugurated by Shah in the presence of Railway Minister Piyush Goyal and CM Yogi Adityanath.

text: Hanan, a college student from Kerala who sold fish to raise money, walked the ramp to promote Khadi products in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday. She was clad in a designer Khadi Kerala half-saree in the fashion show organised by the state-run Kerala Khadi Board. Hanan was earlier trolled after her story was widely shared on social media.

text: Abbot Xuecheng, China's highest-ranking Buddhist monk has been accused of sexually harassing and assaulting nuns at the Longquan Monastery in Beijing. A report sent to the government accused Xuecheng of forcing nuns into sexual relations by "controlling their minds" and also sending them illicit messages. Both Xuecheng and the temple have denied the allegations.

text: India captain Virat Kohli has become the fastest cricketer to score 7,000 international runs as captain, achieving the feat during the first Test against England at Edgbaston on Thursday. Kohli reached the milestone in his 124th innings as captain, 40 fewer than former Windies captain Brian Lara. Kohli was also the fastest to 4,000, 5,000 and 6,000 runs as captain.

text: After Virat Kohli slammed his first-ever Test hundred in England on Thursday, a user tweeted, "Kabhi kabhi lagta hai Kohli hi bhagwan hai." Other tweets read, "Kohli dropped his bat and his helmet to show off his engagement ring," and "India's future is safe. Kohli is already in 22nd century." "With some lady luck, but what a knock," wrote another.

text: Virat Kohli has gone past his previous highest Test score of 39 in England, achieving the feat during the second day of the first Test at Edgbaston on Thursday. The 29-year-old registered his first-ever Test fifty in England and is unbeaten on 53(102) after the second session. Kohli has hit over 20 runs four times in 11 innings in England.

text: Pacer Mohammad Shami has said his "love for cricket" helped him fight the off-field problems he faced after the South Africa tour in January. text: After England lost a DRS review in the second over of India's innings in the first Test, former England off-spinner Graeme Swann said wicketkeeper-batsman Jonny Bairstow should be banned from taking a call for reviews. "He's like an excitable puppy," Swann added. The former spinner further revealed that Paul Collingwood was once banned from making reviews for wrong suggestions.
summary: बेयरस्टो की तरह आकर्षक पिल्ला: इंग्लैंड के रूप में स्वान समीक्षा खो देते हैं

text: World number 10 Saina Nehwal has become the first woman shuttler to reach Badminton World Championships' quarter-finals for the eighth straight edition. The 28-year-old defeated world number four Ratchanok Intanon 21-16, 21-19 in 47 minutes and will face 2016 Rio Olympics gold medallist Carolina Marin in the next round. summary: नेहवाल पहली महिला हैं जो सीधे वर्ल्ड सी के 8 फाइनल में पहुंचीं

text: Talking about Instagram's Stories feature, the photo-sharing platform's CEO Kevin Systrom said, "I think the mistake everyone made was to think that Stories was a photography product." Adding that the company introduced many interactive features to Stories, Systrom also said, "We've really innovated and made it our own." Notably, Instagram Stories was launched on August 2, 2016.

text: Reddit has revealed a security breach which took place in June in which a hacker broke into its employees' accounts, exposing users' personal data. Further, Reddit said the affected users will receive private messages or emails to notify them of the breach.

text: While hearing a rape case against a priest in a church in Kerala in 2016, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said, "It is disturbing that recently cases of rape are coming from churches in Kerala. text: The Supreme Court today said the penal provision on adultery is apparently violative of Right to Equality under the Constitution as it treats married men and married women differently. However, the court clarified that it will not make adultery an offence for women as well. The law says a man having sexual relations with another man's wife will be jailed.
summary: व्यभिचार के लिए सजा समानता के अधिकार का उल्लंघन करती है: एससी

text: A goat abandoned by her ticketless owner at a Mumbai railway station is being auctioned as per existing rules, authorities said. They named the goat 'Basanti' and said she is "well-behaved" and "loves to lounge on a chair." Although she has been kept at a busy terminus with a placard saying Ã¢ÂÂ¹3,000 for several days, there have been no takers.

text: Chinese President Xi Jinping has ordered the military to stop running kindergartens and other businesses and end commercial activities by the end of the year. President Xi said that the move is aimed at making the Army focus on war preparedness and fighting abilities to make it "a world-class military in all respects".
summary: चीन ने सेना को किंडरगार्टन चलाने से रोकने का आदेश दिया

text: RBI Governor Urjit Patel has said that "we are possibly at the beginning of currency war" in the wake of rising trade tensions. "We've already had a few months of turbulence behind us and it looks like it is likely to continue. For how long, I don't know," Patel said. This comes amid speculation that China may be devaluing yuan.
summary: हम एक वैश्विक मुद्रा युद्ध के कगार पर हैं: RBI गवर्नर

text: India national flag 'Tiranga' was based on a design by freedom fighter Pingali Venkaiah, who was born on August 2, 1876. Venkaiah's design, originally for the Indian National Congress, was unanimously agreed upon in the presence of Mahatma Gandhi in 1921. Venkaiah joined the British Army at the age of 19, meeting Mahatma Gandhi during a war in South Africa.
summary: भारत का राष्ट्रीय ध्वज किसने बनाया?

text: Actress Gul Panag revealed she gave birth to her first child with husband Rishi Attari nearly six months ago. "Becoming parents is a special experience...We decided...we'd like to go through it without...public attention," she said. Gul, who gave birth at the age of 39, further said women should have children when they're ready and not when society wants them to.

text: The trailer of Arjun Rampal, Jackie Shroff and Sonu Sood starrer 'Paltan' has been released. The film is based on the Nathu La military clashes of 1967 which took place on the Sikkim border. Directed by JP Dutta, who is known for directing films like 'Border' and 'LOC Kargil', 'Paltan' is scheduled to release on September 7.
summary: अर्जुन रामपाल, जैकी श्रॉफ अभिनीत फिल्म 'पलटन' का ट्रेलर

text: Amitabh Bachchan, who had suffered a near-fatal injury while shooting for the 1983 film 'Coolie', tweeted, "To them that have sent greetings for my 2nd birthday Aug 2...I send my...thanks." Bachchan, who got injured while shooting for a fight sequence, was reportedly declared 'clinically dead for a few minutes'. He recovered from the injury on August 2, 1982, after treatment.

text: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan has said when she was a child, she wanted her father to be addressed as 'Suhana's dad', but it wasn't the case. "When I was about five, he'd...drop me to school, and people would...stare," she added. Suhana further said, "He'd want to hug me...I'd push him back in the car. I hated the attention."

text: Talking about Virat Kohli's 'mic-drop' celebration after running him out in the first Test on Wednesday, England captain Joe Root said the gesture gives "a bit of humour" to the series. "We'll see how things pan out over...five Tests," Root added. Kohli's celebration was an apparent response to Root who celebrated his hundred in ODI series by dropping his bat.

text: Facebook has started monetising WhatsApp four years after acquiring it in 2014, the social media giant announced on Wednesday. Facebook will begin charging businesses for select WhatsApp Business features and interlinking ads on Facebook to WhatsApp. WhatsApp for business was launched in January this year and has nearly 3 million brands registered to its service.

text: A 48-year-old American had to get all his limbs amputated after he contracted sepsis, a life-threatening blood infection caused by a bacteria found in the saliva of dogs and cats. Capnocytophaga canimorsus can infect people with low immunity via bites, licks, or close proximity to the animal. The patient started experiencing flu-like symptoms including fever, vomiting, and diarrhoea last month.

text: A 102-year-old man named Ramaswamy survived a brain stroke and was discharged from a private hospital within three days of undertaking treatment in Bengaluru. He underwent thrombolysis, a treatment which involves the breakdown of blood clots formed in blood vessels. "Thrombolysis is a very challenging treatment method for seniors," a doctor at the hospital said.
summary: 102-वर्षीय B'luru आदमी स्ट्रोक से बचे, 3 दिनों में छुट्टी दे दी

text: A grade 11 student from Ajmer's Mayo College was allegedly sodomised by six seniors from grade 12 multiple times in July. The seniors allegedly forced him to consume alcohol and drugs, and threatened him of dire consequences if he reported the incident. This continued for several days until he left the school and informed his parents of the matter.
summary: अजमेर के मेयो कॉलेज में 6 सीनियर्स द्वारा छात्र को पीटा गया

text: Goa Agriculture Minister Vijai Sardesai has said that beauty contests can be held in paddy fields to make agriculture as a profession more appealing to youths. Sardesai made the comment while responding to Demands for Grants for agriculture department in the Legislative Assembly on Wednesday. He said all attempts should be made to make agriculture an attractive profession.
summary: धान के खेतों में सौंदर्य प्रतियोगिता आयोजित करें: गोवा के मंत्री

text: ICICI Bank has cautioned investors that ongoing investigations into allegations relating to CEO Chanda Kochhar could adversely impact its ability to do business. It also admitted for the first time that CBI has initiated a preliminary enquiry against various individuals and firms including bank officials. The allegations include nepotism, quid pro quo, and failure to make adequate disclosures.
summary: चंदा कोचर के खिलाफ जांच से कारोबार प्रभावित हो सकता है: ICICI बैंक

text: Sashi Cheliah, a 39-year-old Indian-origin prison officer from Adelaide, has won MasterChef Australia 2018, defeating fellow contestant Ben Borsht and earning a prize money of $250,000. Cheliah got 93 out of 100 points, preparing a sambal prawns starter in the first round which earned him a perfect 30. He made a fish curry in the second to honour his aunt.

text: Reacting to Team India head coach Ravi Shastri napping in the dressing room during the first day of the first England-India Test, a user tweeted, "Coaches should also undergo mini Yo Yo tests." text: French tennis player Benoit Paire has been fined $16,500 (Ã¢ÂÂ¹11.3 lakh) for smashing three racquets during his Washington Open match against Cyprus' Marcos Baghdatis on Tuesday. The world number 55 smashed his racquet after failing to break Baghdatis in last set. He then kicked his chair before smashing another racquet into the ground and smashed the third racquet after losing.

text: Team India opener Shikhar Dhawan on Thursday took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with his wife Aesha and wish her on her birthday. "Wish u a very happy birthday my Love. Have a great one. Thanks for making my life complete. Being d pillar of our family," Shikhar wrote. Shikhar tied the knot with Aesha in 2012.
summary: जीवन पूर्ण बनाने के लिए धन्यवाद: धवन को जन्मदिन पर पत्नी की शुभकामनाएं

text: Southeast Asia's ride-hailing major Grab has raised $2 billion funding at a valuation of around $11 billion. The $2-billion figure includes a $1-billion investment from Toyota announced earlier in June and includes investors like OppenheimerFunds, Ping An Capital, and Mirae Asset, among others. The startup aims to expand its geographic reach and move into services like food delivery and payments.

text: Elon Musk-led Tesla has announced that the electric carmaker aims to produce 10,000 Model 3 cars per week in 2019. The startup further said that the "majority" of its production lines would be ready for that volume by the end of 2018. Tesla has also outlined plans to produce 6,000 Model 3 vehicles per week by late August this year.

text: Online food delivery startup Swiggy has acquired Mumbai-based on-demand delivery platform Scootsy for a reported sum of Ã¢ÂÂ¹50 crore in an all-cash deal. As part of the acquisition, Scootsy will continue to operate as an independent app while its founding team will be retained. Founded in 2015, the startup delivers a wide variety of products including food, electronics, and accessories.

text: Bill Gates-backed startup Apeel Sciences, which uses food waste and plant material to keep fruits and vegetables fresher, has raised $70 million in funding. The Series C round was led by Viking Global Investors with participation from Andreessen Horowitz, Upfront Ventures, and S2G Ventures. As part of the round, former Whole Foods executive Walter Robb has joined the startup's board.

text: The police have seized nearly 400 hides of cows, buffaloes and goats from a warehouse in Alwar, Rajasthan. The police also found 91 remains like bones and intestines of cows and buffaloes from the warehouse. The beef was being transported to areas in Rajasthan, Haryana and other adjoining states, the police said.

text: The Roman Catholic Church has said that it will seek the worldwide abolition of death penalty, changing the previous Catholic teaching that allowed it in rare cases. The previous teaching supported capital punishment "if it's the only way of effectively defending human lives against the unjust aggressor". Pope Francis said that death penalty is inadmissible as it attacks human dignity.

text: The UAE has begun a three-month visa amnesty program which allows illegal foreign workers to legalise their status in the country or return home. Residents overstaying their permits will not be fined if they leave the country voluntarily. The amnesty also grants those seeking employment a six-month visa to find a job.
summary: UAE ने अवैध विदेशी कामगारों के लिए वीजा माफी कार्यक्रम शुरू किया

text: Venezuelan President NicolÃÂ¡s Maduro has admitted that his economic model has "failed", saying that "the responsibility is ours, mine and yours". Adding that "we need to make Venezuela an economic power", Maduro said, "It will take about two years to reach a high level of stability." Earlier, the International Monetary Fund predicted that Venezuela's inflation could top 1,000,000% this year.
summary: वेनेजुएला के राष्ट्रपति मादुरो ने माना कि अर्थव्यवस्था 'विफल' है

text: Syrian Ambassador to India Dr Riad Abbas on Wednesday invited Indian investors and business companies to help the Syrian government in rebuilding the war-torn country. "Syria was able to defeat terrorists...Now we are planning to rebuild Syria and we are looking for help from our friends especially India," Abbas said. He further appreciated India's medical and food assistance to Syria.
summary: सीरिया युद्धग्रस्त राष्ट्र के पुनर्निर्माण में मदद करने के लिए भारतीय फर्मों को आमंत्रित करता है

text: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar is planning to take his clothing line 'True Blue', a joint venture with Arvind Group, to global markets including the US and UK. "Whenever I travel, I am not surprised to see made in India tag in clothes. So why not an Indian brand in those markets?" Tendulkar said. The menswear label was launched in 2016.

text: Fino Payments Bank has been barred by the RBI from adding new customers since the end of May. Earlier, Paytm Payments Bank was reportedly told to stop adding new customers over discrepancies in adherence to KYC norms. An RBI audit revealed that some Fino Payments Bank accounts had deposits in excess of the stipulated amount of Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh.

text: An Indian man working for a multinational company was among the three people kidnapped and killed by militants in the Afghan capital of Kabul on Thursday. The trio included a Malaysian and a Macedonian citizen, and their bodies have been found by the police. They worked for food services company Sodexo in Afghanistan.
summary: अफगानिस्तान में आतंकवादियों द्वारा मारे गए तीन में से भारतीय

text: Actor Aamir Khan has clarified that he won't be going to Pakistan to attend Pakistani cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan's oath-taking ceremony on August 11. He also denied reports which said Imran's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf has invited him to attend the ceremony. Earlier, reports said Imran's party had also invited ex-cricketers Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar for the swearing-in ceremony.

text: An investigation is underway after someone replaced a US flag with a flag of Nazi Germany at a public park in Wyoming. text: The Fields Medal, also known as the 'Nobel for Mathematics', was stolen minutes after it was awarded to Cambridge professor Caucher Birkar in Rio de Janeiro on Wednesday. Birkar reportedly left the medal in a briefcase on a table at the venue, along with his phone and wallet. The briefcase was later found but the medal was missing.
summary: 'नोबेल फॉर मैथेमेटिक्स' मेडल चोरी होने के कुछ ही मिनटों के बाद प्रो

text: A 22-year-old man named Thomas Watson on Tuesday managed to extinguish a fire reportedly started by a cigarette butt by peeing on it, saving the worldÃ¢ÂÂs longest pleasure pier 'Southend Pier' in the UK. "The problem was the wind was pretty strong. After one failed attempt, I kneeled and peed," Watson said. The local council thanked him for his "quick-thinking".

text: Mumbai-based advocate Ramakant Patil has filed a case against the makers of John Abraham starrer 'Satyameva Jayate' for allegedly disrespecting the National Emblem in the film's official trailer. text: Speaking about actresses undergoing plastic surgery, Neha Dhupia said, "You either focus on your job or you focus on the boob job." "Some of the most beautiful women are the ones who haven't gone through [plastic surgery]," she added. Neha further said she isn't one of those actresses who would undergo cosmetic surgery to look a certain way.

text: Addressing reports of Salman Khan being upset with Priyanka Chopra for walking out of his upcoming film 'Bharat', Priyanka's mother Madhu Chopra said, "You people (media) only make such stuff up, Salman isn't upset with her." Talking about the film's producer calling Priyanka "unprofessional", Madhu added that there is "nothing like that" and "everything is good".

text: India captain Virat Kohli appeared to do a mic-drop send-off after producing a direct hit to run out England captain Joe Root during the first Test on Wednesday. It was an apparent response to Root who celebrated his match-winning hundred in the third ODI by dropping his bat. Kohli also blew kisses and put finger to his lips while celebrating.

text: Staff at the Eiffel Tower shut down the Paris landmark on Wednesday in protest over a new access policy, which they say is generating "monstrous" queues for tourists. Eiffel Tower's management has started reserving specific lifts for each type of ticket holder. The tower, which welcomed over six million visitors last year, has been hit by repeated strikes.

text: New Delhi-born Australian mathematician Akshay Venkatesh has won the prestigious Fields Medal, often dubbed the "Nobel prize for mathematics". The 36-year-old completed his PhD aged 20, did post-doctoral research at MIT, and is currently a professor at Stanford University. Venkatesh, one of the four winners, has worked on number theory, geometry, topology, automorphic forms, and ergodic theory.
summary: भारतीय मूल के अक्षय वेंकटेश ने जीता 'गणित का नोबेल'

text: Weeks after 11 family members were found hanging inside their home in Delhi's Burari, four of a family were found buried, stacked over one another, with deep stab wounds, at their Kerala home on Wednesday. The police suspect black magic behind the deaths as one of the family members, a 52-year-old man, was said to have performed such rituals before.
summary: 4 के परिवार को दफनाया गया, केरल में एक दूसरे के ऊपर ढेर किया गया

text: A Special Border Personnel meeting took place in Sikkim's Nathu La on Wednesday between the armies of India and China as part of celebrations to commemorate the 91st anniversary of the foundation of China's People's Liberation Army (PLA). The Indian delegation attended the celebration following an invitation by the PLA. Both the countries took part in cultural events.
summary: भारतीय सेना चीनी सेना के 91 वें स्थापना दिवस में भाग लेती है

text: Saudi Arabia had planned to invade Qatar with the help of the UAE last year, according to a report quoting a US intelligence official and two former US State Department officials. The report stated that former US Secretary of State Rex Tillerson intervened to stop the secret Saudi-led, UAE-backed plan and that he may have been fired for his actions.

text: On August 2, 1934, Adolf Hitler became the FÃÂ¼hrer of Germany after the death of President Paul von Hindenburg. Hitler and the Nazis announced the law that combined the office of the President and Chancellor and members of the armed forces swore personal allegiance to him. Hitler remained the absolute dictator of Germany until his alleged suicide in 1945.

text: Iraqi soldiers invaded Kuwait on August 2, 1990, after the country was unable to repay its debt to Kuwait from the Iraq-Iran war and accused Kuwait of stealing oil from its Rumaila oil field. Kuwait was liberated by February 1991 as most Iraqi forces either surrendered or fled the US-led offensive launched as part of the Operation Desert Storm.

text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries has jumped 55 places to be ranked at 148 on the Fortune Global 500 list of the world's biggest companies by revenue. However, state-owned Indian Oil Corporation is the top-ranked Indian company at 137. Other Indian companies on the list are ONGC, State Bank of India, Tata Motors, Bharat Petroleum and Rajesh Exports.

text: Discussing misconceptions about her portrayal in the media, American actress Jennifer Aniston has said, "With all due respect, IÃ¢ÂÂm not heartbroken." She added, "The misconceptions are 'Jen can't keep a man' and 'Jen refuses to have a baby because she's selfish'... Those are reckless assumptions." Aniston is divorced from Brad Pitt and separated from her second husband Justin Theroux.

text: Unveiling his daughter Suhana's first-ever magazine cover at Vogue Beauty Awards, Shah Rukh Khan said, "I will be proud of her when she is proud of herself and the job that she does." text: Apple's former creative director Ken Segall has said, "Passing of Steve Jobs created a completely different approach to marketing." He also said he "can see the difference between Steve being there, and not being there." Adding that big companies tend to play safer, he also said, "In old days, Apple used to do things that get a lot of attention."

text: Xiaomi has launched a smart dustbin which opens automatically using sensors to detect human hand or other objects within a distance of 0-35 cm. text: Discussing Assam's National Register of Citizens (NRC) draft in a Facebook post, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley wrote that sovereignty and citizenship are the soul of India, not imported vote banks. "Leaders like Rahul Gandhi and Mamata Banerjee must realise that India's sovereignty is not a play thing," he added. Jaitley further wrote that Congress is compromising India's sovereignty.
summary: नागरिकता भारत की आत्मा, आयातित वोट बैंक नहीं: जेटली

text: A sub-inspector was arrested from the very police station he headed in Madhya Pradesh for allegedly raping a 15-year-old girl. The girl's mother said her other daughter had killed herself six months ago, and he was investigating the case. During his visits to their home, he allegedly sexually exploited the girl by threatening to implicate the two in the suicide.

text: A four-year-old boy in Andhra Pradesh's Vijayawada was allegedly killed by a woman as revenge against his father, with whom she had an affair that had become strained. She lured the boy with chocolates before allegedly strangling him. The police, who arrested her, said she was having an illicit affair with the boy's father before he started avoiding her.n
