text: The Delhi Commission for Women has rescued 39 girls who were trafficked from Nepal on the pretext of being offered jobs. DCW chief Swati Maliwal said, "They were being trafficked to Gulf countries. Some girls have already been sent to Sri Lanka." A total of 73 girls who were being trafficked were rescued in Delhi in one week, she added.

text: A tribal couple was allegedly abducted, thrashed and made to drink urine by the woman's family for marrying against their wishes in Alirajpur district, Madhya Pradesh. The couple said they had not expected such treatment as the husband's father had already paid the bride price. Two people have been arrested, and a search for several others is underway.

text: The government on Wednesday appointed industrialists Kumar Mangalam Birla and YC Deveshwar as non-official independent directors in Air India. Birla is the chairman of the $44.3 billion Aditya Birla Group, which operates in 35 countries across six continents. Deveshwar is the chairman of Kolkata-based conglomerate ITC, which has a presence in FMCG sector, hotels and IT among others.

text: Rakesh Srivastava, Director (Sales and Marketing) at Hyundai India, has resigned from his position after being associated with the company for almost six years. He is likely to join BMW India as country head, according to reports. Before Hyundai, Rakesh Srivastava, an alumnus of Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Ahmedabad, worked with Maruti Suzuki India for almost 15 years.
summary: राकेश श्रीवास्तव हुंडई को छोड़ देते हैं, बीएमडब्ल्यू इंडिया के प्रमुख बन सकते हैं

text: Billionaire Anand Mahindra has tweeted a video showing the kiosk his team in Mumbai designed for 'shoe doctor' Narsi Ram from Haryana. Mahindra said the kiosk will be delivered soon to Narsi Ram, who advertised his shop as a "hospital for injured shoes". "This man should be teaching marketing at the Indian Institute of Management," Mahindra had tweeted in April.

text: Apple in its Q3 earnings on Tuesday revealed having $243.7 billion in cash, which is more than the combined market value of India's two largest companies, TCS and Reliance Industries. The two companies are the only Indian companies with a market valuation of over $100 billion. Apple's cash reserve is also more than twice the valuation of both the companies.
summary: Apple के पास TCS, Reliance के संयुक्त बाजार मूल्य से अधिक नकदी है

text: Nine needles were removed from the throat of a 14-year-old girl at a government-run hospital in West Bengal after a four-hour surgery. Doctors found one needle at the back of the girl's throat and eight near the food pipe after an x-ray. Hospital authorities said the needles were not swallowed by the girl, but inserted from outside "for some ritual".

text: A former waitress who stole money from a Mexican restaurant in the US 20 years ago, recently sent $1,000 and an apology letter to the restaurant's owner. "Please accept my apology + this money as a repayment + 20 years of interest," the letter read. The restaurant's owner said the letter deeply moved her and her employees.
summary: पूर्व-वेट्रेस ने भोजनालय को $ 1,000 भेजा, जिसे उसने 20 साल पहले नकद चुराया था

text: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana has admitted that getting trolled online does affect her. "People feel like they can judge you. They don't know you... but they're just talking. text: Preity Zinta's ex-boyfriend Ness Wadia has asked the actress through his counsel to "bury the hatchet" in a molestation case filed by her against him. Wadia's counsel argued that the complainant is married and has "moved on", and the two "even sit at the same table during the IPL auction". Preity alleged Wadia had grabbed her arm during IPL 2014.

text: Talking about his daughter Suhana's first solo magazine cover for Vogue, Shah Rukh Khan said it should not be taken as an entitlement. "I hope it's not taken as entitled just because she happens to be Shah Rukh Khan's daughter. I hope it's taken as a responsibility that she has if she's being given a platform like this," he said.

text: 'Despicable Me' series' co-director Pierre Coffin, who also voices the characters Minions, has said that he stole the menu of an Indian restaurant he visits and included names of dishes in the language used by Minions. "Like 'Punjabi' or 'Chicken Korma'... just put that in...it feels like a nonsensical word, but people (in India) would recognise these words," added Pierre.

text: A new footbridge which appears to be supported by two hand-shaped concrete has recently opened near Da Nang in Vietnam. Cau Vang (golden bridge), is 150 metres long and 1,400 metres above sea level. The bridge was designed to evoke the image of the "giant hands of Gods, pulling a strip of gold out of the land," said an official.

text: Punjab Cabinet Minister Navjot Singh Sidhu has accepted Pakistan's Prime Minister-in-waiting Imran Khan's invitation to the oath-taking ceremony on August 11. "Khan Sahab is a man of character. He can be trusted. Sportsmen build bridges, break barriers, unite people," Sidhu said. Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) has also invited former cricketers Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev to the ceremony.
summary: नवजोत सिंह सिद्धू इमरान खान के शपथ समारोह में आमंत्रित करते हैं

text: Following her meeting with Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said Opposition parties will unite in the 2019 elections to defeat the BJP. "We discussed current politics and the possibility of all of us contesting elections together in future... Our priority is to defeat the BJP. There will be a collective leadership," she added.
summary: 2019 में एकजुट होगा विपक्ष: सोनिया, राहुल से मिलने के बाद ममता

text: National Herald, a Congress mouthpiece, has published the results of a pre-poll survey conducted in Madhya Pradesh, according to which PM Narendra Modi was voted as the most attractive leader with 41% support. Congress President Rahul Gandhi was ranked second with 9.72% support. Further, 46% respondents said they're satisfied with the central government led by BJP under PM Modi.
summary: पीएम मोदी सबसे आकर्षक नेता: कांग ने मुखपत्र द्वारा साझा किया

text: The three-year-old girl who fell into a 110-feet-deep borewell while playing outside her grandfather's house in Bihar's Munger has been rescued after over 30 hours. She's reportedly safe and has been sent to the hospital for medical check-up. The rescue team used rods to prevent her from slipping further down and oxygen pipe was lowered to ensure fresh air supply.n
summary: बोरवेल में गिरी 3 साल की बिहार की लड़की को 30 बजे के बाद बचाया गया

text: Fourteen Buddhist nuns, who specialise in Kung Fu, gave self-defence training to girls in Ladakh as part of a six-day workshop. At least 40 girls, in the age group of 12 to 20, participated in the event and learned techniques to protect themselves. "While learning Kung Fu, my confidence level has increased," said one of the girls who participated.

text: The three Armed Forces face a shortage of 9,096 officers with the Army topping the list, MoS, Defence, Subhash Bhamre said. The Army has 42,635 officers, which is 7,298 short of the sanctioned strength of 49,933. The authorised strength for Navy is 11,352 officers as against the existing number of 9,746 officers, while Air Force is short of 192 officers.
summary: सशस्त्र बलों को 9,000 से अधिक अधिकारियों की कमी का सामना करना पड़ रहा है

text: When asked about Priyanka Chopra's upcoming rumoured wedding to American singer Nick Jonas, Shah Rukh Khan jokingly replied, "Even I am getting married." He further said, "I'll send you an invite. I will send you the card for the reception and also, do come for the mehendi." The incident occurred at the Vogue Beauty Awards on Tuesday.
summary: यहां तक कि मैं शादी कर रहा हूं: प्रियंका-निक की शादी की अफवाह पर एसआरके

text: Actor Rajkummar Rao, who will be seen romancing Aishwarya Rai Bachchan for the first time in upcoming movie 'Fanney Khan', has said, "It was a very weird combination." He added, "My character is in awe of her in the film. And I'm in awe of her in real life." He claimed, "My whole romantic side with Aishwarya was really fun."
summary: एक अजीब कॉम्बो: 'फन्ने खान' में ऐश के साथ रोमांस करते हुए राजकुमार

text: A pigeon walking around the square at the Edgbaston Cricket Ground caused a delay during the opening day of the first India-England Test on Wednesday. England opener Keaton Jennings and captain Joe Root moved the pigeon away from near the pitch before the match restarted. Jennings got bowled out by pacer Mohammad Shami off the first ball after player resumed.
summary: कबूतर भारत-इंग्लैंड टेस्ट में देरी करता है, सलामी बल्लेबाज अगली गेंद पर आउट हो जाता है

text: Off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took four wickets to help India restrict England to 285/9 from 216/3 at one stage on the first Test's opening day on Wednesday. India picked up six of England's nine wickets in the last session. England captain Joe Root, who scored 80 runs, became the third youngest cricketer (27 years, 214 days) to reach 6,000 Test runs.
summary: अश्विन ने इंग्लैंड को 285/9 पर सीमित करने के लिए दिन 1 पर 4 विकेट लिए

text: Revealing about suffering from mental health issues, Sunrisers Hyderabad's Australian all-rounder Moises Henriques said, "I've been a long time sufferer of mental illness." Henriques also confirmed that he is feeling much better now while admitting that he needs some more time to get back on track. Henriques took a break from cricket to take care of his mental health.
summary: लंबे समय तक मानसिक रोग से पीड़ित: सनराइजर्स ऑलराउंडर

text: Neymar's mother Nadine Goncalves has come out in defence of her son after the Brazilian forward admitted he "sometimes exaggerated" his reactions during the 2018 FIFA World Cup. "People know the name of Neymar Jr, but the person who is, few know it," she said. "Don't get upset with...accusations of those who do not have love for others," she added.
summary: लोग उसका नाम जानते हैं लेकिन उस व्यक्ति को नहीं, माँ नेमार को बचाती है

text: An Australian channel took a dig at India captain Virat Kohli, sharing a video of his Test dismissals in England in 2014 with the caption, "Virat Kohli's favourite shot in England." Kohli was dismissed seven times edging the ball to wicketkeeper or slips during his last Test series in England. In 2017, Australian media had called Kohli "classless" and "egomaniac".
summary: ऑस्ट्रेलियाई मीडिया ने 2014 में इंग्लैंड में बर्खास्तगी पर कोहली का मजाक उड़ाया

text: A central government team's probe regarding the collapse of a section of tent's canopy during PM Modi's rally in West Bengal's Midnapore in July revealed lapses by local authorities. Adequate cooperation wasn't provided to PM Modi's advance security liaison team, said officials. The report also stated that enough state police wasn't deployed within five kilometre radius of PM Modi's rally.
summary: WB रैली टेंट पतन जांच से स्थानीय प्राधिकरण की चूक का पता चलता है

text: A Russian Su-34 fighter jet destroyed a ship during a naval drill in the Caspian Sea last week. A video surfaced online shows the Russian warplane launching a Kh-31 missile towards the vessel. Su-23 bombers and Su-25 fighter jets also conducted manoeuvres and practiced hitting targets during the naval drill.
summary: वीडियो: रूसी सुपरसोनिक मिसाइल ड्रिल के दौरान जहाज को नष्ट कर देती है

text: Violent clashes erupted between Zimbabwe's Opposition supporters and police and soldiers in the capital Harare on Wednesday after the Election Commission announced the parliamentary election results. The official results showed that the ruling Zanu-PF party secured majority of seats in the Parliament. One person was reportedly killed after the Army opened fire on protestors.
summary: जिम्बाब्वे में चुनाव परिणामों को लेकर हिंसक झड़पें हुईं

text: A US federal judge on Tuesday blocked an attempt to release blueprints of untraceable and undetectable 3D-printed plastic guns. Matthew Albence's remarks came while testifying before the Senate Judiciary Committee that discussed the government's former policy of separating migrant children from their parents.

text: An international arbitration tribunal rejected the government's claim of $1.7 billion from Reliance Industries and its partners for allegedly siphoning gas from ONGC's fields in the Krishna-Godavari basin. The tribunal also awarded costs of $8.3 million to be paid by the government to the consortium, also comprising BP and Niko Resources. The government had raised the demand in November 2016.

text: The process of laying fibre for Reliance JioGigaFiber has reportedly been stopped due to unfavourable weather as the government does not give permission to dig during rains. Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani had said that registration for JioGigaFiber would start from August 15. He added that rollout would be prioritized across localities with the highest number of registrations.

text: Mortgage lender HDFC's chairman Deepak Parekh has said US proxy advisory firm ISS advised investors to vote against his reappointment due to his directorship in many listed companies. Parekh, who received 22.64% negative votes, said ISS had made similar recommendations in the past as well. Parekh will remain on HDFC board as he received over 75% votes in his favour.

text: The RBI's monetary policy committee in its third bi-monthly monetary policy review of 2018-19 on Wednesday hiked repo rate by 25 bps for the second time in a row to 6.5%. text: Ziauddin Ali Ahmed, nephew of former President Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed has said that names of his family members have not been included in the final draft of Assam's National Register of Citizens (NRC). text: England have become the first-ever team to feature in 1,000 Test matches, achieving the feat after taking the field against India at Edgbaston on Wednesday. England, who had played their first Test in 1877, have won 357, lost 297 and drawn 345 of the 999 Tests they have played. England are followed by Australia, who have played 812 Test matches.

text: The National Register of Citizens is the list of Indian citizens in Assam, which is being updated to remove illegal immigrants. NRC was prepared in 1951, with the updating process being done in 2015. To be in NRC, one's name has to be in the 1951 list, or be linked to a person whose name appears in the legacy data.

text: Krishna Bihari, a Mahant at an ashram in Uttar Pradesh's Dalmau, has started making pens using old newspapers and discarded paper waste. text: Apple announced Tuesday that its profits rose 30% to $11.5 billion in April-June period, registering its strongest-ever third quarter. To become the world's first tech company to hit the trillion-dollar market value, Apple share prices reportedly need to rise by 7%.

text: BJP-ally Shiv Sena alleged that even though PM Narendra Modi-led government had maintained that Aadhaar cards are completely secure, "its claims have been exposed before everyone". text: Chief Election Commissioner OP Rawat said that those whose names are not in Assam National Register of Citizens (NRC) draft can vote if their names are on the voter's list and they fulfil all conditions. text: A four-month-old baby developed breathing problems while on a flight with his parents on Tuesday, and died at the Hyderabad airport. The flight took off from Bengaluru and was headed to Patna, but it was diverted to Hyderabad to provide better medical care to the child. He was rushed to a hospital on landing but was declared dead on arrival.

text: An Army jawan committed suicide by jumping in front of a train in TelanganaÃ¢ÂÂs Gadwal town on Tuesday, after he was rejected for marriage by a girl's parents. He had come to his hometown 10 days ago and went to see a girl along with his family members. However, the girl's father did not like him and rejected the proposal.

text: Pro-quota groups led by the Maratha Kranti Morcha organised a "jail bharo" agitation on Wednesday at Azad Maidan in Mumbai while local groups in other parts of Maharashtra held similar protests. Mumbai's rail and road traffic wasn't affected while adequate security arrangements were made amid the protests, officials said. This comes after CM Devendra Fadnavis had promised quota on Tuesday.

text: The US Air Force ordered a Minuteman III intercontinental ballistic missile to self-destruct due to an anomaly that developed during the flight. text: Thieves on Tuesday stole some of Sweden's royal jewels from a cathedral, before fleeing in a motorboat. Police officials said they have launched a search operation, adding, "We are on land, in the water and in the air."

text: The US embassy in London is auctioning off unwanted items, including 1,200 toilet rolls and a 2007 Volvo S80, following its relocation to a new $1-billion facility in Nine Elms earlier this year. text: China's Huawei has overtaken Apple to become the world's second-largest maker of smartphones for the first time, according to market research firm IDC. Samsung remains the leader in smartphone shipments globally, having shipped 73 million units in the quarter.

text: Ahead of the first Test against England, India captain Virat Kohli said he's not in the "frame of mind" to prove himself in any country. Not people who write...predict things," he added.

text: Twenty-three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams suffered the worst loss of her 23-year-long career after losing 6-1, 6-0 to Britain's Johanna Konta in the first round of the Silicon Valley Classic on Tuesday. text: England's Football Association is set to bring in a new set of rules in which even team coaches and managers can be handed red and yellow cards by the referees over "irresponsible behaviour". text: The government has clarified that WhatsApp can't launch its payments services 'WhatsApp Pay' in India without an office and a team in the country. text: Amid the controversy over Assam's National Register of Citizens (NRC) draft, Hyderabad BJP MLA Raja Singh said, "If these Rohingyas and Bangladeshi illegal immigrants don't leave India respectfully, then they should be shot and eliminated. text: The world's biggest colony of king penguins and the second biggest of all penguins has reduced by 88% over the past 35 years for reasons yet unknown, according to scientists. Indian Ocean's Pig Island was home to 500,000 breeding pairs and consisted of over two million penguins during the 1982 survey, while the latest satellite survey reported only 60,000 pairs.

text: Shin Ok-ju, leader of the Grace Road Church has been arrested for subjecting 400 followers to violent rituals. text: North Korea provided a single dog tag to help identify remains believed to be of 55 US soldiers killed in the Korean War, according to a US defence official. text: A gay couple was asked to sit separately on an Alaska Airlines flight so a straight couple could sit together. One of the gay partners was asked to give up the seat or get off the plane. text: All 103 onboard, including 99 passengers and 4 crew members, survived after an AeromÃÂ©xico-operated Embraer 190 aircraft crashed in Mexico's northern state of Durango. text: After US President Donald Trump offered to meet his Iranian counterpart Hassan Rouhani for talks without preconditions, Iran Interior Minister Abdolreza Rahmani Fazli said, "The US is not trustworthy." text: Reiterating that his campaign did not collude with Russia during the 2016 presidential election, US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said, "Collusion is not a crime." text: T-Mobile US has named Finland's Nokia to supply it with $3.5 billion in next-generation 5G network gear, marking the world's biggest 5G deal so far. text: Tata Motors reported its worst loss in nearly nine years at Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,902 crore for the June quarter compared to a profit of Ã¢ÂÂ¹3,199 crore in the year-ago period. text: HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh was reappointed as non-executive director of the country's largest mortgage lender, though 22.64% of the shareholders voted against his continuation. JJ Irani and Keki Mistry too got reappointment as directors with more favourable votes.n

text: Sushant Singh Rajput is set to portray twelve real-life characters, including philosopher Chanakya, poet Rabindranath Tagore and former Indian president APJ Abdul Kalam, in a 12-episode biopic series. text: Three-time NBA champion LeBron James has said US President Donald Trump is using sports to create division throughout the country and that he "can't sit back and not say nothing". text: A spectator once ran on to the ground to congratulate former Windies' captain Sir Frank Worrell after the latter reached his double hundred during a match in the Caribbean. Worrell, who was born on August 1, 1924, was the first black captain of the Windies team. He represented Windies in 51 Test matches, scoring 3,860 runs.

text: Sir Frank Worrell, the first black captain of Windies, made a cameo appearance in Raj Kapoor's 1967 movie 'Around The World'. Worrell, who was born on August 1, 1924, played 51 Test matches for Windies, scoring 3,860 runs at an average of 49.48 and taking 69 wickets. Worrell was the first player to be involved in two first-class 500-run partnerships.
summary: विंडीज के 1 अश्वेत कप्तान ने राज कपूर की फिल्म में कैमियो किया

text: Former Indian batsman Virender Sehwag has not attended a single anti-doping hearing since being inducted into the Anti-Doping Appeals Panel (ADAP) of the National Anti-Doping Agency (NADA) in November 2017. Sehwag, who was inducted in the six-member panel on Indian Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore's invitation, will not be participating in any of the upcoming hearings either.

text: Facebook is reportedly working on a talent show feature that would allow users to compete by singing on its app. The feature, which offers a platform for talent to get discovered, allows users to record themselves singing and submit their videos for critique. The feature isn't live but was uncovered in the Facebook app's code by researcher Jane Manchun Wong.
summary: फेसबुक एक सिंगिंग टैलेंट शो फीचर पर काम कर रहा है: रिपोर्ट

text: Facebook has announced that it removed 32 Pages and accounts that engaged in "coordinated inauthentic behaviour" designed to influence the US elections. Facebook also said it has identified 17 suspect profiles on Facebook and seven Instagram accounts. The company added it was in the "very early" stages of the investigation and did not yet know who was behind the Pages.n
summary: अमेरिकी चुनावों को प्रभावित करने की कोशिश में FB ने 32 पेज निकाले

text: US-based no-brand e-commerce startup Brandless on Tuesday announced that it had raised $240 million from SoftBank's $100-billion Vision Fund. The deal values Brandless at a little over $500 million. Founded in 2017, the startup sells about 300 items on its website, including a wide range of upscale-sounding products like organic pasta sauce or gluten-free veggie chips, mostly for $3 each.

text: A minor girl was allegedly married off by her father to a 25-year-old man in Greater Noida two months ago so he could pay off a debt. Her mother lodged a case on Sunday, following which her father and husband were arrested. The girl, reportedly aged 11, said she was thrashed, sexually assaulted and made to do all the housework.
summary: पिता कर्ज चुकाने के लिए नाबालिग से शादी करता है, माँ पुलिस के पास जाती है

text: At least 60 students fell ill on Tuesday after they drank contaminated water from taps near their school in Maharashtra's Ahmednagar district, the police said. The students, aged between 10 to 12 years, complained of stomach ache, dysentery and giddiness. The police said, "We have collected water samples and sent them for analysis."

text: A van driver has been sacked after he was captured on video splashing pedestrians by driving into large puddles in Canada's Ottawa. text: Chinese hackers chose CDs to send malware to the US officials via mail, the Multi-State Information Sharing and Analysis Center (MS-ISAC) has said. text: A 35-year-old farmer allegedly committed suicide in Maharashtra's Savkhed Tejan village after building his own pyre with animal fodder and wood. text: A 16-year-old girl died on Monday in the Bhadohi district of Uttar Pradesh after her alleged stalker barged into her house and set her on fire. text: A NASA-backed research has refuted SpaceX CEO Elon Musk's idea of nuking the arid atmosphere of Mars to make it warm and habitable. text: At a distance of 57.6 million km, Mars has come closest to Earth since 2003 and will appear relatively brighter. text: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly has said that he promoted MS Dhoni to bat at number three from seven against Pakistan in 2005 to make him a 'player'. summary: एमएसडी को प्रचारित किया। 3 से 7 उसे 'खिलाड़ी' बनाने के लिए: गांगुली

text: Graham Prior, coach of South Africa's squash team, died after collapsing on the road due to a heart attack after the team's World Junior Squash Championship play-off match against Singapore in Chennai. The 67-year-old was on his way along with the players to board the team bus, which was heading back to the hotel when he collapsed.
summary: चेन्नई में सड़क पर गिरने से एसए स्क्वैश कोच की मौत

text: Speaking about the ball-tampering scandal, South African pacer Dale Steyn said that the scandal was almost like a cry for help from the bowlers due to the disparity between batting and bowling in cricket. Highlighting the differences, Steyn said, "[f]ields are small, two new balls, powerplays, bats have got bigger than they used to be, the list can go on".
summary: बॉल टैंपरिंग कांड मदद के लिए रोने जैसा था: डेल स्टेन

text: Researchers at film company 20th Century Fox have developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that can predict a movie's audience based on its trailer. The AI is trained on hundreds of movie trailers released over the last years, along with their attendance records. It is expected to help moviemakers craft custom trailers which will appeal the audience to buy tickets.
summary: एआई जो एक फिल्म के ट्रेलर से दर्शकों की भविष्यवाणी करता है, विकसित हुआ

text: While addressing the audience at the recent music festival Loveloud benefiting the LGBTQ+ youth, Apple CEO Tim Cook said that they are "a gift to the world". He also said, "My heart breaks when I see kids struggling to conform to a society." There's no need to struggle to be "what someone else thinks is normal", he added.
summary: आप दुनिया के लिए एक उपहार हैं: टिम कुक एलजीबीटीक्यू + युवाओं के लिए

text: In his recent Mann Ki Baat address, PM Narendra Modi praised two Indian techies Yogesh Sahu and Rajnish Bajpai in the US for creating India's first 'smart gaon', Taudhakpur. They developed the 'SmartGaon' mobile app that connects the village internally and with the outside world. Taudhakpur has CCTV cameras, public address systems, regular health check-up events, and a WiFi zone.
summary: पीएम मोदी ने 'स्मार्टगॉन' बनाने के लिए अमेरिका में भारतीय तकनीकियों पर जोर डाला

text: Speaking of Congress president Rahul Gandhi, former Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal said, "Rahul is immature. He may mature over time, but to think now that he will be the PM is unimaginable." Claiming the Congress president has a long way to go, he added, "Being PM is a big responsibility and he is not up to the task yet."
summary: यह सोचने के लिए कि राहुल अगले पीएम होंगे अकल्पनीय: बादल

text: Chinese e-commerce startup Pinduodo (PDD), founded by former Google employee Colin Huang, has reached a valuation of approximately $30 billion within 3 years of launch. Pinduodo became a $30-billion-dollar startup after raising $1.63 billion this week in the fourth-largest US initial public offering (IPO) this year. It was led by Credit Suisse, Goldman Sachs, and China International Capital.
summary: चीनी ई-कॉमर्स स्टार्टअप 3 वर्षों में $ 30 बीएन वैल्यूएशन तक पहुंचता है

text: The recent GST rate cuts will pressure the government's fiscal consolidation effort and are 'credit negative' for India, rating agency Moody's Investor Service said on Monday. Moody's said the estimated revenue loss from the GST rate cuts is 0.04%-0.08% of GDP annually. The GST rates on consumer durable items, such as refrigerators, washing machines and small television sets, were lowered.
summary: मूडीज का कहना है कि भारत के लिए जीएसटी दर में कटौती ऋणात्मक है

text: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation (HSBC) on Monday announced the appointment of IIM Ahmedabad alumnus Surendra Rosha as CEO for HSBC India, subject to regulatory approvals. Rosha succeeds Jayant Rikhye, who is taking a leave of absence for medical reasons. Rosha, currently HSBC's Head of Financial Institutions Group for Asia-Pacific, has 27 years of experience in financial services.
summary: एचएसबीसी आईआईएम के पूर्व छात्र सुरेंद्र रोशा को भारत का सीईओ नियुक्त करता है

text: A 22-year-old girl's father got his daughter's stalker from Uttar Pradesh arrested after posing as a Mumbai-based producer of film titled 'Mai Hu Auto Wala'. The stalker allegedly got miffed after she rejected his marriage proposal and morphed her face onto an objectionable picture. After the stalker agreed to visit Mumbai, the father alerted the Mumbai Police of his arrival.
summary: फिल्म निर्माता के रूप में प्रस्तुत करके पिता ने बेटी के पिता को गिरफ्तार कर लिया

text: Actress Katrina Kaif will be playing the female lead in the Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat' after Priyanka Chopra's exit. "I am extremely excited to work with Katrina and Salman once again... We have had exciting collaborations in the past and it is very interesting to work with the duo once again," said director Ali Abbas Zafar.
summary: प्रियंका के निकलने के बाद कैटरीना भरत में महिला प्रधान भूमिका निभाने के लिए

text: A US man got hit by a car as he slipped on the road while doing the viral 'Kiki challenge'. He was supposed to jump on the car's hood while dancing but got hit by it and suffered injuries. People taking the challenge need to dance outside a car on Drake's 'In My Feelings' track and post their videos online.
summary: वायरल होते हुए आदमी कार से टकरा गया 'किकी चुनौती'

text: The government is mulling a single regulator and legislation to address all e-commerce related issues in the country, according to a draft policy document seen by Reuters. The measures suggested in the draft include local data storage, mandating the use of homegrown card payment network RuPay in online transactions and improving the participation of MSMEs in online retail.
summary: भारत ई-कॉमर्स क्षेत्र के लिए एकल नियामक बनाता है

text: Bengaluru-based health and fitness startup Cure.fit has raised $120 million in Series C funding round led by IDG Ventures, Accel Partners, and Kalaari Capital. Within a year, the startup has raised two rounds including Series B. Founded in 2016 by former Flipkart executives Mukesh Bansal and Ankit Nagori, Cure.fit is backed by Flipkart CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy and actor Hrithik Roshan.
summary: स्वास्थ्य और फिटनेस स्टार्टअप Cure.fit ने $ 120 मिलियन फंड जुटाए

text: India is a key partner in US' efforts to ensure peace, stability and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific region, the US State Department has said. It added that the US and India are not only working bilaterally, but also cooperating with other like-minded partners. Further, the US State Department said that India-US partnership is rooted in shared democratic values.
summary: इंडो-पैसिफिक क्षेत्र में यूएस का भारत प्रमुख भागीदार: यूएस एडमिन

text: The Ministry of External Affairs has reportedly asked the government of Antigua and Barbuda to "confirm his (Mehul Choksi) presence in their territory and detain him and prevent his movement by land, air or sea". Reports further said that the government is meeting authorities in Antigua and Barbuda on Monday. This comes after news of Choksi being in the country.
summary: चोकसी को जानें, उसके आंदोलन को रोकें: भारत को एंटीगुआ सरकार

text: The family of a Kerala nun has reportedly alleged a priest called her acquaintance to offer "land, building and safety" and a better posting if she withdrew her rape complaint against a bishop. An audio of the alleged phone call is being investigated by the police. The nun had alleged the bishop raped her multiple times between 2014-2016.
summary: यदि उसने बलात्कार का मामला वापस ले लिया तो प्रीस्ट ने नन की भूमि की पेशकश की: रिपोर्ट

text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday praised 15-year-old Anushka Panda who topped the CBSE Class 10 examinations in the differently-abled category with 97.8%. During his 'Mann ki Baat' address, PM Modi praised Panda saying she didn't let her disability deter her from becoming a topper. Panda, who suffers from spinal muscular atrophy, thanked PM Modi for "his kind encouragement and motivation".
summary: पीएम मोदी ने 15-वर्षीय पुराने सीबीएसई टॉपर की प्रशंसा की

text: A constable employed with the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) was shot dead by unidentified militants when he was on leave at his home in south Kashmir's Pulwama on Sunday. The militants barged into his house and opened fire on him. Naseer Ahmad Rather suffered critical injuries and was rushed to the hospital but could not survive.
summary: कश्मीर में आतंकवादियों द्वारा मारे गए छुट्टी पर सीआरपीएफ जवान

text: Saudi King Salman bin Abdulaziz has told the US that the kingdom won't be able to support its plan for Israeli-Palestinian peace if it doesn't include a Palestinian capital in East Jerusalem. "We will not abandon you...We accept what you accept and we reject what you reject," King Salman had told Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas during a recent meeting.
summary: अमेरिकी शांति योजना के लिए यरूशलेम को फिलिस्तीन की राजधानी के रूप में होना चाहिए: सऊदी

text: German breweries are running out of beer bottles amid the ongoing heatwave, with some breweries turning to social media to ask for help. Notably, beer consumers in Germany pay a deposit on bottles, which is refunded when they are returned. However, the ongoing heatwave has discouraged people from bringing those bottles back in.
summary: हीटवेव के बीच बोतलों से बाहर निकलने वाली जर्मन शराब की भठ्ठी

text: Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 was probably deliberately steered off course and flown to the southern Indian Ocean, according to the Malaysian government's safety report into the disaster. The search for MH370 had ended on May 29. The flight mysteriously disappeared on March 8, 2014, en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur with 239 people on board.
summary: MH370 को इसके अंत तक 'हेरफेर' किया गया था: मलेशिया सरकार

text: A US man was convicted on all charges in the death of his 12-year-old daughter, who was shot by a constable serving eviction papers with a bullet that went through her father's arm. The constable shot after the man pointed a loaded rifle at him. "Parents are supposed to protect their children...Not put them in harm's way," an attorney said.
summary: गोली से बेटी की मौत में दोषी ठहराए गए आदमी ने उसे पहले मारा

text: Diana Penty, who made Bollywood debut with 'Cocktail' in 2012, said that the time between her debut film and second film 'Happy Bhag Jayegi', which released in 2016, was very confusing. "Took me a while to figure out how to proceed, what direction to take," she added. "At that time, I was very new to the industry," she further said.
summary: कॉकटेल, 'हैप्पी भाग ...' के बीच का समय भ्रमित करने वाला था: डायना

text: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said that the nation will become an 'Asian Tiger' under the leadership of World Cup-winning former captain Imran Khan, who is Pakistan's PM-elect. "[T]he whole nation must stand by his side if we are to succeed... I'm confident that Imran bhai will deliver", Shoaib said about Imran.
summary: इमरान खान: शोएब अख्तर के तहत पाक बनेगा 'एशियाई टाइगर'

text: Kapil Dev smashed four consecutive sixes off England spinner Eddie Hemmings at Lord's on July 30, 1990, becoming the first-ever player to hit sixes off four consecutive balls in Tests. India had one wicket in hand and needed 24 runs to avoid the follow-on before Dev slammed the sixes. No batsman has hit more than four consecutive sixes in Tests.
summary: कपिल देव टेस्ट मैच में लगातार 4 छक्के लगाने वाले पहले बल्लेबाज थे

text: Reacting to a photo earlier posted by Shikhar Dhawan, Indian batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has retweeted the same photo with a different caption, that reads, "Na ho koi fikar, jab humaare beech mein ho Shikhar!" Dhawan had earlier posted the photo that featured Pujara and Virat Kohli, with the caption, "Kaise na ho gujara.. jab saath ho Kohli aur Pujara!"
summary: ना हो कोई फिकर, जब बीच में हो शिखर: पुजारा

text: Zimbabwe's cricket board has received funds from ICC to clear all the dues of the players and staff of the Zimbabwe national cricket team. In the past, cricketers had refused to take part in the tri-series involving Pakistan and Australia due to the non-payment of dues. The board had asked for ICC's help after failing to meet the payment deadline.
summary: जिम्बाब्वे के बोर्ड को क्रिकेटरों, कर्मचारियों को भुगतान करने के लिए आईसीसी से धन मिलता है

text: Manika Batra, who won four medals at CWG in April, is yet to receive cash reward promised by the Delhi government. Batra would reportedly get Ã¢ÂÂ¹1.7 crore for her medals (Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 crore for two gold medals, Ã¢ÂÂ¹40 lakh for silver and Ã¢ÂÂ¹30 lakh for bronze). "(D)on't know why it hasn't happened so far but I know it'll happen," Batra said.
summary: दिल्ली सरकार ने अभी तक CWG चंपत बत्रा को नकद इनाम से सम्मानित किया है

text: Swedish forward Zlatan Ibrahimovic won his side, LA Galaxy, the match against Orlando City SC after scoring his first ever hat-trick in the MLS championship on Sunday. Ibrahimovic twice scored his side's equalising goal before scoring the winner to help his side beat Orlando City SC 4-3. Ibrahimovic now has 15 goals in 17 appearances for LA Galaxy.
summary: ज़्लाटन ने अपनी पहली MLS हैट्रिक के साथ टीम के लिए मैच जीता

text: Brazil's forward Neymar Jr has admitted in an advertisement that he sometimes did exaggerate his reactions while playing for Brazil in the recently-concluded World Cup 2018 in Russia. He further says that he suffers on the pitch and has not yet learnt to disappoint his fans. "I fell, but only who falls can pick himself up", Neymar adds.
summary: नेमार ने विश्व कप 2018 में अतिरंजित प्रतिक्रियाओं को स्वीकार किया

text: After the Assam government released National Register of Citizens' (NRC) final draft, state Congress chief Ripun Bora said it was surprising that 40 lakh people are excluded, adding there are a lot of irregularities in the list. Meanwhile, Trinamool Congress' SS Roy said the Centre intentionally excluded minorities which will have serious consequences on the demography of states adjoining Assam.
summary: कांग्रेस ने दावा किया कि एनआरसी से 40 लाख बचे हैं

text: Online food delivery app Swiggy is looking to expand its service offering delivery for categories including grocery, medicines, flowers and gift shops, according to reports. The service would also include a customer-to-customer pick-up and drop service, reports added. The new hyperlocal delivery service is expected to roll out by October-November across NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai.
summary: दवाओं की डिलीवरी शुरू करने का स्वांग, किराना: रिपोर्ट

text: Amazon India has led an $11-million Series B funding round in Gurugram-based bus aggregating startup Shuttl, along with Dentsu Ventures. Existing investors Sequoia Capital, Times Internet and Lightspeed Venture Partners also participated in the round. Founded in 2015, Shuttl aims to reduce congestion in cities by offering bus services that can be booked via a mobile app.
summary: अमेज़ॅन बस सेवा स्टार्टअप Shuttl में $ 11-मिलियन फंड का नेतृत्व करता है

text: A video showing a prisoner undergoing trial for attempt to murder celebrate his birthday inside a jail in Uttar Pradesh's Faizabad has surfaced online. The prisoner claimed he paid Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh to the jailer who provided him with all the items, including cake, candles, knife and lighter, for his 40th birthday. He added the video was shot by the jailer.
summary: वीडियो में यूपी की जेल में कैदी का जन्मदिन मनाते हुए दिखा

text: State Bank of India (SBI) on Monday hiked its fixed deposit (FD) interest rates for select tenures. FDs below Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 crore for 1 year to 2 years will now provide 6.70% interest as against 6.65% earlier while senior citizens will get 7.2%. For deposits from 2 years to 3 years, the interest rate has been revised to 6.75% from 6.65%.
summary: एसबीआई फिक्स्ड डिपॉजिट ब्याज दरों को बढ़ाता है

text: The fully-loaded variant of Asus Zenfone 5z with 8GB RAM, 256GB storage is now available on Flipkart at Ã¢ÂÂ¹36,999. The combination of Snapdragon 845 processor with AI Engine and 8GB RAM make it a performance beast. Featuring dual cameras, dual 5-magnet speakers and "QuickCharge" technology, it is as IB Times puts it "the best value-for-money flagship phone in the market".
summary: आसुस ज़ेनफोन 5 ज़ेड 8 जीबी रैम | 256 जीबी रोम अब फ्लिपकार्ट पर उपलब्ध है

text: Talking about why he signed 'Race 3', actor Anil Kapoor said he did it for the money. "Whenever I sign a film, I obviously think of the amount of money that it will fetch me," added Anil. He further said, "My wife will never allow me into the house if I do not earn money, so it's important to me."
summary: मैंने इसे पैसे के लिए किया: अनिल कपूर ने 'रेस 3' में अभिनय किया

text: Fake apps impersonating banking apps of HDFC, ICICI, and RBL, have been found on the official Google Play Store, security firm ESET has revealed. These apps gathered users' credit card details on the pretext of increasing the limit and also leaked the obtained data online. The apps were uploaded in June and July but have reportedly been taken down now.
summary: ICICI, HDFC, RBL लीक क्रेडिट कार्ड यूजर्स के डेटा के नकली ऐप

text: A polar bear was shot dead by a guard after it attacked and injured his colleague working for tourist cruise ship MS Bremen, which was visiting an Arctic archipelago in Norway. The guard suffered head injuries and is not in a life-threatening condition. A picture of the dead polar bear was circulated online and sparked criticism of Arctic wildlife tourism.
summary: क्रूज शिप गार्ड को घायल करने के बाद आर्कटिक ध्रुवीय भालू की गोली मारकर हत्या

text: The Assam government on Monday released the final draft of National Register of Citizens (NRC) list, in which over 40 lakh people were excluded. Of the total 3.29 crore applicants, 2.89 crore have been found eligible as citizens. Officials said the list is a draft and not final, adding that people who have been excluded can make claims and objections.
summary: असम ने नागरिक सूची का अंतिम मसौदा जारी किया, 40 लाख बचे

text: Ethical hackers on Sunday claimed to have accessed TRAI Chief RS Sharma's bank account details and deposited Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 in his bank account to highlight the potential of Aadhaar being misused. This came a day after Sharma shared his Aadhaar number publicly on Twitter, throwing a challenge of obtaining more information using just the 12-digit UIDAI number.
summary: हैकर्स ने ट्राई चीफ के बैंक अकाउंट डिटेल्स को एक्सेस किया, जमा ¢ ¢1

text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday publicly tore a report on CCTVs prepared by a special committee constituted by the L-G and said his government would install the cameras without Delhi police's licence. "It's the public who will decide where these cameras should come up," Kejriwal said and added CCTV recordings should be given to the police, RWAs, and government.
summary: केजरीवाल ने सीसीटीवी लगाने पर उपराज्यपाल की रिपोर्ट को सार्वजनिक रूप से फाड़ दिया

text: US President Donald Trump has threatened to shut down the government ahead of the spending deadline in September if Democrats do not fund his border wall and back immigration law changes. He also called for an immigration system "based on merit", adding, "We need great people coming into our country!"
summary: ट्रम्प ने अमेरिकी सरकार को सीमा की दीवार पर बंद करने की धमकी दी

text: Iran Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif has said that Americans are addicted to sanctioning, adding that Iran can show them that they have to give up their addiction. The US began imposing sanctions against Iran after it withdrew from the 2015 nuclear deal. Recently, Iran filed a complaint at the International Court of Justice over the US' reimposition of sanctions.
summary: अमेरिकी मंजूरी देने के आदी हैं: ईरान के विदेश मंत्री

text: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was on Sunday shifted to the Pakistan Institute of Medical Sciences (PIMS) in Islamabad after his health deteriorated at Rawalpindi's Adiala prison. Sharif was shifted after his ECG showed irregular heart activity and the tests revealed blood clots. A senior official said he is suffering from cardiac ischemia.
summary: पूर्व पीएम शरीफ स्वास्थ्य बिगड़ने के कारण अस्पताल में शिफ्ट हो गए

text: Rishi Kapoor revealed that he has been approached to portray renowned author and columnist Khushwant Singh in the biopic being made on him. "It was about six months back when somebody asked me about this...I even said yes...Don't know what's happening after that," he added. "They would have to take somebody else to portray his younger version," he further said.
summary: उनकी बायोपिक: ऋषि में खुशवंत सिंह का किरदार निभाने की मंजूरी

text: Former Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney was left with a broken nose after scoring his first goal for his new club, MLS' DC United, on Sunday. Playing against the Colorado Rapids, Rooney suffered a bloodied nose while defending a corner in the match. The former England captain later tweeted that his broken nose required five stitches.
summary: रूनी ने अपनी नई टीम के लिए 1 गोल के बाद टूटी नाक के साथ छोड़ दिया

text: Geraint Thomas became the first Welshman to win the Tour de France cycling race in Paris on Sunday. The 32-year-old and his teammates enjoyed champagne while riding on their bikes during the 21st and final stage of the race in Paris. Notably, Thomas was a support rider in four of defending champion Chris Froome's Tour de France wins.
summary: साइकिलिंग के टूर डी फ्रांस जीतने के लिए थॉमस 1 वेल्शमैन बने

text: Mercedes' British driver Lewis Hamilton won the last Grand Prix race before the Formula One's summer break in Hungary on Sunday. With nine races remaining in the season, Hamilton now holds a 24-point advantage at the top of the drivers' championship. The other two spots on the podium were occupied by Ferrari drivers Sebastian Vettel and Kimi Raikkonen.
summary: हेमिल्टन एफ 1 ग्रीष्मकालीन ब्रेक से पहले आखिरी ग्रां प्री रेस जीतते हैं

text: A video shows skydivers trying to unlock a phone using Face ID in free fall. In the video, the divers are seen jumping off the plane from about 15,000 feet with the phones stuck to their arms. They claim the aim of the experiment was to see if the technology would work in 'unusual' circumstances like free fall.
summary: स्काईडाइवर्स फ्री फॉल में फेस आईडी का उपयोग कर फोन को अनलॉक करने का प्रयास करते हैं

text: Google's keyboard, Gboard, suggests the phrase 'on my face' on typing 'sit' on Android devices. A user claimed that he sent a text to his babysitter, "Hey! Are you free to sit", to which, Google's autocomplete added "on my face". The company said it is aware of the autocomplete issue and is working on a fix.

text: Apple shipped around 35 lakh Apple Watches globally in the second quarter of this year, according to data analytics firm Canalys. text: Niti Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant has said India needs to improve its Human Development Index (HDI) to achieve a growth of around 10%. text: A woman has moved Madras High Court seeking action against doctors of a government hospital after they misdiagnosed a tumour in her abdomen as pregnancy. text: Earth is large enough to cover the Moon with its shadow during a total lunar eclipse. However, some of the sunlight passes through Earth's atmosphere to reach the Moon. As the white light breaks up while passing through the atmosphere, most of its blue-coloured wavelengths are absorbed or scattered. The remaining red wavelengths light up the Moon in blood-red colour.

text: A 26-year-long study using Chile-based telescopes has for the first time revealed the effects predicted by Albert Einstein's general relativity theory on a star's motion in the gravitational field of a supermassive black hole. text: The government told the Supreme Court there'll be no changes in One Rank One Pension scheme as it'll create financial implications. text: Sanjay Dutt starrer 'Saheb, Biwi Aur Gangster 3', which released today, "fails to look any different from a cringe-worthy television soap," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). The film "doesn't make for great cat-and-mouse drama," said NDTV. Firstpost wrote compared to the franchise's first two films, the third part is "just okay." text: DMK President M Karunanidhi on Friday became the first Indian political figure to lead a party for 50 years. text: The planet-wide Mars dust storm that shut down operations of NASA's Opportunity rover originated largely from a single 1,000-km-long geological formation near the Red Planet's equator, American researchers have found. Once about half the size of US, the area is being eroded for over three billion years, releasing enough dust to form up to a 12-metre-thick global layer, said scientists.

text: Bihar Social Welfare Minister Manju Verma has said she will resign and quit politics if her husband is found guilty in the shelter home case wherein 29 girls were raped. She denied allegations he frequently visited the state-funded shelter home and spent "long hours in the girls' room". She claimed they were being targetted since they belonged to Kushwaha community.

text: Facebook on Thursday posted the largest single-day loss of $120 billion in market value by any company in the US stock market history. Facebook surpassed Intel's worst single-day loss of $90.74 billion market value in 2000.

text: According to reports, Tom Cruise's foot injury on the sets of 'Mission: Impossible - Fallout' increased the film's budget by approximately $70 million (over Ã¢ÂÂ¹480 crore). text: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar took to Twitter to confirm that Priyanka Chopra has quit his upcoming directorial 'Bharat'. text: The official trailer of Rajkummar Rao and Shraddha Kapoor starrer 'Stree' has been released. The horror comedy film is reportedly based on the urban legend of 'Nale Ba' that went viral in Karnataka during the 1990s. Directed by Amar Kaushik, the film is scheduled to be released on August 31.

text: The Indian Olympic Association (IOA) has been fined nearly Ã¢ÂÂ¹74,000 by the Commonwealth Games Organising Committee for damages caused by athletes at the Games Village during CWG 2018 in Gold Coast, Australia. text: A 19-year-old taekwondo player has admitted that she had lost the foetus, which was recovered from a toilet of a flight which landed in Delhi on Wednesday. text: A museum dedicated to all former and future Prime Ministers will be built at Delhi's Teen Murti Bhavan, which served as Jawaharlal Nehru's official residence as PM until his death in office. text: Lok Sabha on Thursday passed the Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) Bill, 2018. The legislation calls for punishment ranging from 10 years of imprisonment and a fine of not less than Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 lakh to offenders. "Bill isn't intended to harass those voluntarily in the profession...it has a compassionate view of sex racket victims," said Union Minister Maneka Gandhi.nn
summary: लोकसभा ने मानव तस्करी विरोधी विधेयक पारित किया

text: As many as 20 people have died amid heavy rains and floods in Odisha, which have affected over three lakh people in the state. Officials said that district authorities have to complete the assessment of damages to private properties in two weeks.

text: Somalia will prosecute a female genital mutilation (FGM) case for the first time in the country's history after a 10-year-old girl died from the procedure last week. Deeqa Dahir Nuur suffered severe bleeding after her mother took her to a traditional cutter. Deputy PM Mahdi Mohamed Gulaid said that the practice is not a part of the Islamic religion.

text: Asserting that Pakistan-US ties cannot be a one-way relationship, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf chief Imran Khan on Thursday said they will work on a mutually beneficial policy. text: Barcelona women's team was made to fly in economy while the men's team travelled in first class to US in their first-ever tour together. text: Nine Facebook insiders have sold about $4.13 billion worth of stock since the Cambridge Analytica data-mining scandal first surfaced on March 17, compared to $4.31 billion in all of 2017. text: The 'world's first ever computer algorithm' which was written by a Victorian woman named Ada Lovelace 175 years ago has been sold at an auction for Ã¢ÂÂ¹86 lakh. text: Researchers at Italian Institute of Technology (IIT) have developed a four-legged robot called 'Centauro' that is aimed to help in disaster relief operations. text: Independent MLA Ravi Rana today warned that he and six other independent legislators supporting the BJP-led Maharashtra government would withdraw their support if CM Devendra Fadnavis is replaced. text: A Class 12 boy, who was allegedly under the influence of alcohol, stole a Haryana Roadways bus after starting it with the help of a motorcycle key on Wednesday. text: The body of a 14-year-old missing girl was found inside a locked house in West Bengal's Howrah on Thursday. text: The three sisters who were found unconscious in their one-room residence in Delhi had starved to death, an initial post-mortem report revealed. Police said the bodies of the children have been handed to their family and a second autopsy report is awaited.

text: Goa Tourism Minister Manohar Ajgaonkar has said that though the state welcomes all tourists, they only want good tourists who follow their laws. Ajgaonkar further said that they won't allow tourists who do not respect 'Goaness'.

text: The Central Bureau of Investigation will investigate the Cambridge Analytica data breach scandal, Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said in the Rajya Sabha on Thursday. text: Two people were arrested in Delhi on Wednesday for cheating at least 300 people by swapping their ATM cards on the pretext of helping them. text: Priyanka Chopra has thanked Variety for including her in the magazine's list of 500 most influential business leaders in the entertainment industry. text: India's leading carmaker Maruti Suzuki is planning to develop electric motors for its small cars, Alto, Wagon R, Celerio and A-Star over the next few years. text: Speaking about the Maratha reservation protests, Shiv Sena said in party mouthpiece 'Saamana' that Maharashtra paid the price for the government's nature to suppress issues. text: National Commission of Women (NCW) has recommended abolishing the practice of confessions in churches as it can lead to blackmailing of women. "The priests pressure women into telling their secrets," said the NCW chairperson. text: Speaking about the deaths of three girls due to starvation, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said, "Our system has failed." text: A mute woman was allegedly gangraped by four men when she visited a fair in Patrasayer, West Bengal. text: After Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said everyone should respect religious sentiments, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the nation should be governed according to the Constitution and not sentiments. text: Union Minister RK Singh said on Thursday that the elections in Pakistan were rigged and that the Army helped cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan win. Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI) party is leading in the provisional results listed by the Election Commission of Pakistan.

text: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf chief Imran Khan said that he wanted to learn poverty alleviation from China. text: A 26-year-old man detonated an explosive device near the US embassy in Beijing on Thursday. text: The Election Commission of Pakistan said on Thursday that the final result of the general elections will be announced within 24 hours. The firm had said it would give half the gold found aboard to the Russian government. The warship sunk in 1905 during the Russo-Japanese War.

text: Australian investment bank Macquarie Group on Thursday said that Shemara Wikramanayake will take over as the group's first female CEO in December. The 56-year-old Wikramanayake, who joined Macquarie in 1987, currently heads its asset management arm. Wikramanayake, who was born in the UK, becomes the only female CEO among Australia's 20 biggest companies by market value.
summary: ऑस्ट्रेलिया की मैक्वेरी ग्रुप पहली महिला सीईओ नियुक्त करती है

text: The West Bengal Assembly has passed the resolution to change the state's name to 'Bangla'. The proposal will now go to the Home Ministry for approval, and the name of the state will be changed only if the Ministry gives the green signal. The Centre earlier rejected the proposal of name change to 'Bengal' in English and 'Bangla' in Bengali.
summary: पश्चिम बंगाल ने राज्य का नाम बदलकर 'बंगला' करने का प्रस्ताव पारित किया

text: Three girls aged eight, four and two years died in Delhi due to starvation from prolonged malnutrition, police said quoting initial autopsy report on Wednesday. Their mother was found to be mentally unstable and their father, a rickshaw puller, couldn't be traced. The family shifted to a room last week after rains damaged their shanty.
summary: दिल्ली में भुखमरी के कारण एक ही परिवार की 3 नाबालिग लड़कियों की मौत

text: Former cricketer Virender Sehwag has advised Team India to not play Asia Cup over the tournament's schedule, which will see India play two ODIs in two days, including a match against Pakistan. "Which country plays back-to-back cricket...these days? A player needs...48 hours to recover," he added. "If (our) players are tired then Pakistan will definitely have advantage," he further said.
summary: एशिया कप नहीं खेलना चाहिए: सहवाग ने भारत के बैक-टू-बैक गेम का नारा दिया

text: Media player app VLC has blacklisted some Huawei smartphones from accessing the app on Google Play Store. The decision comes after several Huawei users left negative one-star reviews on the Android app store. However, the company VideoLAN claimed that the problems faced by the users are not because of any bug in their app, but because of the smartphone itself.
summary: नकारात्मक उपयोगकर्ता समीक्षाओं पर VLC ने Huawei स्मार्टफ़ोन को ब्लैकलिस्ट किया

text: Facebook on Wednesday suffered a $150-billion loss in market capitalisation within two hours after it announced its slowest-ever user growth in quarterly reports. The data scandal-hit firm saw its first-ever decline in user count after new data privacy laws were introduced by the EU. Facebook also warned its profit margins will sink to "mid-30s" from 44% for over two years.
summary: क्या अपने इतिहास में $ 150 bn का सबसे बड़ा नुकसान Facebook शुरू हो गया?

text: Google parent Alphabet had more contract workers than direct employees for the first time ever earlier this year, according to Bloomberg. The workers who are referred to as TVCs or "temps, vendors and contractors", are reportedly not entitled to stock, insurance or other benefits accorded to direct employees. Alphabet reported 89,058 direct employees at the end of the June quarter.
summary: प्रत्यक्ष कर्मचारियों की तुलना में वर्णमाला में अधिक ठेकेदार थे: रिपोर्ट

text: Before Facebook's biggest-ever loss of $150 billion in market capitalisation on Wednesday, American chipmaker Intel lost about $91 billion in a single day in September 2000. Multinational oil corporation ExxonMobil lost $53 billion on a Wednesday in October 2008 amid recession. Further, Apple's slowest profit growth in 10 years triggered a loss of almost $60 billion on January 24, 2013.
summary: अमेरिकी इतिहास में सबसे बड़े एकल-दिवसीय स्टॉक स्लैप क्या हैं?

text: RJD leader and Lalu Prasad Yadav's eldest son Tej Pratap on Thursday fell off his bicycle in Patna while protesting against rising petrol and diesel prices in the country. A video of the incident shows Tej falling off while taking a turn near a traffic circle. However, he quickly got up after the fall and continued the cycle protest.
summary: बढ़ती ईंधन दरों का विरोध करते हुए तेज प्रताप साइकिल से गिर गए

text: Nirav Tolia, Co-founder and CEO of Nextdoor, the social network for local neighbourhoods, would be stepping down after almost eight years. Tolia emailed employees that he will move into an "active" chairman role on the company's board once he finds his successor. Founded in 2010, the US-based networking startup lets people join community groups to interact with their neighbours.
summary: नीरव तोलिया को 8 साल बाद नेक्सटूर के सीईओ पद से हटना पड़ा

text: Uttar Pradesh's Partappur village head, who was wanted in two cases, was arrested on Wednesday when he showed at Jhinjhana police station to welcome a newly posted Station House Officer. The SHO said he arrested the head as soon as he was informed by his subordinates about his wanted status. He is allegedly involved in an attempt to rape case.
summary: वांटेड ग्राम प्रधान नए एसएचओ का स्वागत करने आता है, गिरफ्तार हो जाता है

text: A 13-year-old boy was sent to a remand home on Wednesday for allegedly raping his three-year-old neighbour in Maharashtra's Thane. Police said the boy took permission from the girl's grandmother to take her to his home, where he raped her while watching a pornographic clip on a mobile phone. The police is waiting for the girl's medical report.

text: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has said the procedure for a court marriage "must reflect the mindset of...changed times in a secular nation promoting inter-religion marriages". The court said this while ruling on an interfaith marriage case of a Hindu-Muslim couple. It added the Haryana government's Court Marriage Check List (CMCL) largely violates the couple's right to privacy.

text: On the 19th Kargil Vijay Diwas, PM Narendra Modi paid homage to soldiers who served India during the Kargil war. "Our brave soldiers ensured India remains protected and gave a befitting answer to those who tried to vitiate the atmosphere of peace," he tweeted. He also praised ex-PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee for providing "outstanding political leadership" to execute Operation Vijay.

text: An Egyptian zoo has been slammed for trying to deceive visitors by painting a donkey black and white to make it look like a zebra. The image of the fake zebra went viral after a student posted it on social media. However, zoo authorities refused to accept that the zebra was fake despite the evidence.
summary: मिस्र के चिड़ियाघर ने गधे पर धारियों को पेंट किया है ताकि इसे ज़ेबरा के रूप में पास किया जा सके

text: Shilpa Shetty, who won an amount of Ã¢ÂÂ¹10 lakh on the Salman Khan-hosted reality show 'Dus Ka Dum', has donated the money to her NGO named Shilpa Shetty Foundation, which provides shelter and education to orphans. "With this money, I want to rebuild the place. The renovation could easily cost Ã¢ÂÂ¹40-50 lakh, but it's a start," she said.

text: Television actress Ankita Lokhande has said she has decided to stop talking about her ex-boyfriend Sushant Singh Rajput. When asked about whether she can be friends with Sushant, she added, "I am okay being friends with an ex. You don't become enemies." Ankita further said, "Maybe, they are only meant to be with you for that particular time."

text: Barmy Army, a semi-organised group of English cricket fans, presented Team India captain Virat Kohli with International Player of the Year award for 2017 and 2018. "What a fantastic sport @imVkohli is for taking the time to accept 2 x Barmies Awards. We wish him and his team well for the series #maythebestteamwin #ENGvIND," England's Barmy Army tweeted.

text: Bengaluru-based video blogging startup Trell has raised Ã¢ÂÂ¹8.5 crore in its seed round of funding led by Singapore-based BeeNext and Mumbai-based WEH Ventures. text: TaxiForSure Co-founder Aprameya Radhakrishna-led knowledge sharing startup Vokal has raised about Ã¢ÂÂ¹34.5 crore in a Series A round of funding led by Chinese investor Shunwei Capital and 500 Startups. Existing investors Accel India and Blume Ventures also participated in the round. Vokal is an app-based local language question-answer platform for Indians and has both voice and text capabilities.

text: Slamming the Uttar Pradesh government over its draft vision document for Taj Mahal, the Supreme Court said, "Who is exactly the in-charge of the Taj Mahal? The left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing." "First environment ministry files affidavit, then ASI, then the Uttar Pradesh government. There has to be one authority which takes charge," it added.

text: TDP MP Thota Narasimham on Wednesday said that PM Narendra Modi "seems to have drowned in the River Ganga the promises he made to Andhra Pradesh". Adding that the state's people felt cheated, the MP said that the PM made a political speech during the reply to the no-confidence motion but didn't respond to the issues concerning Andhra.

text: The Haryana government has granted Ã¢ÂÂ¹8 lakh to the kin of the man who was lynched to death in Alwar recently. While the Sub Divisional Magistrate of Punhana handed a cheque of Ã¢ÂÂ¹5 lakh, another cheque of Ã¢ÂÂ¹3 lakh was given by state minister Rahish Khan. The victim was thrashed by locals who suspected him to be a cow smuggler.

text: DMK Working President MK Stalin demanded the resignation of Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and Tamil Nadu Deputy CM O Panneerselvam over the use of a military air ambulance to shift Panneerselvam's ailing brother. "It's a mystery...how a military helicopter was provided to a private individual," said Stalin. Panneerselvam visited New Delhi to thank Sitharaman but was denied meeting with her.

text: The brother of a rape victim allegedly raped the 15-year-old sister of the accused as revenge in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj on Tuesday. The brother and his friend offered the victim and her mother a lift in their jeep, raped the girl, and threw them out later. A case has been registered against four people in connection to the incident.

text: After US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said that the country rejects Russia's annexation of Crimea, the Russian Foreign Ministry has said the US fails to stick to commitments. Citing the US withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal and the Paris climate agreement, the Ministry added that the US foreign policy changes with change of leadership.

text: Hong Kong billionaire businesswoman Pollyanna Chu has lost 74% of her fortune, the biggest destruction of individual wealth in Asia this year. Pollyanna Chu, who started the year with $8.4 billion, is currently worth $2.2 billion, according to Bloomberg. She is the CEO of Kingston Financial Group which operates Macau casinos and margin-lending businesses.
summary: हांगकांग की महिला ने इस साल अपने $ 8.4 बीएन भाग्य का 74% खो दिया है

text: After Pakistani actress Mahira Khan was slammed for missing the Pakistan General Elections 2018, she took to Instagram to apologise for not being able to vote. "There was absolutely no way to delay my work commitment which was scheduled months in advance, I tried my best," she wrote. Mahira added, "I urge all of you to get out and vote!!"
summary: माहिरा लापता पाक चुनाव के लिए, ऑनलाइन माफी मांगती है

text: Former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif, who has been jailed for corruption, had also played professional cricket. Sharif was a right-handed batsman and got out for duck in his only appearance for Railways against Pakistan International Airlines in 1973-74 season. Former Pakistan cricket captain Imran Khan and Nawaz's brother, Shehbaz Sharif, have emerged as the frontrunners for the Prime Minister's post.
summary: नवाज शरीफ ने भी क्रिकेट खेला, केवल खेल में 0 पर आउट हुए

text: Facebook lost over $150 billion in valuation in two hours on Wednesday, suffering its history's biggest slump. The loss, which came after Facebook announced its slowest-ever user growth rate, is more than the market cap of India's most valuable company Tata Consultancy Services ($110 billion). Meanwhile, CEO Mark Zuckerberg's net worth also dipped by $16.8 billion to below $70 billion.
summary: एफबी भारत की सबसे बड़ी फर्म के मूल्य से 2 घंटे में $ 150 बीएन खो देता है

text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg lost $16.8 billion within 2 hours on Wednesday, sliding to the sixth place from third among the world's richest persons. Facebook, in its biggest-ever slump lost $150 billion in valuation, leaving Zuckerberg with less than $70 billion. Interestingly, Zuckerberg lost more than the net worth of India's second-richest person and Wipro Chairman Azim Premji ($15.5 billion).
summary: FB CEO, 2 घंटे में $ 16.8 bn खो देता है, जो दुनिया के 6 वें सबसे अमीर व्यक्ति के पास जाता है

text: After Samajwadi Party MLA Azam Khan requested Muslims to stay away from dairy business and cow trading for their safety, his wife Tanzeem Fatima has returned her cow over mob lynching fears. "We have returned a beautiful cow gifted to us by a seer over fears that someone might kill the animal and put the blame on us," Fatima said.
summary: सपा विधायक आजम खान की पत्नी भीड़ के डर से गाय लौटाती हैं

text: The Centre on Wednesday informed the Lok Sabha that all villages adopted by the MPs under 'Sansad Adarsh Gram Yojana', will be provided free WiFi services. Adding that the government has targeted to link each of the 2.5 lakh gram panchayats of India through optical fibre network, it said 1,13,091 gram panchayats have already been connected with high-speed internet.
summary: भारत भर के सांसदों द्वारा गोद लिए गए गाँवों के लिए मुफ्त वाईफाई

text: A woman in labour was carried on a cot by her family members to a hospital through flooded streets in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh after the ambulance service failed to reach on time. The video of the incident shows the woman being carried while it was raining. The ambulance was unable to reach their village due to severe floods and water-logging.
summary: मप्र में बाढ़ की सड़कों पर खाट पर लेटी महिला

text: After a passenger who travelled in Air India's Newark-Mumbai flight complained of bed bugs in their business class seats, the airline claimed, "Infestation may have happened due to the current weather conditions." Apologising for the inconvenience, Air India also offered to refund 75% of the passenger's fare. The passenger had tweeted a photo of bite marks all over her arm.
summary: एयर इंडिया बिजनेस क्लास में बेड बग के लिए मौसम को जिम्मेदार ठहराती है

text: A Tamil Nadu woman died due to excessive bleeding after she allegedly attempted to deliver the child at her residence by following YouTube videos on homebirth. "The contractions began at 2pm but she was taken to the Government Hospital at only 3.30pm after the baby was born," police said. Police have booked the woman's husband in connection to her death.
summary: YouTube वीडियो के साथ घर के जन्म का प्रयास करते समय महिला की मृत्यु हो जाती है

text: US President Donald Trump has postponed a second summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin until 2019, National Security Advisor John Bolton said on Wednesday. Bolton cited special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election as the reason for the delay. Earlier, Trump drew criticism over his invitation to Putin.
summary: ट्रंप ने अगले साल तक पुतिन के साथ दूसरी शिखर बैठक की

text: The football that Russian President Vladimir Putin gave to US President Donald Trump during a recent summit may have had a microchip, reports said. However, all gifts given to the US President are subject to thorough security screening. Earlier, a US Senator had said the football may be bugged, adding that it should not be allowed in the White House.
summary: ट्रम्प के लिए पुतिन के फुटबॉल में माइक्रोचिप: रिपोर्ट हो सकती है

text: US State Secretary Mike Pompeo on Wednesday confirmed that North Korea is still producing fissile material for nuclear bombs despite the deal signed between the leaders of both the countries. He added the US was engaged in "patient diplomacy" to persuade North Korea to give up its nuclear weapons, but would not let the process "drag out to no end".
summary: अमेरिका ने सौदे के बावजूद एन कोरिया के विखंडन सामग्री का उत्पादन करने की पुष्टि की

text: The White House will no longer make public the summaries of President Donald Trump's phone calls with world leaders, according to reports. The Trump administration has not published a readout of a call between the US President and a world leader since mid-June. However, it is unclear if the suspension is temporary or permanent.
summary: नेताओं के साथ ट्रम्प के आह्वान को सार्वजनिक नहीं किया जाना चाहिए: रिपोर्ट

text: US President Donald Trump's star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame has been vandalised by a pickaxe wielding man who later surrendered to police. The man, who did not reveal a motive for the act, is being held on $20,000 bail. Installed in 2007, Trump's star has been frequently vandalised since he was elected to office in 2016.
summary: हॉलीवुड वॉक ऑफ फेम पर ट्रंप के सितारे ने धूम मचा दी

text: India's benchmark index BSE Sensex hit the 37,000-mark for the first time during live-trading on Thursday while Nifty also touched an all-time high to reach 11,172.20 points. The boost in market sentiments was attributed to favourable government policies and a normal monsoon. Recently, the GST Council cut tax rates on 88 items whereas sanitary napkins were exempted from the levy.
summary: सेंसेक्स पहली बार 37,000 के पार, निफ्टी ने दर्ज किया हाई रिकॉर्ड

text: Shahid Kapoor, who is set to get his wax statue at the Madame Tussauds museum, has said the museum's team sent options for the poses and his wife Mira Rajput took the final call on it. "I didn't inform anyone in my family except Mira...The team didn't want me to talk about it for some time," he added.
summary: मीरा ने मेरी मोम की प्रतिमा की मुद्रा में अंतिम आह्वान किया: शाहिद

text: Researchers at the Israel Institute of Technology have discovered a Bluetooth bug which could allow hackers to intercept, monitor and manipulate the data exchanged between connected devices. The bug affects devices from Broadcom, Qualcomm, Intel, and Apple among others. While Microsoft said its devices aren't affected, researchers are yet to determine if Android or Google devices are at risk.

text: Walmart has partnered with Google spinoff Waymo for a pilot program to transport shoppers to and from Walmart stores to collect groceries in the US. After customers place an order on 'Walmart.com', they will be picked up by Waymo self-driving cars. The vehicles will then drive to the Walmart and wait outside until an employee brings out the customers' groceries.
summary: यूएस में वॉलमार्ट के दुकानदारों को ड्राइव करने के लिए वेमो की सेल्फ-ड्राइविंग कार

text: German automaker Porsche has unveiled the new Macan SUV in China featuring an 11-inch touchscreen, voice controls, and self-driving features. Its Traffic Jam Assist feature includes adaptive cruise control for comfortable driving at speeds up to 60 kmph, and assistance with steering in traffic jams. Porsche has sold more than 350,000 Macans since the model was introduced in 2014.

text: Talking about becoming a consumer goods maker, online grocer Grofers' Co-founder Saurabh Kumar in a recent interview said, "We want to completely move to a 100% private label firm in two to three years." Adding that customers are shifting towards private labels, Kumar also said, "Our strategy is to invest more in private labels, and slowly shift towards them."

text: Goa Congress MLA Pratapsingh Rane on Wednesday said that "countries that consume beef look after their cattle in a much better way". Adding that cows are mistreated because farmers lack the means to dispose of unsustainable cattle, he said, "Our cows are just cast off, forced to eat garbage and plastic and fall victim to road accidents."
summary: बीफ खाने वाले देश भारत से बेहतर गायों का इलाज करते हैं: कांग एमएलए

text: An employee of a supermarket in Chennai was allegedly beaten up after he stopped a policewoman from shoplifting on Wednesday. The employee had asked the policewoman to return the stolen goods and to write an apology note. She later returned to the store with her husband and a few others and attacked the employee.
summary: पुलिसकर्मियों ने दुकानदारों को दुकानदारी से रोकने के लिए पीटा

text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday ordered a CBI probe into the Muzaffarpur shelter home rapes case. The CM said that while state police were promptly conducting an investigation into the matter, the probe has been handed to the CBI to remove an "environment of confusion". Medical examination has confirmed that 29 of the 44 girls were sexually exploited.
