text: A man who made Ã¢ÂÂ¹3 crore from selling his land was rescued from kidnappers after the sunglasses they made him wear at night reportedly aroused the police's suspicion. The sunglasses were being used to conceal the blindfold on the victim. Police were also suspicious when they noted the car being used in the crime was a taxi with white plates.
summary: अपहरणकर्ता के रूप में पुलिस ने बचावकर्मी को रात में शेड्स पहनने को कहा

text: Calling on Russia to end its occupation of Crimea, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Wednesday said, "The US rejects Russia's annexation of Crimea and pledges to maintain this policy until Ukraine's territorial integrity is restored." Earlier this year, Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that he will not give back Crimea to Ukraine under any circumstances.
summary: अमेरिका ने रूस से क्रीमिया पर कब्जे को खत्म करने का आह्वान किया

text: A video of a Queen's Guard pushing a woman who was blocking his march at the Windsor Castle has surfaced online. The woman, who was beyond a rope barrier, can be heard screaming as she is pushed. The Guards usually yell "make way for the Queen's Guard" if a member of the public prevents them from carrying out their duties.
summary: वीडियो: रानी के गार्ड ने महिला को धक्का दिया

text: An advertisement for a matrimony meet in Bengaluru, titled 'The Grand National Young Achievers  Matrimony Meet', has gone viral after it listed "beautiful girls" under the category of 'Young Achievers'. The ad, published in The Hindu's Bengaluru edition, described the ideal clientele for the meet to be those from "ultra rich" families, youngsters from IITs, IIMs, or civil services.
summary: खूबसूरत लड़कियों को 'यंग अचीवर्स' कहने वाली मैट्रिमनी का विज्ञापन वायरल हो जाता है

text: Janhvi Kapoor, while speaking about the demise of her mother Sridevi during the time she was shooting for 'Dhadak', said, "I wanted to shoot the next day (after the cremation)." "But the shoot got cancelled. I was like, No...I need to be on the set," she added. Janhvi further said, "I'd have lost my mind if I didn't have 'Dhadak'."
summary: माँ के दाह-संस्कार के बाद धड़क के दिन की शूटिंग करना चाहता था: जान्हवी

text: French defender Benjamin Pavard's long-range goal against Argentina in the Round of 16 has been voted as the Goal of the 2018 FIFA World Cup. With this, Pavard has become the first European player to win the Goal of the Tournament award since its creation in 2006. Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo's free-kick against Spain came fourth in the voting.
summary: पावर्ड की स्ट्राइक गोल ऑफ डब्ल्यूसी; रोनाल्डो की फ्री-किक 4 सर्वश्रेष्ठ

text: During his three-nation tour of Africa, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Africa will be at the top of India's priorities. He added, "We will continue to intensify and deepen our engagement with Africa. As we have shown, it will be sustained and regular." India will strengthen its cooperation and mutual capabilities with Africa to combat terrorism and extremism, he added.
summary: यात्रा के दौरान पीएम कहते हैं कि अफ्रीका भारत की सर्वोच्च प्राथमिकता होगी

text: In a written reply to Rajya Sabha MP KR Arjunan, the Ministry of Home Affairs on Wednesday said that security agencies cannot track calls made using Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP). n"Because of encryption and propriety coding-decoding technique being used by VoIP provider, it's not possible to monitor the communication being provided by such services," the ministry added.
summary: इंटरनेट कॉल के माध्यम से सुरक्षा खतरे का पता नहीं लगा सकता है: सरकार

text: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) is planning to plant nearly 10 lakh saplings across the national capital during the ongoing monsoon season, the body said in a statement on Tuesday. Several big parks, green belts, bio-diversity parks, and the Yamuna flood plains fall under the jurisdiction of the DDA, the statement added.
summary: मानसून के दौरान दिल्ली भर में 10 लाख पौधे लगाने के लिए डीडीए

text: A girl who had posted on Facebook that she was going to commit suicide was saved by Assam Police after the company's US-based headquarters alerted them. The girl had updated her status to "I am gonna to commit suicide today", after which Facebook alerted the police and the child was located. The post was later deleted on police advice.
summary: फेसबुक द्वारा सचेत, असम पुलिस ने लड़की को ed Â € ™ के आत्महत्या के लिए उकसाया

text: Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani wrote a letter to Congress President Rahul Gandhi in 2017 on why his company got Rafale contract from the government. Gandhi alleged the joint venture between Dassault and Reliance was okayed by Centre despite latter having insufficient expertise in defence manufacturing. Ambani said the joint venture was an independent agreement between two private entities.
summary: अंबानी ने राहुल को लिखा कि रिलायंस को राफेल ठेका क्यों मिला

text: After being sentenced to two years in jail for riots during Patidar protests in 2015, Patidar leader Hardik Patel tweeted that BJP's 'Hitlershahi' can't suppress his voice from fighting for truth, farmers, youth and the poor. "If fighting for societal justice is sin, then I'm a sinner," he wrote further. A Ã¢ÂÂ¹50,000 fine has also been imposed on the leader.
summary: भाजपा के हिटलरशाही मेरी आवाज को दबा नहीं सकते: हार्दिक जेल की सजा पर

text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday took to Twitter to congratulate President Ram Nath Kovind on completing one year in the office. "He's endeared himself to every Indian with his wisdom and humility. He is extremely well versed in key policy issues," the PM wrote. "Rashtrapati Ji is also passionate about empowering the youth, farmers and poor," he further said.
summary: पीएम ने राष्ट्रपति पद पर 1 साल पूरा करने पर प्रीज कोविंद को बधाई दी

text: A Swedish activist prevented an Afghan asylum seeker's deportation by refusing to sit down until he was removed from the flight. Elin Ersson livestreamed her protest, a footage of which emerged on social media. Ersson is heard saying that the man will most likely get killed in Afghanistan following which both of them were taken off the plane.
summary: फ्लाइट में बैठने से मना करने पर महिला ने पुरुष को रोका

text: Clare Bronfman, an heiress to the Seagram's liquor fortune, has been arrested in a probe of a self-help organisation which prosecutors claim was a sex cult. The organisation allegedly branded its victims and forced them into unwanted sex. Clare, the daughter of late billionaire Edgar Bronfman, and three others were charged with identity theft, extortion, sex trafficking and money laundering.
summary: सेक्स पंथ मामले में सीज शराब की वारिस गिरफ्तार

text: Producer Boney Kapoor, while speaking about the compliments his daughter Janhvi Kapoor has received for her debut film 'Dhadak', said, "Shabana Azmi told me 'Has Janhvi done chupke se 25-30 films that you haven't released?'" He added that Shabana also said Janhvi looks very "polished" onscreen. "Rekhaji was in tears (after watching the film)," Boney further said. n
summary: शबाना ने पूछा कि क्या जान्हवी ने गुप्त रूप से 25-30 फिल्में की हैं: बोनी

text: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag has been named in the three-member Cricket Committee of the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA), which also includes former players Aakash Chopra and Rahul Sanghvi. Gautam Gambhir, who was removed as skipper last season, has been nominated as a special invitee. The committee is authorised to form selection committees and to give valuable guidance.
summary: डीडीसीए की क्रिकेट समिति में सहवाग, गंभीर को विशेष आमंत्रित

text: Twitter removed more than 1,43,000 apps between April and June which violated its policies, the microblogging platform has announced. The move is to tighten access to its application programming interfaces (APIs) that allow app developers to make automated Twitter posts. Twitter will limit the apps to 300 tweets and retweets per three hours and 1,000 likes per day.
summary: ट्विटर ने नीतियों का उल्लंघन करने पर 1 लाख से अधिक ऐप हटाए

text: Uber has resumed testing its self-driving cars on public roads, four months after the fatal crash which prompted the startup to shut down its testing program. The vehicles will not be driven in autonomous mode but instead will be manually operated by human drivers. The cars will feature an active driver monitoring system to keep tabs on the safety driver.
summary: घातक दुर्घटना के बाद उबर ने सेल्फ ड्राइविंग कारों का परीक्षण शुरू किया

text: BJP MLA Surendra Singh on Wednesday said, "Population of Hindus should increase. Every mahant believes that each Hindu couple should give birth to at least five children to keep...Hindutva intact." Earlier, BJP MP Sakshi Maharaj had given a similar statement, advising every Hindu woman to bear at least four children to protect the Hindu religion.
summary: हिंदुत्व को अक्षुण्ण रखने के लिए हिंदुओं के 5 बच्चे होने चाहिए: भाजपा विधायक

text: Slamming Prime Minister Narendra Modi for visiting Africa while the Parliament is in session, Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday said, "The meeting could have been avoided." "Prime Minister is out on a five-day tour...It was not an inevitable meeting. But, since he has the absolute majority, he chooses to go on foreign tours and skips Parliament sessions," Kharge added.
summary: मीटिंग से बचा जा सकता था: पीएम के अफ्रीका दौरे पर खड़गे

text: Surat Police has issued summons to former Gujarat BJP Vice President Jayanti Bhanushali in connection with a rape case against him. A 21-year-old girl from Surat has accused him of raping her multiple times since November 2017, after promising to get her admitted to a fashion designing institute. Bhanushali resigned from his position following the rape accusation.
summary: पुलिस ने बलात्कार के मामले में गुजरात भाजपा उपाध्यक्ष को तलब किया

text: Organisations such as Ram Sena, Hanuman Sena, Ayyappa Dharma Sena, among others, have called for a statewide strike against the Kerala government's decision to support women's entry inside the Sabarimala temple. As per the temple board's rules, women aged between 10 and 50 are prohibited from visiting the premises. The hearing on the matter is underway in the Supreme Court.
summary: सबरीमाला मंदिर में महिलाओं के प्रवेश का विरोध करने के लिए हिंदू संगठन

text: Two Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in Kashmir's Anantnag following an intelligence input about their presence inside a house, the police has said. The police said, "This was a difficult operation as it was in a crowded locality. All civilians were evacuated and the room intervention team completed the operation. There was no collateral damage."
summary: जम्मू-कश्मीर में मुठभेड़ में मारे गए 2 लश्कर-ए-तैयबा के आतंकी

text: Claiming Indian Railways was used for "political reasons" earlier, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday said, "The bullet train technology has arrived in India after a delay of 50 years because PM Narendra Modi has come now." Speaking of Congress, he said, "They should be happy that the bullet train project which they could not implement, this government is doing."
summary: बुलेट ट्रेनें 50 साल देरी से चलीं, फिर आए PM: पीयूष गोयल

text: A 50-year-old man named Rajesh Bangera has been arrested in Karnataka's Kodagu district by a Special Investigation Team (SIT) in connection with the Gauri Lankesh murder case. This is the tenth arrest the SIT has made in connection with the case. Senior journalist Gauri Lankesh was shot dead in Bengaluru last year.
summary: गौरी लंकेश हत्या मामले में दसवां संदिग्ध गिरफ्तार

text: Shiv Sena MLA Harshavardhan Jadhav and NCP MLA Bhausaheb Patil Chikatgaonkar have resigned from their positions in support of the Maratha community's demand for reservation in education and government jobs. Their resignation comes after the Maratha Kranti Morcha called off the bandh in Mumbai on Wednesday. CM Devendra Fadnavis has said the government is ready to negotiate with Maratha groups.
summary: महाराष्ट्र के 2 विधायकों ने मराठा कोटा की मांग के समर्थन में इस्तीफा दिया

text: Iran has said that it will never take part in one-sided negotiations with the US under threat. This comes after US President Donald Trump said he is ready to "make a real deal" with Iran. Iran filed an official letter of objection reportedly in protest against US State Secretary Mike Pompeo's speech wherein he compared Iran's leaders to a "mafia".
summary: खतरे में अमेरिका के साथ एकतरफा वार्ता में भाग नहीं लेंगे: ईरान

text: Financial services giant Motilal Oswal's MD Raamdeo Agrawal has said US President Donald Trump's tweets are affecting his investments in oil refining companies. "We are 70% to 80% dependent on oil imports and Trump is not helping," Agrawal added. "I don't know how many more tweets are yet to come. Every day he wants some new excitement," he further said.
summary: ट्रम्प के ट्वीट मेरे निवेश को नुकसान पहुंचा रहे हैं: मोतीलाल ओसवाल एमडी

text: Outgoing Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Subramanian has said the highest GST slab of 28% would be "virtually a hollow shell" over the next year or so. Notably, only 35 goods are left in the slab, from 226 at launch. He also said that a lot of effort and time was devoted to simplifying the burden on small and medium enterprises.
summary: 28% का जीएसटी स्लैब आभासी 'खोखला खोल' बन सकता है: सीईए

text: A 73-year-old British man has been reunited with his wedding ring 52 years after he lost it at a cricket match. The ring was found by a woman who slipped on a muddy bank near the ground while walking her dog and spotted the ring. She mentioned the ring to a spectator who turned out to be the man's brother.
summary: 52 साल बाद क्रिकेट पिच पर मिली वेडिंग रिंग

text: Mumbai-born spinner Ajaz Patel has been named in the New Zealand squad for the three-Test series against Pakistan, which is scheduled to start in October. The 29-year-old was the top wicket-taker in New Zealand's domestic first-class competitions for the last three seasons and the domestic Player of the Year in 2017. Patel has taken 187 wickets in 44 first-class matches.
summary: मुंबई में जन्मे स्पिनर का नाम टेस्ट बनाम पाकिस्तान के लिए NZ टीम में रखा गया है

text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that now whenever he comes across BJP MPs, they take 2 steps back thinking he will hug them. "You can fight someone with all your mind but hate is a choice," Gandhi said. "We'll take on PM and BJP but we don't need to hate them," he added.
summary: बीजेपी के सांसद 2 कदम पीछे सोच रहे हैं मैं उन्हें गले लगाऊंगा: राहुल गांधी

text: Jeep Compass SUV wasn't meant to come to India but was launched here due to a "real warm relationship" between Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata and Fiat Chrysler's former CEO Sergio Marchionne. The revelation was made by Jeep's Design Head, Mark T Allen. Marchionne, who was diagnosed with a type of cancer, passed away on Wednesday at 66.
summary: जीप कंपास, टाटा-फ़िएट के पूर्व सीईओ की दोस्ती के कारण भारत आई

text: Scientists in South Africa have discovered the earliest evidence of terrestrial life on Earth in the microbes fossilised within sedimentary rocks, which date back 3.22 billion years. It was previously believed that ocean to land transition happened 2.7 billion years ago. The new findings suggest oxygen-feeding bacteria accumulated near seafloor vents and got exposed as land emerged.
summary: स्थलीय जीवन के सबसे पुराने संकेत 3 बीएन-यार-पुरानी चट्टानों में पाए गए

text: Talking about mob lynching incidents across the country, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said, "Humans are important and cows are also important." "We'll provide protection to everyone, but it's the responsibility of every individual, every community and every religion to respect each other's sentiments...[Humans and cows] have their own roles in nature," he added.
summary: मनुष्य महत्वपूर्ण हैं, इसलिए गाय हैं: यूपी के सीएम योगी

text: Railway Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday praised a Railway Protection Force (RPF) constable for saving a woman from slipping under a train at Kanjurmarg railway station in Mumbai. "Heroic attempt by RPF constable Raj Kamal Yadav...I am very proud of our Railway family which is working non stop to ensure the safety and convenience of our passengers," the minister tweeted.
summary: गोयल ने जवान की प्रशंसा की, जिसने महिला को ट्रेन के नीचे गिरने से बचाया

text: A 25-year-old Indian student in Australia has died after being found critically injured at the house of a 19-year-old girl he met through a dating site. The teenager, who lived alone, has been arrested and charged with intentionally causing serious injury. Maulin Rathod, an accounting student, had moved to Australia four years ago for studying.
summary: 25 साल के भारतीय की मृत्यु ऑस में हुई उस लड़की से हुई, जिसके बाद वह ऑनलाइन मिली थी

text: Pakistan's intelligence agency ISI is helping new terror outfit Al Badr to organise attacks against India and Afghanistan, reports quoting intelligence inputs have claimed. The reports further claimed as many as 15 terrorists from Kashmir have joined the new terror group. Al Badr is reportedly collecting funds for its attacks and is also being helped by both LeT and JeM.
summary: ISI ने भारत पर नए आतंकी समूह हमले की मदद की: रिपोर्ट

text: The vote cast by PM candidate Imran Khan in the elections in Pakistan might be cancelled after a TV channel filmed him casting his vote. The Election Commission is going to examine if the video violates rules on the secrecy of ballot. The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party leader faces 6 months jail and Pakistani rupee 1,000 fine for violating ballot secrecy.
summary: पाक पीएम उम्मीदवार इमरान का वोटिंग वीडियो रद्द हो सकता है

text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday slammed his former lawyer Michael Cohen over reports that he taped a conversation in which the US President discussed paying former Playboy model Karen McDougal. She had claimed she had an affair with Trump in 2006. The audio tape was reportedly seized by the FBI during a raid on Cohen's office.
summary: किस तरह के वकील टेप क्लाइंट: ट्रम्प ऑन प्लेबॉय मॉडल पंक्ति

text: New Zealand's Parliament on Wednesday passed a law granting paid leave to victims of domestic violence. The victims will get up to 10 days of extra leave a year apart from annual holiday and sick leave. Parliamentarians said the leave entitlement would allow victims to go to courts and move away from abusive homes.
summary: घरेलू हिंसा पीड़ितों को छुट्टी देने के लिए न्यूजीलैंड

text: Around 100 people were killed in southwestern Syria on Wednesday in raids and suicide bombings carried out by the Islamic State, the Syrian authorities said. The militants launched simultaneous attacks on villages and killed residents in their homes, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights (SOHR). More than 170 people were injured in the attacks.
summary: सीरिया में कई इस्लामिक स्टेट हमलों में 100 लोग मारे गए

text: The Aadhaar OTP facility for e-verification of Income Tax Return (ITR) is temporarily unavailable due to technical issues. Meanwhile, the Income Tax Department said the assessees can use other options like Internet banking and demat accounts for e-verification. The department also noted that e-verification can be done up to 120 days from filing.
summary: अस्थायी रूप से आईटीआर ई-सत्यापन के लिए आधार ओटीपी सुविधा

text: Pakistani cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan listened to the 1992 World Cup theme song "Who Will Rule The World" in his car after casting his vote during Pakistan's General Election on Wednesday. "In a mindset to win; Imran Khan in a psyched up mood 1992 style," Imran's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf tweeted. Imran was captain when Pakistan won the World Cup in 1992.
summary: पाक के इमरान खान मतदान के बाद कार में 1992 डब्ल्यूसी गीत सुनते हैं

text: Brazilian forward Neymar barged a teenager to the floor after losing the ball to him during a five-a-side match. The PSG forward executed several tricks but the teenager kept his eye on the ball and successfully stole the ball. Reacting to the incident, a user tweeted, "I can't believe he stayed on his feet and didn't roll over 5 times."
summary: नेमार एक मैच में किशोर को गेंद खो देता है, उसे फर्श पर ले जाता है

text: Slamming PM Narendra Modi for his Africa tour, BJP leader Shatrughan Sinha tweeted, "Parliament is in session...Heavens wouldn't have fallen if you'd left after the session." He also criticised PM Modi for his silence on mob lynching incidents. "You'll gift 200 cows to a village (in Rwanda)..Back home, Opposition is in big news over lynching by cow rakshaks," wrote Sinha.
summary: शत्रुघ्न ने अफ्रीका यात्रा पर पीएम मोदी की खिंचाई, लुटने के मामले

text: The Centre on Tuesday said 53 rape cases involving foreigners were registered between 2014 and 2016. It added that 76 arrests were made in these 53 cases but one person was convicted. While 22 rape cases involving foreigners were registered in 2014, 12 cases were registered in 2015 and 19 cases were registered in 2016.
summary: 2014-16 के बीच विदेशियों से जुड़े 53 बलात्कार के मामलों की रिपोर्ट

text: The railways suffered a loss of around Ã¢ÂÂ¹90 lakh after a Mumbai road overbridge collapsed earlier this month, Minister of State for Railways Rajen Gohain informed the Lok Sabha today. He added, "The Commissioner of Railway Safety, Western Circle, has been nominated to conduct an inquiry." On July 3, the road overbridge collapsed on rail tracks in Andheri, injuring five.
summary: मुंबई पुल ढहने में रेलवे को Mumbai suffered L90L का नुकसान उठाना पड़ा: सरकार

text: Addressing the Lok Sabha, Minister of State for External Affairs VK Singh on Wednesday said that over 7,700 Indians are lodged in jails in foreign countries, adding that India spent over Ã¢ÂÂ¹2.7 crore between 2015-18 to assist them. Indian missions abroad provide airfare to facilitate the return of Indian prisoners who have completed their sentence, he further said.
summary: 7000 से अधिक भारतीयों ने विदेशों में जेलों में बंद: सरकार

text: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday said that Rohingya refugees were "illegal" and will not be permitted to thrive in India. Meanwhile, Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh has directed states to ensure that no Rohingya Muslim possesses Indian identity documents. Last month, Myanmar said it was willing to take back all Rohingya refugees.
summary: भारत में रोहिंग्याओं को पनपने नहीं दिया जाएगा: मंत्री

text: Two people have been arrested after a 22-year-old Dalit man was beaten to death by a mob for allegedly having an affair with a Muslim woman in Barmer, Rajasthan. The police said the victim succumbed to severe injuries as he was thrashed, while the mob also attempted to strangle him. Further investigation into the matter is underway.
summary: दलित व्यक्ति ने मुस्लिम महिला के साथ संबंध बनाए, 2 गिरफ्तार

text: A woman was killed and eight others were injured when part of an illegal three-storey building collapsed on a tenement and an adjoining public toilet in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi on Tuesday. The eight-year-old building had been declared dilapidated by authorities six months ago. Meanwhile, the police have registered a case of accidental death.
summary: महा में 3 मंजिला इमारत गिरने से महिला की मौत, 8 घायल

text: Addressing the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday, Minister of State for Home Hansraj Ahir said that PM Narendra Modi has asked the state governments to take strict action against cow vigilantes who practice violence. Adding that state governments are responsible for matters pertaining to crime, he said the Centre has issued advisories to states on maintaining law and order.
summary: पीएम ने राज्यों से कहा कि वे गौ-रक्षकों के खिलाफ कार्रवाई करें: सरकार

text: Many ad-hoc teachers including women tonsured their heads in Uttar Pradesh today to demand permanent jobs for those who have cleared the Teacher Eligibility Test (TET). Their demand also includes compensation to families of teachers who lost their lives in previous protests against the state government. In May, Brahmin teachers relinquished their 'janeu' (sacred thread) as part of the protest.
summary: यूपी के शिक्षकों ने मांग की स्थायी नौकरी, विरोध में टॉन्सिल प्रमुख

text: After Interpol informed India about Gitanjali Gems promoter Mehul Choksi's whereabouts, the CBI has written to Antiguan authorities seeking more information on him. Choksi is said to have taken a passport from the Caribbean nation, with which India does not have any extradition treaty. Choksi had earlier claimed that he was afraid of being lynched if he returned to India.
summary: CBI ने एंटीगुआ से मेहुल चोकसी पर विवरण मांगा

text: The Rajya Sabha on Wednesday passed the Fugitive Economic Offenders Bill, 2018, which empowers authorities to confiscate the assets of economic offenders who flee the country. The Lok Sabha had passed the bill on July 19. The bill proposes the formation of a special court under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act to declare a person a fugitive economic offender.
summary: भगोड़ा आर्थिक अपराधी विधेयक राज्यसभा में पारित

text: Scientists have found evidence of liquid water underneath the south pole of Mars using radar measurements from Europe's Mars Express Orbiter. The probe detected a 20-km-wide water body about 1.5 km beneath the surface, making it the first stable liquid water body found on the planet. Researchers said they tried to exhaust "every possible alternative" to arrive at the conclusion.
summary: वैज्ञानिकों ने मंगल की सतह के नीचे तरल पानी पाया

text: The body of a newborn was found with toilet paper stuffed in its mouth on a flight from Guwahati to New Delhi on Wednesday, according to the police. They believe the baby was delivered on board the flight in the toilet. Police suspect that the mother was an underage girl travelling from Imphal.
summary: दिल्ली फ्लाइट में मुंह में भरा कागज के साथ नवजात का शव

text: A 40-year-old police officer named Devchandra Nagle was beaten to death by an absconding criminal and his relatives he went to arrest in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara on Wednesday. Eight accused, including the criminal and three women, were arrested for attacking Nagle and his team with sticks and axes. While Nagle died on the spot, another policeman was left injured.

text: American television personality Kylie Jenner earns up to $1,000,000 (over Ã¢ÂÂ¹6 crore) per sponsored post, as per Instagram scheduling tool Hopper. Kylie, with a fan base of 111 million followers, topped Hopper's 2018 Instagram Rich List. She beat celebrities like Selena Gomez ($800,000), who was ranked second, and her half-sister Kim Kardashian ($720,000) who was ranked fourth in the list.

text: Italy-based photographer Alessio Mamo, who faced criticism for placing fake food in front of malnourished Indian children for a picture, has apologised. "The only goal... was to let western people think, in a provocative way, about the waste of food...Maybe I did it in the wrong way, but I worked honestly and respectfully with all the people involved," said Mamo.

text: A female volleyball player in Haryana has accused her coach of raping her on multiple occasions for more than two years. The minor girl registered a complaint to the police after her coach threatened to kill her if she dared to disclose about the crime. Police booked the coach under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offence (POCSO) Act.

text: Samsung has toppled Xiaomi to regain the top spot in the Indian smartphone market with a 29% share in the June quarter, according to market tracker Counterpoint Research. Xiaomi held a market share of 28%, Counterpoint data showed. Vivo, Oppo and Honor had 12%, 10% and 3% share of the smartphone shipment respectively in the June quarter.

text: Calling Rahul Gandhi's hug to PM Narendra Modi a "political stunt", Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath dared the Congress President to try and hug him. Rahul Gandhi should think at least 10 times before making such an attempt, he added. Instead of hugging leaders, Gandhi should embrace the people of India, he further said.

text: Gurugram-based Mediology Software's Readwhere CMS (Complete Mobile Solution) has been certified by Google Developers as a solution partner for building advanced mobile experiences in the News and Media vertical. It supports progressive web apps, accelerated mobile pages and native applications. Readwhere CMS is the world's first product to be certified by Google in the News and Media vertical.

text: The Prime Minister of India's residence at 7, Lok Kalyan Marg in Delhi, does not have an electricity meter and there's no electricity consumption record of the residence, an RTI query has revealed. As per rules, the Central Public Works Department is responsible for the maintenance of the government buildings. It also maintains the Parliament and the Rashtrapati Bhavan.
summary: PM के आवास में बिजली का मीटर नहीं है: RTI

text: As many as 111 people were killed in 822 incidents of communal violence in the country in 2017, Union Minister Hansraj Gangaram Ahir said on Wednesday. text: A couple in West Bengal's Malda was allegedly beaten up by neighbours on Tuesday because the two reportedly fought daily. The neighbours, who were "irked" by the fighting, started beating up the husband, who had to be hospitalised due to severe injuries.

text: Women in Pakistan's Upper Dir district voted for the first time on Wednesday since the country came into being in 1947, officials said. Pakistan's election commission said all votes in a constituency will become invalid if women are stopped from voting.

text: Filmmaker Aanand L Rai, while praising Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan, said, "If you know them personally, they'll never make you feel that they're stars." text: Twenty-three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has claimed she's a victim of "discrimination" as she's tested for drugs more than any other players. text: Facebook has obtained a licence to set up a startup incubator in China despite its website being banned in the country since 2009. text: Uber rival Lyft has been sued by a retired professor Stephen Dickerson for allegedly copying his patented technology underlying the core of Lyft's business model. text: A mob on Wednesday attacked four men, who were transporting a dead buffalo in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras. text: An 18-year-old female student of Delhi University's Bharati College allegedly committed suicide today in the college's washroom. She consumed pesticide in the college toilet, said the police. No suicide note was found and it has to be ascertained why she took the step, the police added.n

text: Singapore has disconnected computers from the Internet at its public healthcare centres to prevent cyber attacks. This comes after a cyber attack on the government's health database last week stole the personal information of nearly 15 lakh citizens, including Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong. text: Several restaurants across Pakistan are offering free food and free drinks in order to motivate people to vote as the country went to polls on Wednesday. text: Pakistan's Election Commission on Wednesday stated that a low turnout of women voters at any polling booth will result in the cancellation of all votes cast in that booth. text: Infosys Chairman Nandan Nilekani has said there should be a broader law on data protection and privacy, which applies to government and private agencies. text: Bruce Lee starrer 1973 action drama 'Enter The Dragon' is set to get a remake, as per reports. The film will reportedly be directed by filmmaker David Leitch, who earlier directed films like 'Deadpool 2' and 'John Wick'. No actor has been cast to play Bruce Lee's role yet, reports added.

text: US-based ride-hailing startup Uber completed over 10 billion trips since it was first launched eight years ago, the company has announced. text: The trillion-tonne iceberg that broke off from Antarctica's Larsen C ice shelf last July, travelled only about 45 km before getting stuck behind an elevated ice structure (star-marked), NASA satellite photos showed. text: During his visit to Uganda, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday announced to build a Gandhi Heritage Centre in Uganda's Jinja, where a statue of Mahatma Gandhi was installed. text: Addressing the Rajya Sabha, Home Minister Rajnath Singh said the government has fulfilled around 90% commitments made to Andhra Pradesh during its bifurcation to create Telangana. text: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday said that Rohingyas are illegal and "won't be allowed to thrive in India". text: At least 19 people have been killed and more than 100 are reported missing after an under-construction hydropower dam collapsed in Laos on Monday, the state media reported. More than 3,000 people needed to be rescued and 6,600 others were left homeless as the collapse triggered flash floods which swept away homes.
summary: लाओस में बांध गिरने के बाद 19 की मौत, 100 लापता

text: The Maratha Kranti Morcha, which has been spearheading the Maratha reservation protests, has called off the bandh in Mumbai city. Armed with saffron flags and banners, Maratha activists had taken out processions, blocked roads and even set a bus on fire. They also went around requesting shopkeepers to down shutters and express solidarity with their cause.
summary: मुंबई बंद का आह्वान करने वाले मराठा समूह

text: A 78-year-old woman and her 31-year-old grandson were killed after their car was sandwiched between two buses in Delhi's Nand Nagri on Tuesday. A speeding cluster bus hit the car at a roundabout, pushing the car into a DTC bus. Using iron cutters and hammers, rescuers took about 30 minutes to take out the victims, who died on the spot.
summary: दिल्ली में 2 बसों के बीच कार के कुचलने से महिला, पोता की मौत

text: Over 2 lakh people have signed a petition, addressed to Disney, to rehire 'Guardians of the Galaxy' director James Gunn, who was fired by Disney over old tweets where he joked about rape and pedophilia. "I'm smart enough to know this...won't change anything but hopefully, this could get Disney to realise [their] mistake," said the person who launched the petition.
summary: याचिका में डिज़नी को निर्देशक से बलात्कार पर पुराने ट्वीट्स के लिए नियुक्त करने के लिए कहा गया है

text: The trailer of Diana Penty and Sonakshi Sinha starrer 'Happy Phirr Bhag Jayegi', a sequel to the 2016 film 'Happy Bhag Jayegi', has been released. Both Diana and Sonakshi will portray 'Happy' in the film, which also stars Jimmy Sheirgill and Ali Fazal among others. Directed by Mudassar Aziz, 'Happy Phirr Bhag Jayegi' is scheduled to release on August 24.
summary: सोनाक्षी का ट्रेलर, डायना की 'हैप्पी फ़िर भाग जायेगी'

text: With a fan base of 23.2 million followers on Instagram, Team India captain Virat Kohli earns up to $120,000 (over Ã¢ÂÂ¹80 lakh) per sponsored post, as per Instagram scheduling tool Hopper. Among athletes, Cristiano Ronaldo was placed on top ($750,000), followed by Neymar Jr ($600,000) and Lionel Messi ($500,000). Kohli ranked 17th overall, being the only Indian in the list.

text: India Under-19 batsman Pavan Shah slammed 282 runs off 332 balls against Sri Lanka Under-19 to record the highest-ever score by an Indian in a Youth Test. The 18-year-old overtook Tanmay Srivastava's nearly 12-year-old record of 220 runs scored against Pakistan at Peshawar. The 282-run score is also the second highest in Youth Tests after Australia's Clinton Peake's 304*.
summary: U-19 टेस्ट में 18 साल के शाह ने 282 मारे, 12 साल पुराने रिकॉर्ड को तोड़ा

text: Google Cloud's CEO Diane Greene while announcing a partnership with coding platform GitHub on Tuesday remarked, "I'm sort of sad they're at Microsoft." The world's largest collaborative coding platform GitHub was acquired in June by Google's rival Microsoft for $7.5 billion in an all-stock deal. Earlier, Diane had said that Google wouldnÃ¢ÂÂt have minded buying GitHub.
summary: Microsoft में वे दुखी हैं: GitHub पर Google क्लाउड के सीईओ

text: Rajasthan BJP chief Madan Lal Saini has said that when Mughal emperor Humayun was dying, he asked father Babur to respect cows, Brahmins and women if he wants to rule in India. Significantly, Humayun's father Babur died around 25 years before Humayun. As per popular belief, Babur suggested that Humayun should distance himself from religious prejudices to win people's respects.
summary: हुमायूँ ने बाबर से कहा कि वह भारत पर राज करने के लिए गायों का सम्मान करे: राज भाजपा

text: A year after its merger with Flipkart fell apart, Snapdeal in a letter to its employees has claimed that the e-commerce startup was cash flow positive in June 2018. "We now have achieved the milestone of earning money from our business," the letter read. "We have no current or future dependency on any external funding," it added.
summary: स्नैपडील का दावा है कि यह कर्मचारियों के लिए पत्र में नकदी प्रवाह सकारात्मक है

text: An HIV positive man in Odisha committed suicide by hanging himself after he was allegedly denied treatment by government hospitals, police said. The man was supposed to undergo a surgery for his fractured hand but on learning he's HIV positive, the doctors started referring him to different hospitals without treating his hand. He was reportedly humiliated by fellow villagers too.
summary: अस्पतालों में इलाज से इनकार करने के बाद एचआईवी पॉजिटिव व्यक्ति आत्महत्या कर लेता है

text: Mumbai's St Xavier's College is set to get its first non-Christian Principal since its inception nearly 150 years ago after the appointment of Rajendra Shinde, currently heading the Botany department, as the 24th principal. Shinde, who has a PhD in Botany, will assume his post from September 1. In 2015, Agnelo Menezes had become the college's first non-Jesuit Principal.
summary: सेंट जेवियर्स कॉलेज को 150yrs में प्रथम गैर-ईसाई प्रिंसिपल पाने के लिए

text: David Headley's lawyer John Theis has dismissed reports that the 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind was battling for his life in Chicago, US, after being beaten by inmates at a detention centre. "Although I cannot disclose his location, he is neither in Chicago nor in a hospital," he said. Theis added that he was in regular communication with Headley.
summary: 26/11 के मास्टरमाइंड डेविड हेडली ने हमला नहीं किया

text: Over 50% students who applied for re-evaluation of their CBSE Class 12 examinations reportedly saw an increase in marks. Out of 9,111 students who applied for paper re-evaluation, 4,632 witnessed evaluation mistakes, according to reports. A Nagpur student, Ishrita Gupta, saw an increase of 22 marks in her Political Science paper as 17 of her answers were incorrectly scored.
summary: 50% सीबीएसई कक्षा 12 के बच्चों को अधिक अंक मिलते हैं, फिर से जाँच करें: रिपोर्ट

text: Acting New Zealand PM Winston Peters is demanding that Australia change its flag because it is too similar. "We had a flag that we've had for a long time, copied by Australia, and they should...honour the fact that we got there first with this design," Peters said. Notably, the New Zealand flag was adopted 52 years before the Australian flag.
summary: न्यूजीलैंड ऑस्ट्रेलिया से कहता है कि वह अपने झंडे की नकल करना बंद करे

text: US airlines including American Airlines, Delta Air Lines and United Airlines have changed how they refer to Taiwan on their websites to avoid Chinese penalties ahead of the July 25 deadline. China had demanded that foreign firms including airlines should not refer to Taiwan as a non-Chinese territory on their websites. China described the changes as "positive developments".
summary: अमेरिकी एयरलाइंस ने चीन की चेतावनी पर वेबसाइटों से 'ताइवान' हटा दिया

text: Ranbir Kapoor has doubled his endorsement fee to Ã¢ÂÂ¹6 crore following the success of his latest film 'Sanju', as per reports. "Ranbir has mostly 10 brands (endorsements) at any given time...This makes him quite exclusive," said Vijay Subramaniam, co-CEO of KWAN, the company that manages Ranbir's work. 'Sanju', which released on June 29, has earned over Ã¢ÂÂ¹500 crore worldwide.

text: The fixtures for the upcoming 2018-19 La Liga season have been announced, starting from August 19. Real Madrid, who will face Barcelona on October 28 and March 3, will commence a season without Cristiano Ronaldo for the first time after 9 years. Barcelona have won four of the last six La Liga titles, while Real managed to win only one.
summary: बारोआ, रियल मैड्रिड 28 अक्टूबर को खेलने के लिए, ला लीगा में 3 मार्च

text: German electronics company Bosch has developed a technology to alert self-driving vehicles to changing road conditions like icy bridges or rain-slick roads. The company has partnered with Finnish weather forecasting provider Foreca's road-weather experts for the service which will "alert to hazards before critical situations can develop". Bosch expects to roll out the service widely from 2020.
summary: बॉश सेल्फ ड्राइविंग कारों के लिए रोड कंडीशन अलर्ट विकसित करता है

text: India's leading carmaker Maruti Suzuki has said that it is recalling 1,279 units of the new Swift and Dzire models over possible fault in the airbag controller units. The recall will take place for models manufactured between May 7 to July 5, 2018. It will include the latest versions of the cars with the faulty parts being replaced for free.
summary: मारुति ने 1,279 स्विफ्ट, दोषपूर्ण एयरबैग्स पर डिजायर कारों को याद किया

text: New Delhi-based co-working space startup Awfis has raised $20 million in a Series C funding round from existing investors Sequoia Capital, The Three Sisters: Institutional Office, and InnoVen Capital. The latest funding round reportedly valued the startup at over $130 million. Founded in 2015, Awfis allows customers to book workplaces for durations ranging from an hour to 11 months.
summary: को-वर्किंग स्पेस स्टार्टअप Awfis ने $ 20 मिलियन जुटाए

text: The Mumbai Police has arrested a married couple running an investment firm for allegedly cheating 700 people from the city of nearly Ã¢ÂÂ¹40 crore. The accused would tell investors that they have huge capital and promised them 1.5 times their money in the form of returns in 100 days. Police have recovered Ã¢ÂÂ¹5.86 lakh from the accused so far.
summary: मुंबई के कपल ने of ¢40 करोड़ के 700 निवेशकों को धोखा दिया

text: Addressing the Indian diaspora in Uganda, PM Narendra Modi said, "It's possible that when you buy a smartphone in Uganda next time, you will get the one Made in India." Adding that India is becoming a manufacturing hub, PM Modi said, "Many of our products, including cars, smartphones, are sold today to countries from whom we used to import."
summary: आपका अगला स्मार्टफोन मेड इन इंडिया हो सकता है: युगांडा में पीएम

text: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur has alleged she was gangraped by four people, including her husband, in the name of Nikah Halala. The woman claimed she was given Triple Talaq before being married to someone else for three months. Nikah Halala is the practice wherin a man cannot remarry a woman unless she marries and divorces someone else.

text: Police have arrested seven men for allegedly harassing and insulting a woman over her caste after she was appointed to a school as a cook in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur. A group of parents had protested against her appointment, stating they wouldn't let their children go to the school. The Block Development Officer had then reportedly issued a transfer order.
summary: 7 को TN में उसकी जाति पर स्कूल कुक को परेशान करने के लिए गिरफ्तार किया गया

text: The European Commission has offered to pay countries Ã¢ÂÂ¬6,000 (over Ã¢ÂÂ¹4.8 lakh) per person to take in migrants crossing the Mediterranean on boats. The Commission said it would pay for the cost of personnel who process the asylum requests. The Commission also proposed setting up "regional disembarkation platforms" outside the European Union to process migrants rescued at sea.

text: India's drug regulator Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation has reportedly asked Johnson and Johnson (J&J) to reveal the composition of its talcum powder. The move comes after J&J's US parent was ordered to pay $4.7 billion Ã¢ÂÂon claims that asbestos in its powder caused ovarian cancer. Talcum powder is made from talc, a mineral composed of silicon, magnesium and oxygen.
summary: नियामक जेएंडजे को पाउडर सामग्री प्रकट करने के लिए कहता है: रिपोर्ट

text: The Prevention of Corruption (Amendment) Bill, 2018, which seeks to punish both bribe givers and takers, was passed in Parliament on Tuesday. The Bill provides for imprisonment from three to seven years, besides fine, to those taking bribes. Bribe givers have also been included in the legislation for the first time, liable for imprisonment up to seven years, and/or fine.
summary: बिल जो संसद में पारित रिश्वत देने वालों को दंडित करता है

text: At least 25 people have been killed and over 20 others have been injured in an explosion near a polling booth in Pakistan's Quetta, according to reports. The blast reportedly targeted a police vehicle. Pakistan has deployed over 3.7 lakh troops at 85,000 polling stations across the country to oversee the general elections being held today.
summary: पाकिस्तान में पोलिंग बूथ के पास विस्फोट में 25 की मौत

text: Speaking about his children Arjun, Anshula, Janhvi and Khushi coming together after Sridevi's demise, Boney Kapoor said, "They've happened through...different mothers but why should they get affected?" "They're...my blood. They had to come [together]," he added. While Arjun and Anshula are Boney's children from his late ex-wife Mona Shourie, Janhvi and Khushi are from his second wife Sridevi.
summary: मेरे बच्चे अलग-अलग माताओं से हैं, लेकिन उन्हें क्यों प्रभावित करना चाहिए: बोनी

text: Abhishek Bachchan responded to a troll who mocked Anurag Kashyap for casting him in his film 'Manmarziyaan'. After Anurag tweeted 'Manmarziyaan' will premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival, a user commented, "From Kay Kay Menon to...Nawazuddin. All Great choices. But...Abhishek?...It's all about loving the film stars??" Replying to this, Abhishek wrote, "He called me a film star!!!"
summary: अभिषेक ने अनुराग को कास्टिंग के लिए ट्रोल करने का जवाब दिया

text: Veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar has said that she would love to sing for late actress Sridevi and producer Boney Kapoor's daughter Janhvi Kapoor, who recently made her acting debut with 'Dhadak'. The 88-year-old singer added, "Boney too is a close family friend. After he lost Srideviji so suddenly, his daughter's debut is a reason for him to smile."
summary: मुझे जान्हवी कपूर के लिए गाना पसंद है: लता मंगेशकर

text: Team India will get no rest day before the 50-over Asia Cup match against Pakistan on September 19, as per the schedule of the six-team tournament. However, India will play against the last-placed team on September 18, which will be decided by qualifiers between UAE, Singapore, Oman, Nepal, Malaysia and Hong Kong. Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and Afghanistan have already qualified.

text: A passenger who travelled on Air India's Newark-Mumbai flight last week has tweeted pictures of bed bug bites she allegedly got on the plane. The woman, who was travelling business class with her three children, claims she developed rashes all over her body. Further, she alleged she got a seat change only a short while before landing in Mumbai.

text: A Gujarat court on Wednesday sentenced Patidar leader Hardik Patel to two years in jail in connection with the vandalism of BJP legislator Rushikesh Patel's office in Visnagar during 2015 Patidar reservation protests. A Ã¢ÂÂ¹50,000 fine has also been imposed on the leader. Out of the total 17 people accused in the case, the court found three, including Hardik, guilty.

text: Sharing an Amul poster on Rafale deal, Congress President Rahul Gandhi has tweeted, "India has had 4 "RAFALE Mantris". But, none of them know what really transpired in France. Except the PM." Stating that India has had "4 revolving Raksha Mantris" since 2014, Rahul said, "It gave the PM space to personally re-negotiate RAFALE with the French."

text: A lawyer in Chandigarh allegedly gave his wife Ã¢ÂÂ¹24,600 in the form of Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 and Ã¢ÂÂ¹2 coins and four Ã¢ÂÂ¹100 notes as part of her Ã¢ÂÂ¹25,000 monthly maintenance in a divorce case. The wife then approached the court, calling it "sheer harassment". Justifying his action, the lawyer said there's no guideline stating the denomination to pay the maintenance money.
summary: वकील ने एक ,1 और wife ¢ 2 सिक्कों में पत्नी को yer ,24,600 रखरखाव दिया

text: A 23-year-old female IAS aspirant, named Priyanka, died hours after she checked into a Gurugram guest house facility on Monday with a male acquaintance, the police said. The man, Ravinder Yadav, was seen carrying the woman to a hospital and later fled. An autopsy revealed that the woman died due to "a partial rupture of liver leading to internal bleeding".
summary: पुरुष मित्र ने बुक किया गुरुग्राम घर में मृत मिला IAS आशिक

text: The Centre has asked states to appoint nodal officers of the Superintendent of Police rank in each district to monitor social media content to curb incidents of mob violence. Advising states to conduct awareness campaigns to reduce such incidents, the Centre said special task forces should be set up to report on people likely to be involved in such crimes.
summary: सोशल मीडिया पर नज़र रखने के लिए नोडल अधिकारी पाएँ: सरकार राज्यों से पूछती है

text: Telangana Police jailed a groom and eight others for obscenity and not taking prior permission to host a belly dancing event at a wedding reception. "Russian dancers brought in from Mumbai and Delhi had performed obscene dances at the reception," police said. The incident came to light when the event's video was posted on social media.
summary: ग्रूम, 8 अन्य रिसेप्शन में बेली डांसिंग इवेंट में जेल गए

text: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal has said "My next target is to ensure no prostitution in Delhi" after CM Arvind Kejriwal extended her term. She noted that such activities had been going on in Delhi in red-light areas like GB Road. Prostitution is "the worst form of slavery and legalising the trade would promote trafficking," Maliwal added.

text: The Speaker of the Iranian Parliament Ali Larijani has said US President Donald Trump's recent threats against the country are the "words of a troublemaker" pursuing "ignorant diplomacy". "The US is experiencing disorder and wildness in its diplomatic relations," he added. Earlier this year, Larijani said Trump is not capable of identifying and judging the long-term consequences of his actions.
summary: 'ट्रबलमेकर' ट्रम्प ने 'अज्ञानी कूटनीति' अपनाई: ईरान

text: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority has directed private satellite TV channels to stop airing any content related to the general elections being held today. TV channels were airing footages of campaigns, which ended on July 23. It further directed channels to not air any opinion polls or surveys as that might influence the voters and the electoral process.
summary: पाक टीवी चैनलों ने चुनाव संबंधी सामग्री को प्रसारित करने से रोकने के लिए कहा

text: Revealing that he built his physique for 'Race 3' in four months, Bobby Deol said, "Had I trained well in my 20s, I'd...have had the best physique in Bollywood." "I sense that people look at me differently [now]," he added. The 49-year-old actor further said, "Heading to the gym takes a lot...but once you start seeing results, you're instantly motivated."
summary: अगर मैं अपने 20 के दशक में प्रशिक्षित होता, तो मुझे B'wood: बॉबी में सबसे अच्छा शरीर मिला होता

text: Researchers at MIT have created self-powered robots the size of human egg cells that can sense the environment, store data, and carry out computational tasks. They consist of tiny electronic circuits made of two-dimensional materials that attach themselves to insoluble, minuscule particles called colloids. The robots could be used for diagnostic functions in the human body, researchers claimed.
summary: एमआईटी स्व-संचालित रोबोटों को मानव अंडा कोशिकाओं के आकार को विकसित करता है

text: Google has updated its Chrome browser to include a feature which marks all HTTP sites as "not secure" in the address bar. The interface will help users understand that all HTTP sites are not secure, and will put pressure on sites to support HTTPS. The "S" in HTTPS stands for "secure", implying the communication between browser and website is encrypted.
summary: Google Chrome अब सभी HTTP साइटों को 'सुरक्षित नहीं' के रूप में चिह्नित करता है

text: Talking about AIADMK's support to the Centre in the no-confidence motion, Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami said that the party's goal is to have a "cordial" relationship with the Centre. Adding that AIADMK isn't concerned about what other CMs think about the decision, he said, "Did any other CM support our MPs when they stalled Parliament over the Cauvery issue?"
summary: लक्ष्य का केंद्र के साथ सौहार्दपूर्ण संबंध है: TN CM

text: A Canada-based study has identified a mechanism that allows the brain to recreate vivid sensory experiences like the smell from memory. Researchers found mice smelled new odours for longer periods of time and didn't return to spots which carried the same smell. The findings could explain why the loss of ability to smell is an early symptom of Alzheimer's disease.
summary: गंध और स्मृति के बीच संबंध खुला

text: The Maratha Kranti Morcha has said that it is carrying out a peaceful protest in Maharashtra for reservations for the community and are not blocking any roads. It added that workers have been told not to inconvenience the police or the government. This comes amid reports of stone-pelting and torching of vehicles by protestors in some areas.
summary: कोटा के लिए शांतिपूर्ण विरोध प्रदर्शन: मराठा क्रांति मोर्चा

text: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Tuesday rescued 16 girls in Munirka, who were reportedly being trafficked from Nepal to Iraq and Kuwait. Adding that the victims were locked up in a small room and their passports taken from them, DCW chief Swati Maliwal tweeted, "Seven other girls have already been sent to Kuwait and Iraq 15 days ago."
summary: नेपाल से तस्करी कर लाई गईं 16 लड़कियों को DCW ने दिल्ली में छुड़ाया

text: Telangana Irrigation Minister T Harish Rao on Tuesday said that if Andhra Pradesh is granted Special Category Status, then Telangana should too. Adding that industries will be moved to Andhra Pradesh if it is alone is given special status, he said, "Do the Telangana Congress leaders support SC status for Andhra at the cost of Telangana?"
summary: तेलंगाना को आंध्र को विशेष दर्जा मिलना चाहिए: मंत्री

text: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami on Tuesday named a six-month-old female lion cub in Vandalur Zoo as Jaya, after late Chief Minister Jayalalithaa. Jayalalithaa was an animal lover, who had taken measures for basic infrastructure in the zoo, the CM said. He further inaugurated two enclosures for tigers and a play area for children inside the zoo.
summary: जयललिता के बाद चिड़ियाघर में तमिलनाडु के सीएम का नाम शेर शावक है

text: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Tuesday said he was confident South Pacific nations would choose the US as an ally over China. text: The Democratic Republic of Congo has declared the end of an Ebola outbreak which was first reported in the month of May in Bikoro province. text: Inflation in Venezuela could top 1,000,000% by the end of the year as the country faces its worst economic crisis, the International Monetary Fund has said. text: Three lawsuits have been filed against the US-based startup JUUL Labs alleging that its patented recipe has led to nicotine addictions among users. The suits claim that the startup deceptively marketed the product as safe when it contains more potent doses of nicotine than cigarettes. The complainants seek monetary damages, as well as an injunction to curb JUUL's marketing practices.

text: A speeding Jaguar car, whose driver was reportedly drunk, injured several people and rammed into around ten vehicles on Monday in Mumbai. The driver was beaten up by bystanders before being handed over to the police, officials said. The driver has been arrested and a probe into the matter is underway, the officials added.

text: Toxic foam from the Bellandur lake in Bengaluru has now reached the Lakshmi Sagara lake in Kolar. Last year, the National Green Tribunal had ordered a complete shutdown of 76 polluting industries around the lake.

text: A 27-year-old man died on Monday after jumping into the Godavari river as part of a 'Jal samadhi' agitation for reservation quota for the Maratha community. Following his death, Maratha Kranti Morcha workers vandalised several vehicles and blocked the Mumbai-Pune highway, reports said. They demanded the youth be declared a martyr and his family be given compensation of Ã¢ÂÂ¹50 lakh.
summary: मराठा कोटे से नदी में कूदने से आदमी की मौत

text: The Centre on Monday confirmed that, according to a study by the Central Ground Water Board, the groundwater in the SIPCOT area of Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin where the Sterlite copper plant is located is polluted. Notably, the plant was closed two months ago following a protest which resulted in the death of 13 protestors in police firing.
summary: भूजल, जहाँ स्टरलाइट संयंत्र स्थित है दूषित: सरकार

text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday wrote to CBSE seeking a probe into the alleged leak of personal data of NEET 2018 candidates. Adding that it is alleged the data of over 2 lakh students is available on certain websites for a price, Gandhi said the leak "highlighted the serious lack of safeguards to prevent data breach".
summary: राहुल NEET 2018 के उम्मीदवारों के डेटा लीक की जांच चाहते हैं

text: Sheena Bora's brother Mikhail on Monday testified in her murder case in a Mumbai court, alleging he was tortured at a mental hospital for a month at the behest of their mother Indrani. He added Indrani plotted this to prove he is mentally unstable since he called her mother instead of sister. Indrani is accused of murdering Sheena in 2012.

text: Model-actor Milind Soman, on being asked about the age gap of 26 years between him and his wife Ankita Konwar, replied, "It doesn't matter to us. Does it to you?" text: The upcoming eleventh season of Coke Studio Pakistan will be featuring two transgender singers as revealed by its promo, released on Monday. text: Using tiny 2-D materials, researchers have built microscopic chemical sensors that can be sprayed as aerosols. Each sensor comprises a chip with dimensions 1 micrometer x 100 micrometers with circuits that include a chemical detector and photodiode, which converts light into electric current. The devices could help monitor environmental pollution or diagnose diseases, said researchers.

text: Google's parent company Alphabet posted a 26% increase in year-over-year quarterly revenue at $32.7 billion. Last week, Google was fined a record $5.1 billion by the European Union for illegally abusing its Android market dominance. Advertising remained the key revenue source for Google, pulling in $28 billion in the three months ending in June, a 24% rise from last year.

text: Google parent Alphabet ended 2018's second quarter with cash reserves of $102 billion and saw its employee headcount rise to 89,000 from 75,000 a year ago, the company revealed. Alphabet subsidiaries including self-driving car unit Waymo and life sciences division Verily registered a 49% revenue jump from last year but still made operating loss of $732 million in last quarter.

text: August 1 will mark the day humanity's annual demand for natural resources will exceed what the planet can provide for the year, a date that arrived two days sooner than last year, according to the Global Footprint Network. The day is marked as Earth Overshoot Day, which has moved up from late September in 1997 to August 1 in 2018.

text: After his visit to Hathras on Monday, Yogi Adityanath became the first Uttar Pradesh CM to visit all the 75 districts in the state in 16 months of his government's rule. text: India has extended Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,378 crore ($200 million) lines of credit (LOCs) to Rwanda after PM Narendra Modi held talks with the nation's President Paul Kagame. The two countries signed agreements on industrial and agricultural development. PM Modi, who is the first Indian Prime Minister to visit the country, also announced that the first Indian diplomatic mission would be opened there.

text: A mob thrashed four women and stripped two of them on Monday after they suspected them to be child lifters in West Bengal's Daukimari village. Reportedly, two of the women had gone to a bank in the village, while one was visiting a relative and the fourth one was out to sell clothes. No arrest has been made yet.

text: The police have arrested self-styled godman Asif Noori in Maharashtra after videos of him forcing male devotees into unnatural sex with each other circulated online. Operating out of a madrasa, the 38-year-old godman targetted young married men on the pretext of solving their problems with divine powers. He would sedate them before forcing them to engage in unnatural sex.

text: After being released at Attari-Wagah border, a 16-year-old Pakistani prisoner in India said, "I don't want to go back. India is good. I can get a job. I wish Indian government would let me stay." The teen had allegedly crossed the border by mistake when he was arrested and had been here for 14 months.

text: Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif on Monday slammed threats made by US President Donald Trump, warning him to "be cautious". "Unimpressed...We've been around for millennia and seen fall of empires, (including) our own, which lasted more than the life of some countries," he said. text: Vowing to continue his war on drugs, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on Monday said the fight would be "as relentless and chilling as on the day it began". Adding that the crackdown aimed to stop drugs destroying families, Duterte said, "Your concern is human rights, mine is human lives." Over 4,500 people have been killed in Duterte's war against drugs.

text: Actress Disha Patani has said that she believes everything goes hand in hand, adding, "If you work hard, only then will your luck chip in." "You can get something due to good fortune but then, that will stay only for a very small span of time," she further said while talking about how hard work is required to maintain success.

text: Actor Shahid Kapoor is set to get his wax statue at the Madame Tussauds museum. The actor shared a photo of him from the measurements session and captioned it, "Keep an eye out. Coming soon." Earlier, Deepika Padukone had announced that she will get a wax statue at London's Madame Tussauds.

text: American swimmer Ryan Lochte, a winner of 12 Olympic medals including six gold medals, was handed a 14-month ban by the US Anti-Doping Agency for an anti-doping violation. text: Intel has shared a video showing how its artificial intelligence (AI) is helping to protect the Great Wall of China. The AI uses a data-driven model to detect damaged area of the remote and dangerous section of the Wall. The data is then processed, which allows preservationists to calculate time, labour and cost of materials without performing on-site measurements.
summary: वीडियो: चीन की महान दीवार को बचाने में मदद करने वाली इंटेल की AI

Along with testing on public roads, Krafcik also said Waymo has covered 5 billion miles in simulations.

text: Data breach incidents in India have been higher compared to the global average, according to a survey by defence grade technology maker Thales. Indian companies with $100 million and $1 billion revenue were covered in the report.

text: Trinity supercomputer, hosted at the Los Alamos National Lab, US, has made a world record of creating 1 trillion files in two minutes. The files represent an individual particle's trajectory, velocity, temperature, and spin among other data points. The supercomputer would take snapshots of all trillion particles and rewind through their trajectories to locate them.

text: Goa BJP leader Dattaprasad Naik has called Congress President Rahul Gandhi a "loafer" for winking at fellow MPs after his hug with PM Narendra Modi in the Parliament. text: A video showing German astronaut Alexander Gerst performing live with Kraftwerk band from space has been revealed by the European Space Agency. Gerst's musical instrument of choices was a tablet computer with a virtual synthesizer.nn

text: The government on Monday said that it has asked all states and union territories to communicate the ill-effect of single-use plastic to temples, mosques, gurudwaras and churches. The government further added that offices under its own administrative control have been asked to eliminate single-use plastic.

text: An 18-year-old student in Haryana's Jind was stabbed to death on Saturday during a fight between two groups of school students over talking to a girl. The victim and his friends were allegedly attacked with knives by the other group after the teacher left their classroom. The accused stopped the fight when the faculty intervened and then fled the spot.

text: Bihar JD(U) leader Ashok Saw was arrested on Sunday for supplying Maoists with liquor and arms. Police had been on a lookout for Saw since the recovery of a huge quantity of explosives concealed in a field.

text: Democratic candidate Willie Wilson, who is running for mayor of Chicago, US, was seen handing out hundreds of thousands of dollars in cash to potential voters in a church last week, allegedly to "help them pay property taxes". text: A fake news of WhatsApp introducing a third blue tick for chats being read by the government is doing rounds online. WhatsApp, which is dealing with fake news crisis, said last week it is limiting forwarding messages to only five chats at once in India.

text: The first humans to land on the Moon, Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin, left behind over 106 items including tools, space gear, and even human waste. text: Responding to his rumoured ex-girlfriend Nora Fatehi saying 'Who is Angad?' on being asked to comment on his wedding with Neha Dhupia, Angad Bedi said, "I'm nobody to comment on...what [others] feel." "All I want to look forward to is a good future in cinema," he added. Angad further said he wants to make time for his "loving wife".

text: Portugal's 33-year-old forward Cristiano Ronaldo's medical for his new club Juventus has revealed that his fitness is similar to a 20-year-old's. text: Former Team India captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni has emerged as the highest individual taxpayer in Jharkhand for 2017-18 after he paid Ã¢ÂÂ¹12.17 crore in the financial year. text: Qualcomm on Monday unveiled the new QTM052 mmWave antenna module that will enable 5G networking spectrum to work with mobile phones. The size of a penny, the module features four antennas that can accurately point toward the nearest 5G tower. Earlier, Samsung, LG, Sony, HTC and Xiaomi said they will work with Qualcomm to launch 5G-ready phones by 2019.

Slamming PM Narendra Modi for taking a "U-turn" on the special status promised to Andhra Pradesh, he added, "Telugu people would never forget how the Centre had deceived them."

text: Scientists have discovered that our galaxy, Milky Way, once had a massive sibling galaxy that was shredded by our neighbour galaxy, Andromeda. The galaxy, named M32p, would have been the third biggest galaxy in our local galaxy group, behind Andromeda and Milky Way. Notably, Milky Way and Andromeda will collide to form a larger galaxy in about four billion years.

text: Infosys Co-founder and the brain behind Aadhaar, Nandan Nilekani has said he will be perfectly fine if Supreme Court rules that Aadhaar is non-mandatory for citizens. He added, "If you want to do surveillance, just use your mobile phone."

text: Constitutional matters heard by Chief Justice Dipak Misra can be live-streamed on trial basis, the Centre told the Supreme Court on Monday. Attorney General KK Venugopal said the live-streaming can be undertaken for around three months to understand how it functions technologically. The SC also instructed Venugopal to compile suggestions from various parties and submit them for the SC's approval.
summary: CJI द्वारा सुनाए गए संवैधानिक मामलों को लाइव-स्ट्रीम किया जा सकता है: सरकार

text: After police booked a woman with no prior criminal records under Goondas Act in Tamil Nadu's Theni, the Madras High Court asked if it had to meet "Goondas targets". The act defines 'Goonda' as a person who habitually commits crimes. However, the accused was booked after she pushed a neighbour's mother during an argument, following which the elderly woman died.
summary: क्या आपके पास मिलने के लिए गुंडा एक्ट के लक्ष्य हैं: एचसी ने टीएन पुलिस की खिंचाई की

text: Narendra Modi on Monday arrived in Rwanda, becoming the first Indian Prime Minister to visit the east African country. During his two-day state visit, PM Modi will meet business leaders and the Indian communities in Rwandan capital Kigali. PM Modi will also gift 200 cows as a contribution from India to Rwanda's 'Girinka' (one cow per family) scheme.
summary: नरेंद्र मोदी पहले भारतीय पीएम हैं जिन्होंने रवांडा का दौरा किया

text: Justice Tahira Safdar was on Monday nominated as the first woman chief justice of a Pakistani high court. She will take charge of her new role following the retirement of incumbent Balochistan High Court Chief Justice Muhammad Noor Meskanzai on August 31. In 1982, Safdar became the first woman civil judge in Balochistan.
summary: पाकिस्तान को उच्च न्यायालय की पहली महिला मुख्य न्यायाधीश मिली

text: Iran has overtaken Saudi Arabia to become the second largest oil supplier to Indian state-owned firms during the June quarter, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said. Oil imports from Iran were only second to Iraq. However, Pradhan did not answer the question if the government has asked oil companies to reduce imports from Iran due to the threat of US sanctions.
summary: ईरान ने सऊदी को भारत के दूसरे सबसे बड़े तेल आपूर्तिकर्ता के रूप में पछाड़ दिया

text: Confirming that he will be starring in Priyanka Chopra's 'The Sky Is Pink', Farhan Akhtar shared the upcoming film's draft on Instagram with a caption, "It all starts here." The film revolves around Aisha Chaudhary, who became a motivational speaker after being diagnosed with pulmonary fibrosis at the age of 13.

text: Actress Trisha has said that she is not a feminist at all and that she believes in equality. "Gender bias is universal, something that is there in every industry," she added. "Fortunately, my journey has been very cushioned in this industry. I have not felt the bias," she further said.
summary: मैं बिल्कुल भी नारीवादी नहीं हूं और मैं समानता में विश्वास करती हूं: त्रिशा

text: Television actor Saumya Tandon, who plays the role of Anita Vibhuti Narayan in the TV show 'Bhabiji Ghar Par Hai!', has denied the reports that stated she is quitting from the show. "I had a liver infection so was on a leave for a week," she tweeted. "Have been shooting since 3 days," she further wrote.

text: WWE wrestler Braun Strowman met an astrologer who read his palm during his visit to India. WWE took to Twitter to share the picture of the astrologer reading the wrestler's hand, captioning it, "Can you guess what (Strowman's future) looked like?" Reacting to it, a user tweeted, "Jo Vince ji chahenge vhi Braun ka future hoga."
summary: WWE के स्ट्रोमैन को भारत में एक ज्योतिषी द्वारा पढ़ा गया उनका हाथ मिलता है

text: Maruti Suzuki has crossed production of 20 million vehicles in India at its Gurugram and Manesar facilities, becoming the first carmaker in the country to cross the milestone. The feat has been attained in 34 years and 6 months since the start of production in December 1983. Maruti Suzuki exports the vehicles made in India to more than 100 countries.
