text: Online video game PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) has apologised for its reference to Japan's military regime during World War II via in-game content. The item in question was a pilot mask with a decoration resembling the Imperial Japanese Military's "Rising Sun" insignia. Following criticism from Korean and Chinese players, PUBG removed the pack from sale and refunded players who bought it.
summary: PUBG खेल आइटम के माध्यम से द्वितीय विश्व युद्ध का उल्लेख करने के लिए माफी माँगता है

text: Photo-sharing app Snapchat is shutting down its digital payments service Snapcash next month on August 30 after four years of its launch. "Yes, we're discontinuing the Snapcash... our first product created in partnership with another company, Square," a spokesperson confirmed. Launched in 2014, Snapcash allowed users to send money to friends' bank accounts without leaving the app.
summary: स्नैपचैट 4 साल के बाद अपनी भुगतान सेवा Snapcash को बंद करने के लिए

text: Slamming BJP, Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray said, "Our women are unsafe today, and you are protecting the cows." He said he did not accept the Hindutva being adhered to in India in the last three to four years. He added, "We don't want Hindus who just go to ring bells in temples sporting a 'choti' and a 'janoi thread'."
summary: गायें सुरक्षित हैं लेकिन हमारी महिलाएं असुरक्षित हैं: उद्धव ने भाजपा को पटकनी दी

text: A woman from Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr has filed a petition against Nikah Halala in the Supreme Court, following which the SC tagged her petition with similar petitions. The practice allows a Muslim man to remarry his estranged wife after she consummates marriage with another man and divorces him. Earlier, the Centre said it will oppose Nikah Halala in the SC.
summary: SC में निकाह हलाला के खिलाफ याचिका दायर करती यूपी की महिला

text: Congress MLA Rupjyoti Kurmi went down on his knees to apologise to patients admitted to a hospital in his Mariani constituency in Assam over the poor availability of healthcare services. Kurmi said that none of the eight doctors appointed by the state government were available at the hospital during his visit. Meanwhile, BJP dismissed Kurmi's actions as "drama".
summary: असम के विधायक घुटनों के बल बैठकर मरीजों से माफी मांगते हैं

text: A group of women on Sunday sat on a JCB machine in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior to protest against an anti-encroachment drive by the Gwalior Municipal Corporation. The women began the protest after some houses were demolished as part of the High Court-ordered drive. A video of the incident shows the women shouting against the corporation.
summary: अतिक्रमण विरोधी अभियान के विरोध में महिलाएं जेसीबी मशीन पर बैठीं

text: A class four student was found hanging from an iron rod in his hostel room at a boarding school in Darjeeling district, West Bengal, the police said today. The boy was found by the hostel superintendent after he missed dinner. His family claimed it was impossible for a class four boy to hang himself, and lodged a murder complaint.
summary: पश्चिम बंगाल में हॉस्टल के कमरे में कक्षा 4 का छात्र लटका मिला

text: IT services giant Wipro has won a $1 billion, seven-year contract from US-based HR solutions provider Alight Solutions, as per reports. This is Wipro's largest deal since June 2014, when it won a $1.1 billion order from Canadian logistics firm ATCO. Notably, Wipro's larger rival TCS won three multi-year deals worth $5.6 billion since December last year.
summary: Wipro ने US-आधारित Alight Solutions से $ 1 बिलियन का IT सौदा जीता

text: India's benchmark index Sensex closed above 36,700 for the first time on Monday led by gains in FMCG and consumer durable stocks. The GST Council on Saturday cut rates on over 50 goods including refrigerators, televisions, footwear and paints. Sensex rose 222 points to close at an all-time high of 36,718.6 while the Nifty ended 74 points higher at 11,084.75.
summary: जीएसटी दर में कटौती के बाद सेंसेक्स पहली बार 36,700 के ऊपर बंद हुआ

text: Bihar Police started to dig up the compound of a government-funded shelter home in Muzaffarpur over allegations that an inmate was killed and buried by the staff in the premises. Medical reports confirmed that 16 girls of the shelter home were raped, Muzaffarpur SSP Harpreet Kaur said. Ten people have been arrested in the case so far.
summary: बिहार आश्रय गृह में 16 लड़कियों का बलात्कार, पुलिस ने 1 के शव के लिए खुदाई

text: Japanese multinational Sony has unveiled the IMX586 stacked CMOS image sensor for smartphones, which it claims has the world's highest pixel count with 48 megapixels. The sensor can be squeezed into a phone-sized 8.0 mm diagonal unit. The sensor rivals high-performance SLR cameras, making it possible to capture high-resolution images even with a smartphone.
summary: सोनी ने दुनिया के पहले 48 मेगापिक्सेल स्मार्टफोन सेंसर का खुलासा किया

text: Former PM Indira Gandhi faced 15 of 27 no-confidence motions moved in Lok Sabha, while Lal Bahadur Shastri and PV Narasimha Rao faced three each during their 19-month and five-year tenures respectively. The first such motion was moved against Jawaharlal Nehru's government in 1963. Manmohan Singh, who served for ten years, is the only PM who didn't face no-confidence motion.
summary: पूर्व पीएम इंदिरा को लोकसभा में 27 में से 15 न्यासों की मंशा का सामना करना पड़ा

text: Bengaluru-based budget hotel chain Treebo Hotels has fired between 70 to 80 of its employees which make about 10% of its total workforce of 800 employees. The startup said the layoffs were a result of process improvements and investments in technology. The firings come a few months after MakeMyTrip delisted Treebo Hotels from its platform.
summary: बेंगलुरु का ट्रीबो होटल अपने कर्मचारियों की संख्या का 10% हिस्सा है

text: Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu on Monday informed the MPs that they can submit notices for discussion and question hour through an app. He added that the requirement of submitting a physical notice hasn't been removed. The Vice President further directed all members to approach House officials for updates on their notices since he may not have all the information.
summary: राज्यसभा सांसद ऐप के माध्यम से चर्चा के लिए नोटिस प्रस्तुत कर सकते हैं

text: A mentally-challenged woman was allegedly lynched by a mob in Madhya Pradesh's Morwa on suspicion of child-lifting. The woman was seen in the area months prior to the incident and her images were circulated on WhatsApp along with rumours that she kidnapped children, reports said. Over 30 people have been killed in last two months over such rumours, reports added.
summary: मानसिक रूप से विक्षिप्त महिला बच्चे को पालने की अफवाहों से पल्ला झाड़ लेती है

text: The head of the Samajwadi Party's minorities panel said on Monday that husbands give triple talaq to their wives so that they don't have to murder them. He explained, saying "If you find your wife in a compromising situation with another man, what will you do? You will either kill her or give triple talaq to get rid of her".
summary: पुरुष ट्रिपल तालक देते हैं ताकि उन्हें पत्नी को मारना न पड़े: सपा नेता

text: Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday informed the Parliament that the Rafale deal with France is on track, adding the delivery of the 36 fighter jets will start in September 2019 and be completed by April 2022. This comes amidst allegations from Congress President Rahul Gandhi that Sitharaman lied to the nation about the deal under PM Narendra Modi's pressure.
summary: ट्रैक पर राफेल सौदा, जेट विमानों की डिलीवरी 2019 में शुरू: सरकार

text: The US has sold more weapons to its foreign allies in the first six months of 2018 than in the whole of 2017, according to the Defence Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA). Adding that defence exports are good for national security, the DSCA said the figures from the last fiscal, which stood at $41.9 billion, had been surpassed by $5 billion.
summary: 2017 के मुकाबले अमेरिका ने 2018 के 6 महीनों में अधिक हथियार बेचे

text: The government's move to slash GST rates on over 50 goods will lower revenue by as much as Ã¢ÂÂ¹15,000 crore each year, according to reports. The GST Council on Saturday cut tax rates on several items including sanitary napkins, washing machines, refrigerators and lithium-ion batteries. Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal had said that the revenue loss will be minimal.
summary: जीएसटी की दर में कटौती से एक वर्ष में ¢ a15,000 करोड़ का कर राजस्व कम हो सकता है

text: Actor Anupam Kher, who will portray former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh in upcoming biopic 'The Accidental Prime Minister', shared a picture which shows actors playing Sonia Gandhi and Lalu Prasad Yadav. The picture also shows actors portraying various other politicians and former President APJ Abdul Kalam. 'The Accidental Prime Minister' is scheduled to release on December 21.
summary: मनमोहन की बायोपिक से पिच पर अभिनेता सोनिया, लालू का किरदार निभा रहे हैं

text: Reacting to Mesut ÃÂzil's retirement from international football, Turkey's Justice Minister Abdulhamit GÃÂ¼l tweeted, "I congratulate Mesut ÃÂzil who by leaving (German) national team has scored the most beautiful goal against virus of fascism." ÃÂzil, who has Turkish heritage, retired citing "disrespect and racism". He was criticised by German football federation for a picture with Turkey's President.
summary: फासीवाद बनाम सुंदर लक्ष्य: तुर्की मिन-ए-ज़िल जर्मनी को छोड़ देता है

text: Indian spinner Mokit Hariharan, playing for the VB Kanchi Veerans in the Tamil Nadu Premier League, bowled with both arms in his team's match against Dindigul Dragons. Hariharan was bowling left-arm spin to right-handed batsman but then changed his bowling arm while facing a left-handed batsman. Hariharan also made an unbeaten 77 during his side's batting.
summary: भारतीय स्पिनर तमिलनाडु में दोनों हाथों से गेंदबाजी करते हैं

text: Reacting to Indian wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant's Instagram video in which he is seen performing acrobatics, Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal commented, "Apollo circus se offer aaya hai bro Haan kardun after seen ur dis video?" Responding to the comment, the 20-year-old Delhi cricketer wrote, "yes plz but I'll be joining with you".
summary: अपोलो सर्कस से ऑफर आया है: पंत की कलाबाजी पर चहल

text: Indian cricketer Gautam Gambhir posted a video on Instagram of his elder daughter Aazeen completing the Yo-Yo test, the fitness test that is mandatory for selection into the Indian cricket team. Many former cricketers including Sachin Tendulkar have been critical about the test and have said that the test should not be the sole criterion for selection into the team.
summary: गंभीर ने अपनी बेटी का यो-यो टेस्ट पूरा करते हुए वीडियो पोस्ट किया

text: German midfielder Mesut ÃÂzil, who retired from international football over "racism", slammed German football federation's President, saying for him "I am German when we win, but I am an immigrant when we lose." "Why am I German-Turkish...I was born and educated in Germany, so why don't people accept that I am German?" his statement further read.
summary: 'मैं जर्मन हूँ जब हम जीतते हैं, एक आप्रवासी जब हम हार जाते हैं': Ã z-zil

text: Pakistan's Hassan Ali, who pulled up a neck muscle while performing his 'bomb explosion' celebration in the second ODI against Zimbabwe, asked teammate Shadab Khan to perform it in fifth ODI. The pacer asked Shadab to perform the move after dismissing Zimbabwe captain Hamilton Masakadza in the 15th over. Shadab pulled off the move while Ali stood next to him.
summary: पेसर टीम के साथी से अपने 'बम विस्फोट' समारोह को करने के लिए कहते हैं

text: Alibaba has joined a $600 million funding round for Chinese AI startup Megvii along with other investors including Boyu Capital, according to reports. The startup, which already counts Ant Financial Services as an investor, is expected to close this round of funding within weeks. Founded in 2011, the startup provides face-scanning systems to companies including Lenovo Group.
summary: अलीबाबा AI स्टार्टअप मेगवी के लिए $ 600 मिलियन फंडिंग राउंड में शामिल हुआ

text: Addressing the Bihar Assembly on Monday, CM Nitish Kumar said the liquor ban was introduced in the state to help the poor people as they were wasting a major portion of their income in purchasing alcohol. The state Assembly has approved amendments to the alcohol prohibition law to ensure that it is not misused against innocent people.
summary: गरीबों की मदद के लिए पेश है शराब बंदी: बिहार के सीएम नीतीश

text: At least five members of a family were killed after a fire broke out in a residential building in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district on Monday. Initial reports suggest that a cylinder blast was responsible for the fire, which broke out when a wedding party returned home late at night. The deceased included the parents of the groom and his sister.
summary: हिमाचल में बिल्डिंग में आग लगने से एक परिवार की मौत

text: A nine-year-old girl was allegedly gangraped and killed along with her minor brother on Sunday in Bihar. Their bodies were found on the bank of a river after a search was launched as they did not return home that evening. The police said, "The parents have identified three persons of the same village as the culprits."
summary: बिहार में नाबालिग भाई के साथ गैंगरेप, 9-वर्षीय लड़की की हत्या

text: Accusing Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi Palaniswami of 'Himalayan corruption', DMK Working President MK Stalin on Monday met with Governor Banwarilal Purohit seeking a CBI probe into the matter. In a two-page petition, Stalin claimed the CM had allocated around four contracts pertaining to road construction and maintenance to firms owned by his son's father-in-law.
summary: स्टालिन ने 'हिमालयी भ्रष्टाचार' के लिए TN CM से की CBI जांच की मांग

text: Reacting to Congress President Rahul Gandhi's post on the Alwar lynching case, Railways Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted, "Stop jumping with joy every time a crime happens." Calling Gandhi a "merchant of hate", the minister added, "The state has already assured strict and prompt action. You divide the society in every manner possible for electoral gains and then shed crocodile tears."
summary: हर अपराध पर खुशी के साथ कूदना बंद करें: राहुल को पीयूष गोयल

text: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday skipped the annual puja at Lord Vitthal Temple in Pandharpur and performed the rituals at his Mumbai residence after Maratha groups seeking reservation threatened to disrupt the event. Fadnavis, who performed the puja for three years, said he skipped the event this year to ensure the safety of 10 lakh devotees at the temple.
summary: विरोध की धमकियों के बीच पंढरपुर मंदिर में पूजा के दौरान महामंत्री ने की पूजा

text: Retired SC Judge Jasti Chelameswar, who had earlier voiced concerns regarding the administration of the SC, has urged people to raise their voices even if they are labelled "anti-national". He said, "An opinion on public issues has to be expressed without any fear even if it is against popular opinion." All political parties "unilaterally think they are right", he added.
summary: भले ही आपको एंटी-नेशनल टैग मिले: रिटायर्ड एससी जज

text: Two people were killed and two others suffered injuries after a 100-year-old building collapsed in Kolkata's Sealdah on Monday night. Kolkata Municipal Corporation councillor Aparajita Dasgupta claimed that the corporation had alerted the occupants about the dangers posed by the two-storey building multiple times, adding that a bigger disaster could have taken place at the site.
summary: कोलकाता में इमारत गिरने के बाद 2 की मौत

text: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has decided to block transactions made within the same account using different UPI IDs, effective August 1. NPCI said these transactions "do not serve any use case and also add unnecessary load on the system." Reports said the ban is aimed at stopping customers from making multiple and unnecessary transaction to get cashbacks.
summary: 1 अगस्त से प्रतिबंधित यूपीआई के साथ खुद के बैंक खाते में फंड ट्रांसफर

text: The Supreme Court on Monday said there cannot be any "blanket ban" on holding protests at Delhi's Jantar Mantar and Boat Club near the India Gate. The verdict came in response to several petitions, including one that challenged the National Green Tribunal's last year's decision to ban all protests at these places, saying such activities violate environmental laws.
summary: जंतर मंतर पर विरोध प्रदर्शन पर "कंबल प्रतिबंध" नहीं हो सकता: एससी

text: An advertisement by Kalyan Jewellers featuring Amitabh Bachchan and his daughter Shweta Nanda was taken down after being slammed by the All India Bank Officers' Confederation. The ad allegedly showed the characters being mistreated by bank employees. The bank union had earlier called the ad 'disgusting', and said it aimed to create distrust in the banking system.
summary: आलोचना के बाद अमिताभ, बेटी श्वेता का विज्ञापन वापस ले लिया

text: OnePlus, as a part of its back-to-school-sale, is offering exclusive deals to the students from July 23 to July 30. During the sale, the company is offering bumper discounts to students on the purchase of OnePlus products. It is offering Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,500 off on OnePlus 6 and 20% off on OnePlus 6 cases and covers purchased via exclusive OnePlus stores.
summary: OnePlus ने भारत में छात्रों के लिए OnePlus 6 पर छूट की घोषणा की

text: India-born engineer Rohit Prasad spearheaded the development of Amazon's voice assistant Alexa almost from its inception five years ago along with Amazon executive Toni Reid. Prasad, who has his family in Jharkhand's Ranchi, did his schooling from DAV and engineering from Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra. He currently works as VP and Head Scientist of Alexa Artificial Intelligence at Amazon.
summary: कौन है रोहित प्रसाद, अमेज़न के एलेक्सा के पीछे भारतीय इंजीनियर?

text: Shiv Sena's chief Uddhav Thackeray explained his party's stand on abstaining from voting during the no-confidence motion, saying that the party is a friend of the Bharatiya Janata and not any other party. "Of course we are part of the government but if something is wrong we will talk about it," Thackeray said in the interview.
summary: हम भारतीय जनता के मित्र हैं, किसी पार्टी के नहीं: शिवसेना

text: The Uttar Pradesh Police's official Twitter handle on Sunday used a reference from Netflix series 'Sacred Games' in a tweet warning against spreading fake news. It tweeted a poster featuring actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui's character Ganesh Gaitonde along with #UnSacredGames. Earlier, the UP Police used a scene from actor Amitabh Bachchan's 'Deewaar' to warn against spreading rumours and fake news.
summary: यूपी पुलिस नकली समाचार पर ट्वीट में पवित्र खेलों के संदर्भ का उपयोग करती है

text: The police have arrested the alleged mastermind behind the gangrape of five women NGO activists in Jharkhand. The women were kidnapped by armed men while performing a street play and then gangraped in a forest. The mastermind is also suspected to be behind the kidnapping of four policemen in retaliation for raids conducted to arrest those accused in the gangrape.
summary: J'khand में 5 NGO कार्यकर्ताओं के बलात्कार के पीछे मास्टरमाइंड गिरफ्तार

text: A Station House Officer (SHO) in Delhi has been transferred to police lines after a photo showing him getting a "healing" head massage from self-styled godwoman Namita Acharya went viral. The photo was posted on Facebook by Acharya, who has earlier given head massages to several MPs and police officers. Meanwhile, a vigilance inquiry has been initiated against the SHO.
summary: गॉडवूमन से सिर की मालिश करवाने के बाद कॉप का तबादला

text: Frida, a Labrador Retriever who helped rescue people following last year's earthquake in Mexico City, has been honoured with a statue. A figurine of one of her trainers has been placed next to her statue. A plaque in front of the statues reads, "Memorable symbols of the strength Mexicans can have when we decide to come together for great causes."
summary: मेक्सिको में भूकंप के दौरान लोगों को बचाने वाले कुत्ते को खुद की मूर्ति मिलती है

text: A senior commander of Iran's Revolutionary Guards Brigadier General Gholamhossein Gheybparvar has said threats by US President Donald Trump against the country amount to "psychological warfare". Adding that Iran will resist pressure from enemies, Gheybparvar said, "We will never abandon our revolutionary beliefs...US wants nothing less than (to) destroy Iran (but) Trump cannot do a damn thing."
summary: ट्रम्प की धमकियाँ हैं 'मनोवैज्ञानिक युद्ध': ईरान जनरल

text: A passenger aircraft made an emergency landing in Moscow, Russia, after a dog opened the luggage compartment from the inside, triggering an alarm onboard. The alarm went off when the passenger aircraft was at an altitude of 4,000 metres (13,000 feet). Following the emergency landing, it was revealed that the dog's cage was not properly locked.
summary: कुत्ता सामान ढोने वाले मिड-फ़्लाइट को खोलता है, लैंडिंग को मजबूर करता है

text: France's Minister of Economy and Finance Bruno Le Maire has referred to US President Donald Trump's trade policies as "the law of the jungle", saying that a trade war is now a reality. "The law of the jungle will only turn out losers, it will weaken growth, threaten the most fragile countries and have disastrous political consequences," he added.
summary: ट्रम्प की व्यापार नीतियां 'जंगल का कानून' हैं: फ्रांस

text: A video of the Toronto mass shooting suspect who killed one person and injured 13 others has surfaced online. The footage from the scene shows a man walking down a street before pulling out a handgun and firing into an eatery. Toronto Police Chief Mark Saunders said they are looking at all possible motives.
summary: टोरंटो मास शूटिंग संदिग्ध कैमरे पर पकड़ा गया

text: HCL Technologies Founder and Chairman Shiv Nadar has made a donation of Ã¢ÂÂ¹1 crore to the Lord Venkateswara temple in Tirupati. Nadar handed over a demand draft for Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,00,00,001 to a temple official after offering prayers. He requested Tirumala Tirupati Devasathanams, which manages the shrine, to utilise the fund for a hospital trust run by it for differently-abled people.
summary: शिव नाडर ने तिरुपति मंदिर को ¢ ar1 करोड़ का दान दिया

text: Saif Ali Khan, while talking about his and Kareena Kapoor Khan's son Taimur Ali Khan, has said that for them as parents of Taimur, it's important to give him a lot of time. He added, "Kids get affected if they are with their nannies all the time." "Taimur is so happy when he is with us," he further said.
summary: हमारे लिए बेटे तैमूर को बहुत समय देना महत्वपूर्ण है: सैफ

text: The MS University of Baroda in Gujarat has cancelled the booking for comedian Kunal Kamra's show after it received a letter from 11 former students complaining that his content was "anti-national". Stating that Kamra mimicked the national anthem and openly supported the "Tukde-Tukde Gang", the letter alleged an "ideological conspiracy to pollute the minds of Barodian youth ahead of 2019".
summary: वर्सिटी कॉमेडियन के शो को 'देश-विरोधी' कंटेंट पर रद्द करता है

text: Sri Lankan batsman Danushka Gunathilaka has been suspended from international cricket after a Norwegian woman accused his friend of raping her in a hotel room where he was present. The 27-year-old and his friend took two Norwegian women to the hotel where he was staying in Colombo on Sunday. Gunathilaka's friend was arrested and police are investigating the incident.
summary: दोस्त ने बलात्कार के आरोपी को निलंबित कर दिया श्रीलंकाई क्रिकेटर

text: Air India apologised immediately after its officials stopped the Indian Table Tennis team, including 17 players and officials, from boarding the Delhi-Melbourne flight on Sunday. The team was on its way to participate in the ITTF World Tour Australian Open. CWG gold medalist Manika Batra took to Twitter to complain about it, tagging the Sports Minister and the PM Office.

text: Worms were found in the midday meal served to primary school students in West Bengal, following which parents lodged a protest with school authorities. A student said, "When I pointed out that there were worms in the meal, the teacher brushed it aside saying they were cumin seeds (jeera)." Meanwhile, the parents have threatened to intensify their protest.

text: Security forces on Sunday killed three militants involved in the abduction and murder of a police constable in J&K's Kulgam. The militants, part of a joint group of militant outfits Lashkar-e-Taiba and Hizbul Mujahideen, were trapped after a cordon-and-search operation by the Army, police, and CRPF. The constable was tortured by the militants, Director General of Police SP Vaid said.

text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Saturday tweeted a picture of PM Narendra Modi performing aarti without removing his shoes in front of a person dressed as Lord Ram during a Ramleela event in Delhi last year. text: A youth allegedly shot dead an elderly man after the latter opposed to him visiting a neighbouring girl's house in Allahabad. The youth told the police he loved the girl and had wanted to impress her. He allegedly killed the man after an argument with his neighbours, following which he was arrested and the murder weapon was seized.

text: Five people drowned on Sunday after they were washed away due to floodwaters while bathing in the Cauvery river in Tamil Nadu. The incident followed the release of excess water from the Stanley reservoir of the Mettur dam. Authorities said that they had issued mandatory warnings about possible flooding before and after the release of excess water.

text: One person has died after an under-construction building collapsed in Ghaziabad on Sunday. Authorities said seven people had been rescued, of which six had been admitted to the hospital. UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has instructed authorities to visit the site of the collapse and take action against those guilty.
summary: एक की मौत, 7 गिर गए गाजियाबाद की इमारत से बचाया

text: South Korea-based fashion brand Stylenanda has apologised after Twitter users accused it of darkening a model's hand in their latest advertisement to sell a new nail polish. text: Reliance Jio's Group Chief Technology Officer Jagbir Singh and Bharti Airtel's Chief Technology Officer for Mobile Networks Shyam Prabhakar Mardikar have resigned from their companies. text: Actor Jackie Shroff has shared a video on Twitter where he is seen managing traffic on a road in Lucknow. text: In an article condemning incidents of violence by India's "Hindutva" forces, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said, "It seems safer in many places these days to be a cow than a Muslim." text: At least 11 people were killed and 14 others were wounded in a suicide bombing outside the Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul, Afghanistan. text: A New Zealand-based e-will managing company Perpetual Guardian is said to make a four-day work week permanent for employees after a two-month trial for the same turned out to be a success. text: The GST Council has pruned the 28% slab by cutting rates on 191 goods over the past one year, leaving just 35 items in the highest tax bracket. The Council on Saturday cut rates on TV, fridge and washing machine among others.

text: Hina Khan, who has been accused of fraud by a jewellery brand but denied the charges, has sent a counter legal notice to the company for defamation. text: Four-time F1 world champion driver Lewis Hamilton tried to push his car back to the pit-lane after it suffered a hydraulics leak during German Grand Prix's opening qualifying session on Saturday. text: Lancashire medium-pacer Jordan Clark produced a hat-trick against Yorkshire in the County Championship on Sunday, which involved dismissals of two of world's top four Test batsmen. text: MS Dhoni, during a match against Australia in his first away tournament as ODI captain, asked his teammates to not celebrate once India won, a book has revealed. text: Italian design firm CRA-Carlo Ratti Associati has developed a 'writing' robot that can draw and erase images uploaded from a user's smartphone on any vertical surface like a wall. text: Google is reportedly working on an operating system (OS) called 'Fuchsia' which will replace Android. text: Responding to a journalist's article criticising meaningless conversations on Twitter, CEO Jack Dorsey has said that there is a need to focus on "conversational dynamics within Twitter". text: Researchers at the Stanford University have developed a wearable sensor patch which can detect stress levels from a user's sweat. The patch, which when applied directly to the skin, absorbs sweat and assesses within seconds how much cortisol, or the stress hormone, a person is producing. It also features a waterproof layer to protect the patch from contamination.

text: Following a meeting of the newly constituted Congress Working Committee, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "If a party leader gives a wrong statement and weakens our fight, I will not hesitate to take action." text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi was authorised to take decisions on forging pre-poll and post-poll alliances for the party during the five-hour Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday. text: Ahead of the publication of the final draft of the National Register of Citizens, Home Minister Rajnath Singh said all individuals in Assam will get "sufficient opportunity" to prove their citizenship. text: The number of complaints against e-commerce platforms has gone up by 1,400% over the last four years, according to government data. text: Toblerone is reverting to its original shape nearly two years after its maker widened the gaps between the chocolate bar's distinctive triangular chunks. text: Pakistani opener Fakhar Zaman has become the first batsman in history to slam 500-plus runs in a five-match bilateral ODI series. text: A day after he said the Alwar lynching incident was a reaction to PM Narendra Modi's popularity, union minister Arjun Ram Meghwal has claimed his remarks were "completely misinterpreted". text: Warning the US against provoking Iran, President Hassan Rouhani has said that the conflict with the country would be "the mother of all wars". text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said the Yo-Yo test used by team India should not be the sole criteria for selection of players. "It should be a mixture of fitness and... ability of a player," Sachin said. Sachin added he has never done the Yo-Yo test but had done the 'Beep test', which he claims is similar to the former.

text: Barcelona star Lionel Messi met Real Madrid fan and current men's singles tennis world number one Rafael Nadal during his holiday in Spain's Ibiza. England footballers Eric Dier and Raheem Sterling were also seen in the crowd. Cesc Fabregas' wife Daniella Semaan was also present and seen spending time with Messi's wife Antonella.

text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said the decision of MS Dhoni's retirement should be left to him. There had been calls for MS Dhoni's retirement following his performances in the recently-concluded ODI series against England. "A player of his calibre, who has been around for a long time, knows what is expected of him. And where he stands," Sachin added.
summary: एमएस धोनी के संन्यास के फैसले को छोड़ दो: सचिन

text: An FIR has been registered against AAP MLA Fateh Singh for allegedly giving false information about his educational qualifications in his nomination papers. According to his papers, the MLA completed his Class 12 from the UP Board and then did his graduation from Chaudhary Charan Singh University. The complainant has claimed that this is false, the police said.

text: Jason Gargac, an Uber driver in Missouri, US, live-streamed hundreds of riders without their consent on video platform Twitch, according to a report. Gargac recorded the interior of his car during the rides with a camera, allowing his followers to see and comment on the faces of his passengers. Uber has suspended the driver claiming violation of its rules.

text: The Kerala High Court has quashed the decision by a college in the state to expel two students for a 'love affair'. "Love is blind and an innate humane instinct. It is all about individuals and their freedom," the court said. It added that action cannot be taken for indiscipline in the absence of evidence that it had affected classes.

text: A Pakistani intruder was gunned down in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua by BSF troops on Sunday after they saw him trying to enter Indian territory. The intruder seemed to be a "guide", who was probably "sent by Pakistan to conduct a recce and to see the alertness of BSF troops", BSF Jammu frontier inspector general Ram Awtar said.

text: A youth from Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar was arrested on Saturday after he allegedly uploaded videos of him raping a 15-year-old girl on a social media site. The youth had raped the girl on several occasions since January and had threatened to upload the videos online if she reported the matter, police officials said.

text: Congress leader Manish Tewari has claimed that 60,000 Indian youth are being detained at the US-Mexico border for illegally trying to enter the US through Mexico. He added that as many as 90% of the youth were from Punjab. Tewari, who was on a visit to the US, said their release has to be dealt with by External Affairs Ministry.

text: The UN has reportedly been deploying alleged Sri Lankan war criminals to its peacekeeping operations in Mali, Lebanon, Darfur and South Sudan. Those deployed included commanders involved in alleged abuses during the civil war in 2009. This comes despite the establishment of a verification process to screen out those who served in frontline combat positions in the war's final phase.

Notably, there has been increased scrutiny over work visas in the US in the recent months.

The discovery was made during a routine exercise of freeing up lockers for club members.

text: TV actor Siddharth Shukla, known for his role in 'Balika Vadhu', was arrested for rash driving after his BMW hit three cars and then a divider in Mumbai on Saturday, injuring three people in the accident. text: After Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Congress leader Digvijaya Singh's actions are anti-national, Digvijaya has said he would appear before police and they could arrest him if he's anti-national. text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's 'unwanted hug' remark on Congress President Rahul Gandhi, party leader Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said, "Modi has hugged various leaders during his visit to foreign countries." text: Japan's parliament on Friday passed a controversial law to legalise casino gambling paving way for up to three casino resorts to open. The law limits Japanese citizens to three casino visits per week and 10 per month out of concerns about gambling addiction. Further, admission will be free for foreigners while local residents will be charged a fee.

text: Talking about his half-brother Shahid Kapoor's reaction after watching 'Dhadak', Ishaan Khatter said, "He liked us [Janhvi Kapoor and me] together. He said you two are really great together." text: After the BJP-led NDA government defeated the no-confidence motion in the Lok Sabha, BJP leader GVL Narasimha Rao on Saturday said, "This is only a trailer." "What the people of the country have seen...on the floor of the Parliament is what will happen in 2019...Congress party will have to move yet another no-confidence vote against [PM] in 2024," he added.

text: The Indian women's hockey team marked their return to World Cup with a 1-1 draw against hosts England on Saturday. The match was India's first-ever World Cup match since the 2010 edition in Argentina. The ongoing 14th edition of the World Cup is India's seventh appearance at the competition. Notably, the Indian women's teamÃÂ has never won the World Cup.

text: Several Toronto FC supporters mistakenly set a section of stands on fire during the second half of their team's Canadian Championship match against Ottawa Fury FC. The fire was reportedly caused by flares and fireworks smuggled into TD Place Stadium. There was also an explosion that startled fans and the match was temporarily suspended to deal with the issue.

text: Former world number one Billie Jean King, who won 39 Grand Slam titles, said that American tennis star Serena Williams is not supported like Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal because of her skin colour. King, who founded the Women's Tennis Association, also said, "Women also just don't get the attention, enthusiasm or the sponsorship money that the men do."
summary: रंग के कारण सेरेना फेडरर की तरह समर्थित नहीं हैं: एक्स-रैंक 1

text: Muhammed Anas Yahiya ran the men's 400m race in a Czech Republic event in 45.24 seconds to bag gold and break own national record for the second time. He had earlier broken his 45.32-second record by running 400m in 45.31 seconds at 2018 CWG. Yahiya is only the second Indian after Milkha Singh to compete in men's 400m CWG final.

text: Former Sri Lankan off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, the only player in Test cricket history to take 800 wickets, picked up his 800th wicket on the final ball of his Test career. Muralitharan dismissed India's Pragyan Ojha as his 800th Test wicket on July 22, 2010. Notably, Muralitharan is the fastest to pick 400, 500, 600, 700 and 800 Test wickets.
summary: मुरली ने करियर की आखिरी गेंद पर 800 वां टेस्ट विकेट लिया

text: Australian cricketer David Warner, who is currently serving a one-year ban over the ball-tampering scandal, has said that if he didn't love cricket, he would've retired by now. "I've still got plenty of fuel in the tank and I'm excited," the 31-year-old said after playing his first match in Australia since the scandal. Warner scored 36 runs off 32 balls.
summary: अगर मैं क्रिकेट से प्यार नहीं करता, तो मैं अब तक रिटायर हो चुका होता: वार्नर

text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on Saturday announced that he will not contest the Lok Sabha elections scheduled in 2019. This comes after reports claimed that he will contest elections after being selected in the Congress working committee. Siddaramaiah, who had contested the recently-concluded state election from two constituencies, won from the Badami seat.
summary: 2019 का लोकसभा चुनाव नहीं लड़ेंगे: पूर्व कर्नाटक सीएम

text: BJP President Amit Shah on Saturday announced that incumbent Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje will be the party's CM face in the Assembly elections later this year. "Election will be contested under her leadership and she will again become the CM with a thumping majority," he said. Notably, Raje is Rajasthan's only female CM and has served at the post twice.
summary: बीजेपी ने राजस्थान चुनाव के लिए सीएम चेहरे के रूप में वसुंधरा राजे की घोषणा की

text: Sidelined BJP MP Shatrughan Sinha on Saturday said Congress President Rahul Gandhi stole the show during the Lok Sabha debate on the no-confidence motion against the government. In an apparent jibe at PM Narendra Modi, Shatrughan tweeted, "People enjoyed his oratory skills but one wished his speech could have been shorter (instead of 1.5 hrs) making it more impactful."
summary: राहुल ने चुराया शो: लोकसभा बहस पर बीजेपी सांसद शत्रुघ्न

text: Indian-American scientist Keshav Singh and his team have managed to reverse the age-associated skin wrinkles and hair loss in mice. The team found that skin wrinkles and hair loss created by an induced mutation can be reversed by turning off the gene responsible for mitochondrial dysfunction, a kind of cellular atrophy caused by ageing.

text: Scientists have created the world's fastest spinning object, a tiny dumbbell-shaped nanoparticle made from silica, that spins at rates close to 60 billion rotations per minute. The scientists made the dumbbell spin by levitating it using a laser. The discovery will help scientists study things like quantum mechanics and the properties of vacuum like vacuum friction and gravity.
summary: वैज्ञानिक दुनिया की सबसे तेज घूमने वाली मानव निर्मित वस्तु बनाते हैं

text: The staff of a civic body in Jharkhand's Dhanbad held a puja to chase away the 'ghost of a woman', who the staff claims wanders on the top floor of the four-storey office building. Officials had also claimed that guards on night-duty complained of hearing a woman's screams. The ritual was organised by representatives of Deputy Mayor Eklavya Singh.
summary: झारखंड नागरिक शरीर भूत को भगाने के लिए पूजा करता है

text: The body of a trainee constable of the Jammu and Kashmir Police was found with bullet holes in Kulgam on Saturday. The constable had been abducted by unknown militants on Friday while he was on leave. "We condemn this cowardly act. We all stand by his family at this critical juncture," the Kashmir zone police tweeted.

text: A 70-year-old retired sub-inspector from Tamil Nadu's Madurai has been taken in for questioning after a 9-year-old girl, his neighbour, accused him of sexually assaulting her. A mob had gathered outside the accused's house but he was saved after his wife locked him inside. Police then arrived at the spot and pacified the mob.
summary: पूर्व-टीएन सिपाही ने 9-वर्षीय पड़ोसी पर यौन उत्पीड़न का आरोप लगाया

text: US President Donald Trump has slammed the "Fake News Media", calling them "hypocrites" for saying he's been "too nice" to Russian President Vladimir Putin. "If I was loud and vicious, I would have been criticised for being too tough," he added. Trump told reporters at the Helsinki summit that he saw no reason why Russians would interfere in 2016 elections.
summary: ट्रंप ने 'फेक न्यूज' के लिए पुतिन को 'बहुत अच्छा' कहते हुए नारे लगाए

text: The US has said that it is working with India to avoid sanctions arising from its military deals with Russia. The US added it was helping countries identify and avoid engaging in potentially sanctionable activity under the Countering America's Adversaries Through Sanctions Act (CAATSA). The US has warned India against purchasing the S-400 air defence systems from Russia.
summary: रूस के प्रतिबंधों से बचने में मदद के लिए भारत के साथ काम करना: यू.एस.

text: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has launched the 'Walking Action Plan' in a bid to make London the 'world's most walkable city'. The move is aimed at reducing air pollution and improving health of the people by making streets more pedestrian-friendly. The plan includes introducing new traffic signal technology to make it easier and safer to cross roads, among other provisions.

text: China is waging a "quiet kind of cold war" against the US and making efforts to replace it as the world's leading superpower, Deputy Assistant Director at CIA's East Asia mission centre, Michael Collins said. He added China's militarisation of the disputed South China Sea is similar to "Crimea of the East," referring to Russia's annexation of the Ukrainian region.

text: The GST Council on Saturday approved quarterly filing of return for small taxpayers having a turnover of up to Ã¢ÂÂ¹5 crore as an optional facility. text: The GST rate on lithium-ion batteries used in electric vehicles and mobile phones has been reduced from 28% to 18% on Saturday. text: In the first such sentence under Rajasthan's new law, a 19-year-old man was sentenced to death for raping a seven-month-old infant. A relative was babysitting the infant when the accused took her away earlier this year. The state assembly in March passed a new sexual abuse law that allowed death penalty in rape of minors aged under 12.

text: Denying reports that he was secretly recorded by his former lawyer Michael Cohen while discussing payment to a former Playboy model Karen McDougal, US President Donald Trump tweeted, "Your favourite President did nothing wrong!" Reports had stated an audio tape was uncovered during FBI raid on Cohen's office. Trump added, "Inconceivable that the government would break into a lawyer's office."

text: A 15-year-old Indonesian girl has been jailed for six months for having an abortion after she was raped by her elder brother, an official said on Saturday. Her 17-year-old brother was sentenced to two years in jail for sexually assaulting a minor. Indonesian law requires that an abortion must be performed no later than six weeks into a pregnancy.

text: A UK-based doctor named Kashif Samin has been permanently banned from practising after he claimed he had 46 years of medical experience, despite then being aged only 41. Samin, now 42, also fabricated his university degree and links to societies in job applications. He had quit masters in emergency medicine, the degree of which he mentioned in his CV.
summary: 41-वर्षीय डॉक्टर का दावा है कि 46 साल का अनुभव है, लाइसेंस रद्द हो जाता है

text: Actor Ranveer Singh was seen hugging and dancing with spiritual leader Sadhguru at an alumni event of IIM Bangalore on Saturday. Ranveer also shared a clip from the event and captioned the post, "Happy Dance!" Ranveer and Sadhguru were part of a session at the event, where the theme was 'Sensing The Future'.

text: The first promo of Ekta Kapoor's production 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay' has been released. Sharing the promo on Instagram, Ekta wrote, "Love never dies! When you think it's over it RETURNS." lt is a reboot of Ekta's 2001 serial by the same name, which starred Shweta Tiwari and Cezanne Khan (later replaced by Hiten Tejwani) as the characters Prerna and Anurag.

text: A 14-year-old girl was murdered for resisting sexual assault and buried in the backyard of a short-stay home run by an NGO in Bihar's Muzaffarpur, rescued inmates claimed. The NGO, Seva Sankalp Evam Vikas Samiti, was engaged by state welfare department to run the home. The inmates were rescued after reports of sexual abuse of girls at some homes surfaced.

text: Islamic Seminary Darul Uloom Deoband in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur has issued a fatwa against waxing and shaving, saying they are not "considered to be good" under the Sharia law. text: Eight people have been booked for allegedly sedating and raping a 16-year-old girl in Bengaluru. The girl worked in a private firm where she developed a friendship with one of the accused, who kidnapped her, took her to a coconut farm, and raped her. He then sedated her, called his friends "and jointly repeated the cruelty again", police have said.

text: A four-year-old boy accidentally shot dead his 2-year-old cousin at home in the US state of California, police said. The victim was found suffering from a gunshot wound and was taken to a local hospital where she was pronounced dead. The victim's grandfather was arrested and charged with child endangerment and being a felon in possession of a firearm.

text: India's largest private lender by market capitalisation, HDFC Bank, on Saturday posted an 18.2% increase in its profit at Ã¢ÂÂ¹4,601 crore for the quarter ended June. text: The government on Friday indicated that 25% of the ATMs run by state-owned banks may be vulnerable to fraud as they are running on outdated software. However, it did not disclose details of such ATMs run by private sector lenders. The government also informed the Parliament that the total number of functional ATMs constitutes nearly 89% of the total ATMs.

text: Dave Bautista, who plays 'Drax the Destroyer' in 'Guardians of the Galaxy', has said that he's not ok with Disney firing the director of 'Guardians of the Galaxy' franchise James Gunn. "He [Gunn] is gentle and kind and cares deeply for people and animals. He's made mistakes. We all have. I'm not ok with what's happening to him," tweeted Dave.
summary: 'गार्जियंस ऑफ ...' मेकर: 'ड्रेक्स' एक्टर की फायरिंग से ठीक नहीं

text: Actress Neha Dhupia, who appears in various reality-based TV shows, said, "As long as television gives me the opportunity to be myself which is non-fiction, I'll definitely do it." "I've always been a part of the small screen in situations where I'm doing things that I'm comfortable with. It has been about me being myself," she added.

"I've been toying with a couple of ideas for a while now and finally have zeroed down one," he added. He further said, "Haven't thought of the cast yet." text: Third-party insurance for a term of three years will be mandatory for cars being sold from September 1, the Supreme Court ordered on Friday. text: About 157 GB of sensitive data from over 100 companies, including General Motors, Fiat Chrysler, Ford, Tesla and Toyota, were exposed on a public server, security researcher UpGuard Cyber Risk has revealed. text: Most of the accused named by the CBI in the latest chargesheet for the February 2016 Rohtak violence are linked to former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda, state Finance Minister Captain Abhimanyu has said. text: Former BJP MP Chandan Mitra on Saturday joined Trinamool Congress (TMC) at a mega rally in Kolkata, TMC President and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced. text: A video footage of an indigenous man in his 50s, whose tribe members were murdered 22 years ago in Brazil's Amazon forests, has gone viral. Brazilian government has been monitoring the man since 1996 to prove he's alive and renew land restriction orders to protect him.

text: The Union Ministry of Women and Child Development has asked all states and Union Territories to inspect all the homes run by Mother Teresa's Missionaries of Charity. The directive comes after members of the charity's home in Ranchi were arrested for allegedly selling four infants.

text: A 28-year-old Delhi-based BPO executive was killed after a speeding cab hit him near Gurugram's Ambience Mall on Thursday morning. text: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed the bail plea of the Class 11 student of a private school in Gurugram, who has been accused of killing a 7-year-old boy in the school's washroom. text: Migrants do not have the unfettered right to choose their host nation, the UN's refugee agency has said. The UNHCR added that nations have "obligations to save lives and afford protection to refugees". It further hailed the efforts of European nations including France, Germany and Italy for processing the asylum of around 450 refugees and migrants stranded in the Mediterranean.

text: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh cannot join a rival company for six months if he decides to leave the IT major, according to his employment contract. Parekh cannot join rivals including TCS, IBM and Cognizant during the cooling-off period. Infosys said it could place Parekh on "gardening leave", suspension from work on full pay during his notice period, if he resigns.

text: Marlboro-maker Philip Morris has been slammed for 'disgraceful PR stunt' by offering "smoke-free" tobacco products to England's National Health Service (NHS) staff to mark its 70th anniversary. text: Actor Arjun Kapoor will be seen playing the lead role in the sequel of Boney Kapoor's 2005 film 'No Entry', as per reports. text: Television actress Sumona Chakravarti, known for her role as comedian Kapil Sharma's on-screen wife, has slammed services startup UrbanClap after using its waxing service. text: Abhishek Bachchan and Taapsee Pannu's 'Manmarziyaan' will be clashing with Shahid Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor's 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu' as both the films are scheduled to release on September 21. text: Pakistan opener Fakhar Zaman, who on Friday became the sixth batsman to slam ODI double hundred, achieved the feat in his 17th innings. Sachin Tendulkar scored ODIs' first double hundred in his 431st innings.

text: Pakistan registered their highest-ever ODI total by scoring 399/1 in 50 overs in the fourth ODI against Zimbabwe on Friday. text: The Uttar Pradesh Police will deploy over 3.6 lakh 'digital volunteers' across around 1,500 police stations to stop the spread of rumours and fake news on social media. Volunteers will be responsible for countering rumours and spreading awareness about facts.

text: Russian President Vladimir Putin suggested to US President Donald Trump that the crisis in Ukraine could be solved with a referendum, according to Bloomberg. The US has said it does not recognise Russia's annexation of Crimea.

text: A Pakistani-American father-son duo has been sentenced to 18 months in prison in the US for exporting products illegally to the Pakistan military. They had pleaded guilty to international money laundering in March.

text: Opener Fakhar Zaman has become the first Pakistani and overall sixth batsman to smash a double hundred in men's ODI cricket history, achieving the feat against Zimbabwe on Friday. text: According to Lok Sabha rules, a government must always have majority support in the Lok Sabha to remain in power. text: Justifying the US exit from the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC), US Ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley has described the Geneva-based body as the UN's "greatest failure". She further said UNHRC focused "relentlessly" on Israel and "ignored the misery inflicted by regimes in Venezuela and China".

text: E-commerce giant Amazon briefly crossed $900-billion market cap for the first time in its history on Wednesday, becoming only the second company after Apple to achieve this milestone. text: Elnaaz Norouzi, who portrayed an actress in an abusive relationship with a movie star in 'Sacred Games', has said although her character is similar to Katrina Kaif, it's not inspired by her. text: Twenty-three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams, who finished as runner-up in the women's singles event at Wimbledon, has dedicated her run in the tournament to fellow mothers. text: Apple's App Store generated nearly double the revenue of Google's Play Store in the first half of 2018, according to Sensor Tower. Apple made $22.6 billion in worldwide gross app revenue as compared to $11.8 billion made on Play Store. Further, in 2017, consumer spending on App Store reached $38.5 billion whereas Google Play Store recorded an estimated $20.1 billion.

text: Online bookmarking service Instapaper has announced it is buying itself back after being acquired by Pinterest two years ago. Instapaper allows users to save articles and web pages to read offline on various devices.

text: South Africa-based MeerKAT radio telescope, which was inaugurated last week, took the clearest view yet of the Milky Way's centre, which contains the galaxy's largest black hole, weighing about four million solar masses. Lying behind Sagittarius constellation, the region 25,000 light-years away from Earth is covered by clouds of gas and dust, making it invisible while using ordinary telescopes.

text: In a first, IIT Delhi researchers have developed a silk-based hydrogel that emulates human hair growth, and may help screen drugs for treating hair loss without animal tests. Researcher Sourabh Ghosh said physiological differences amongst animals and humans drastically limit the success of such drugs, which prompted the need for 3D in-vitro model of hair follicle using human cells.

text: A jawan has allegedly committed suicide by shooting himself with his service rifle at an Army camp near the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Akhnoor. text: The Vatican has announced that physical virginity is not a prerequisite for women to dedicate themselves as "Brides of Christ". It comes amid reports that the technology giant was planning to launch its own e-commerce platform in India later this year. Further, recent reports also suggested that Flipkart executives opposed Google's plan to invest in the e-commerce startup.
summary: अमेज़न, फ्लिपकार्ट ने Google पर विज्ञापन खर्च में 30% की कटौती की: रिपोर्ट

text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi reportedly called the Congress a "party for Muslims", Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said, "The Congress is the worst communal party. It has always done communal politics." He added, "What Rahul Gandhi has said is against the spirit of the Constitution and against every principle of democracy."
summary: जावड़ेकर ने राहुल की खिंचाई की, 'कांग्रेस को सबसे बुरी सांप्रदायिक पार्टी' कहा

text: At least seven people died on the spot when two private cars collided on a highway in the outskirts of Maharashtra's Lonavala, an official said today. Several people who were injured were taken to a local hospital. The accident resulted in traffic jams with hundreds of vehicles stuck on both sides of the highway as rescue teams cleared the site.
summary: महा राजमार्ग पर सड़क दुर्घटना में सात लोगों की मौत

text: Air hostess Anissia Batra's brother has claimed she had once texted her family about her husband Mayank Singhvi, "because of him my life is going to go, please don't leave him."  Further, days before her alleged suicide, her father had filed a complaint against Mayank, alleging he was harassing her. Anissia committed suicide in her Delhi house this month.
summary: उसने हमें बताया कि हम उसके पति को नहीं छोड़ेंगे: एयर होस्टेस का परिवार

text: A groom named Sanjay Jatav became the first Dalit to lead his baraat through UP's Nizampur village. Jatav and his family were protected by over 350 police officers as local Thakurs had allegedly threatened to disrupt the procession. The District Magistrate said it took five months to prepare for the day, while the bride said they had faced "huge obstacles."
summary: 350 पुलिस सुरक्षा प्रदान करते हैं क्योंकि यूपी में दलित दूल्हा बरात लेकर जाता है

text: The Income Tax Department on Monday conducted raids at premises of SPK Group, one of the main road contractors in Tamil Nadu. The raids were carried out reportedly across 30 locations after a tip-off on alleged tax evasion and about Ã¢ÂÂ¹80 crore was seized. Properties belonging to SPK Group MD Nagarajan Seyyadurai have also come under search by tax officials.
summary: तमिलनाडु स्थित सड़क ठेकेदार के परिसर में आई-टी छापे

text: As many as 105 couples tied the knot in Kashmir's biggest mass wedding on Sunday. The brides and grooms were aged between 25 to 45, and many were orphans or from poor families, the Jaffari Council of Jammu and Kashmir said. The council, which organised the wedding in Srinagar, added, "Our motive is to promote simple marriages and reduce flamboyance."
summary: 105 जोड़े कश्मीर की सबसे बड़ी सामूहिक शादी में शामिल हुए

text: A Class 8 student has made a video slamming Karnataka CM Kumaraswamy for failing to allot sufficient funds for Kodagu in the budget, adding that "relentless rain" damages crops and affects civic life in the region. Stating that he will assess the damage caused by rain in Kodagu, Kumaraswamy said, "How long will you deter me with stories like this?"

text: US-based Goldman Sachs Group is expected to name David Solomon as its next CEO, according to reports. He will replace outgoing CEO Lloyd Blankfein, who is expected to retire later in the year. Solomon, who joined the investment bank as a partner in 1999, currently serves as the President and Chief Operating Officer of the company.

text: ICICI Bank has decided to postpone its Annual General Meeting (AGM) by a month amidst independent enquiry conducted by Justice BN Srikrishna on alleged cases of impropriety against the bank's CEO Chanda Kochhar. The AGM will now be held on September 12 instead of August 10. Kochhar has gone on leave till the inquiry into allegations against her is complete.

text: Over 70,000 employees of associate banks of SBI, which merged with the lender in 2017, have been asked to return "overtime compensation" for "extra hours" they worked post demonetisation, according to reports citing an SBI circular. SBI said the associate banks hadn't merged with it at time of demonetisation and five employer banks were responsible to pay the overtime compensation.

text: In an open letter to trolls, director Anubhav Sinha wrote his upcoming film 'Mulk' is not being funded by underworld don Dawood Ibrahim, Congress or the RSS. text: Talking about how her statements are taken out of context and reported in the media, Janhvi Kapoor said, "Maybe I should just shut up...I read the kind of stuff that's being printed and it makes me cringe." text: A British cave diver who helped rescue 12 boys from a Thai cave has said he may sue Elon Musk after the entrepreneur called him a paedophile on Twitter. text: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Unacademy has raised $21 million in Series C funding round, the startup's Co-founder and CEO Gaurav Munjal said. The funding round was led by Sequoia Capital, Nexus Venture Partners, and SAIF Partners with participation from its early backer Blume Ventures. Founded in 2015 as an online education platform, Unacademy now has a total funding of $38.6 million.
summary: Edtech स्टार्टअप Unacademy ने सीरीज़ में $ 21 मिलियन की राशि जुटाई है

text: In a letter for a martyr's five-month-old daughter, District Magistrate of Rajasthan's Jhalawar, Jitendra Soni, wrote, "You sat on the coffin and laid on that without crying...It was very emotional." "Grow well and make your father's glorious martyrdom your pride," he added. Her father Mukut Bihari Meena was an Army paratrooper who was martyred while fighting militants in Kashmir.

Mohammed Azam, survived by his 18-month-old son and wife, was killed and three others were injured by a mob of around 2,000 people on child-lifting suspicions.

summary: नाटो नेताओं ने मुझे साथ लाने के लिए धन्यवाद दिया: ट्रम्प

text: The board of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) gave its approval to buy up to 51% stake in public sector lender IDBI Bank, Economic Affairs Secretary SC Garg said on Monday. text: FMCG major Hindustan Unilever has posted a 19.17% year-on-year increase in net profit to Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,529 crore for first quarter of FY19, compared to Ã¢ÂÂ¹1,283 crore in the same period last fiscal. text: Actress Kajol, while talking about her profession, has said that actors are supposed to be perfect all the time. "I feel that in this profession and in this field, we are not allowed to have fears of any sort," she added. She further said that actors are supposed to be "incredible, amazing and not have any faults."

text: Ex-world number one Novak Djokovic's three-year-old son Stefan could not watch his father play the Wimbledon final on Sunday because of the tournament's rules. text: France midfielder Paul Pogba paid tribute to his late father by holding the 2018 FIFA World Cup trophy in one hand and the shin pad having the picture of his father in the other hand. text: Technology major Microsoft is working on a new smartphone model which will be powered by Android, according to reports. The phone is not a part of the Lumia series, the report said, adding that the new edition of smartphones will be branded under the company's name. However, the report did not reveal any specifications of the anticipated Microsoft smartphone.

text: Google is reportedly facing a record European Union (EU) fine for using its Android operating system to manipulate the smartphone manufacturers. The company is accused of giving its Android software for free in exchange of "exclusivity agreements" to install its apps. The fine is expected to surpass the $2.7-billion fine Google paid last year over manipulating its internet shopping business.

text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday tweeted that BJP has "completely failed" in Delhi, and added, "Law and order in the capital of India is deteriorating by the day." text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's office in Thiruvananthapuram was attacked on Monday by miscreants who poured black engine oil on its wall and gate, and hung a banner reading 'Hindu Pakistan' office. text: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant has said for India to grow at 9-10% for three decades consistently, promoting women entrepreneurship has to be key strategy. "Women contribute about 22% of [India's] GDP, the worldwide average is close to 44-45%," he added. He further said if women don't do well then society faces an inter-generational cycle of malnutrition and infant mortality.
summary: भारत में 9% की दर से विकास के लिए महिला उद्यमियों को होना चाहिए: NITI Aayog

text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday signed an autograph for a woman injured after a tent collapsed during his rally in West Bengal's Midnapore. The BJP tweeted that the woman, who was "barely able to talk", had asked PM Modi for an autograph despite being bedridden at the hospital. PM Modi had asked people to not run when the accident occurred.

text: Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Kiran Bedi has asked Sri Venkateshwaraa Medical College Hospital and Research Centre to not discriminate against students over a fee dispute being heard in the High Court. summary: बेदी ने फीस से अधिक छात्रों को कक्षाएं देने से इनकार कर दिया

text: The Kerala University has postponed all examinations scheduled for Monday to July 21 due to heavy rainfall in the area. Over 10 people have been killed in heavy rainfall since last week, while around 2,000 families have been given shelter in over 45 relief camps.

text: UP police stopped a child marriage in Jansath two days before the wedding after receiving a complaint in this regard. Police officials said they reached the venue and found that the girl was 16 years old. They asked the family not to go ahead with the wedding, following which her parents decided to wait until she becomes an adult.

text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Sunday directed state police to not harass drug addicts and prohibited them from entering de-addiction centres to question patients. CM Singh also urged people to not lynch drug smugglers and peddlers. The number of addicts lodged in de-addiction centres increased from around 2,300 to over 6,500 after the government announced free treatment for patients.

text: Congress worker Rajiv Sinha, who had filed a complaint against online series 'Sacred Games', withdrew his complaint on Monday. text: The Uttarakhand government on Sunday refuted reports that it issued any order for levying charges on the use of helicopters during rescue operations in the state. text: The Interpol Washington wrote to the Indian government saying that absconding diamantaire Nirav Modi's uncle Mehul Choksi is not in the United States, according to reports. text: Katrina Kaif's surname was changed from Turquotte to Kaif in her debut film 'Boom', which also starred Amitabh Bachchan. text: Gurugram-based grocery delivery startup Grofers has shut down its fresh produce service delivering vegetables and fruits across cities including Delhi (NCR) and Bengaluru. text: The brother of the 17-year-old girl who committed suicide at Delhi's Tilak Nagar police post alleged the policemen panicked and ran to different rooms when they learnt of her suicide. text: President Donald Trump on Monday blamed "years of US foolishness and stupidity", and the Russian investigation for the dismal state of relations between the US and Russia. "Our relationship with Russia has never been worse," Trump added. This comes ahead of the summit between Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in the Finnish capital of Helsinki.

text: A mob of villagers killed nearly 300 crocodiles after a man was killed by one of the reptiles at an Indonesian breeding farm. Authorities and police said they were not able to stop the attack, adding that they are investigating and may press criminal charges. The breeding farm had been setup on a condition that the reptiles won't disturb locals.

text: India's inflation measured by the Wholesale Price Index (WPI) rose to an over 4-year high of 5.77% in June as compared to 4.43% in May, government data revealed on Monday. Vegetable prices grew by 8.12% in June, while primary articles that account for over one-fifth of entire WPI, grew by 5.3%. Fuel and power inflation grew at 16.18% in June.
summary: थोक मुद्रास्फीति जून में 4 साल के उच्च स्तर 5.77% पर पहुंच गई

text: Shares of Delhi-based PC Jeweller plunged about 26% on Monday after it withdrew a proposal to buyback shares worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹424 crore. PC Jeweller has lost over 80% of its market value in last six months.

text: Actress Priyanka Chopra, while shooting for her upcoming film "Isn't It Romantic" in New York, was seen dancing on the streets of New York for a sequence of the film. summary: प्रियंका ने न्यूयॉर्क की सड़कों पर फिल्म की शूटिंग के लिए नृत्य किया

text: After Russian President Vladimir Putin stood under an umbrella while Croatia and France's Presidents got drenched in the rain, a user tweeted, "They've only brought one umbrella, and it's for Putin. He is NOT sharing it." Other users reacted with tweets like, "Do they only have one umbrella in Russia?" and "MVP of tournament: Putin's umbrella guy".

text: French midfielder Paul Pogba trolled England by singing their adopted FIFA World Cup chant "It's coming home" in an Instagram Live video after winning the World Cup on Sunday. Pogba began singing and dancing during a photo shoot with the World Cup trophy before chanting "It's coming home". The 25-year-old Manchester United midfielder later apologised for it.

text: Out of the 64 matches at the 2018 FIFA World Cup, only one match finished with a scoreline of 0-0. Denmark and eventual champions France failed to score a single goal in their final Group C match on June 26. Notably, the most frequent result at the 2018 FIFA World Cup was 1-0, with 15 matches ending with the scoreline.
summary: केवल 2018 डब्लूसी मैच जो 0-0 से समाप्त हो गया, उसमें फ्रांस शामिल था

text: French midfielder Paul Pogba became the first Manchester United player to score in a final of the World Cup after scoring France's third goal in the World Cup final against Croatia on Sunday. text: Former captain MS Dhoni has become the first-ever Indian wicketkeeper to take 300 catches in ODI cricket, achieving the feat against England in the second ODI on Saturday. With this, he became the only wicketkeeper to take 300-plus catches and 100-plus stumpings in ODIs. Former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist holds the record for taking most ODI catches (417) as wicketkeeper.

text: Addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said, "Those who didn't even like looking at each other earlier have united and are now chanting Modi Modi." He added that parties which believe in dynastic politics and leaders who have been released on bail wish to create obstacles in development.
summary: जो लोग एक दूसरे को पसंद नहीं करते थे मोदी मोदी: पीएम मोदी

text: Congress leader P Chidambaram has asked Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to share "her secret information" on "plans to incite riots in the run-up to Lok Sabha election" with Home Minister Rajnath Singh. text: The Tamil Nadu Police has taken three more people into custody over the death of a teenage girl during a disaster preparedness drill in a government college. text: Police on Friday arrested five Columbian nationals for allegedly attempting to break into former Karnataka Chief Secretary Kaushik Mukherjee's residence in Jayanagar. text: As many as sixty poisonous Russell's viper snakes were found at a Zilla Parishad school's kitchen in Maharashtra's Hingoli on Friday, officials said. School authorities stopped panicked villagers from killing the snakes and hired a snake catcher, who caught the snakes in over two hours and put them in jars. The snakes were later handed over to a forest official.

text: Locals from Jharkhand's Bariatu village thrashed a Naxal to death after a group of Naxals assaulted a contractor for refusing to pay Ã¢ÂÂ¹15,000 as levy. The contractor, who is presently engaged in building toilets, had fled from his home and sought help from villagers after he was attacked. Locals claimed Naxals threaten and assault people for refusing to pay levy.

text: Karnataka Deputy CM G Parameshwara has urged the Centre to formulate a law awarding death penalty to those accused of peddling drugs, adding that the government should take the initiative after consulting with states. Stating that anti-narcotics wing of Bengaluru Police will increase patrols around schools and colleges, he added, "We will not allow Karnataka to go the Punjab way."

text: China is spying on US-led military exercises off the coast of Hawaii, the US Defence Department said. text: The first-ever land-based communication link between China and Pakistan was inaugurated on Friday. The Pakistan-China Optical Fibre Cable project includes an 820-kilometre underground cable that starts from Pakistan's Rawalpindi and ends at Khunjerab bordering China and connects with optical fibre in the Chinese side. It is a part of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) project.

text: Thousands of people on Friday across the UK attended planned protests against US President Donald Trump. text: Former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has said that she refused better facilities in jail by her own will. text: Fortis Healthcare board has approved a Ã¢ÂÂ¹4,000-crore offer from Malaysia-based IHH Healthcare for 31.1% stake in it, valuing Fortis at Ã¢ÂÂ¹8,880 crore. IHH will also make a mandatory open offer of up to Ã¢ÂÂ¹3,300 crore to buy 26% more stake in Fortis from existing shareholders. text: PC Jeweller has withdrawn a proposal to buyback shares worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹424 crore after it failed to receive the requisite no-objection certificate from its bankers. text: Andhra Bank has filed a bankruptcy petition against apparel retailer Provogue India at the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) for non-payment of dues, according to reports. Provogue India's shares fell about 8.5% on Friday after the reports emerged. A group of lenders led by Andhra Bank acquired a 51% stake in Provogue India by swapping debt into equity in 2016.

text: Sister Koshleniea, one of the two nuns from Missionaries of Charity who were arrested by Ranchi police on charges of child trafficking, has confessed to the crime while saying, "I have sold two more babies." text: An Uber driver in Bengaluru assaulted a passenger, leaving him with a broken nose, fractured fingers and injuries to his face, while driving him home. The passenger claimed that the driver asked him to get out of the cab midway as there was a lot of traffic. After he refused, the driver reportedly pulled him out and assaulted him.

text: On July 14, 1930, Indian poet Rabindranath Tagore met Albert Einstein at his Berlin home. The two Nobel laureates explored concepts of science, religion, and philosophy. As Einstein questioned if God was isolated from the world, Tagore said, "There cannot be anything that cannot be subsumed by human personality", while relating connectivity between humans to that of protons and electrons.

text: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee stated that actress Sunny Leone will not be allowed to use 'Kaur' in the title of her web series 'Karenjit Kaur: The Untold Story of Sunny Leone', which premieres on July 16. text: A spectator proposed to his girlfriend in the stands during the second India-England ODI at Lord's Cricket Ground on Saturday. After the woman accepted the proposal, the broadcasters displayed the caption, "She said 'Yes!'"

text: After Forbes declared Kylie Jenner's worth is $900 million and she could become the world's youngest-ever 'self-made billionaire', comedian Fat Jew started a GoFundMe page to make her a billionaire. text: After reports claimed that BJP President Amit Shah said Ram temple will be constructed before the 2019 elections, the party on Saturday said he didn't make any such statement. text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed he holds the "smallest desk" in his car-making factory where he "barely" sits. text: A 26-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh has committed suicide by consuming poison after she was allegedly raped by a BSF jawan, police officials said. text: An Uttar Pradesh court has sentenced three doctors to three-year jail term each for preparing an incorrect post-mortem report of a 14-year-old girl who was murdered on the Nighasan police station campus in 2011. The doctors had described hanging as the cause of death, but another post-mortem report after her family's protest revealed the actual cause to be strangulation.

text: Indian economy is expected to become the world's third largest by 2030 with GDP worth $10 trillion, Economic Affairs Secretary SC Garg has said. text: Eight of 14 critically endangered black rhinos have died after being relocated to a new wildlife reserve in Kenya. The rhinos died as a result of salt poisoning as they tried to adapt to saltier water at their new habitat, wildlife officials said. text: Officials in China have busted a World Cup gambling ring that brought in 330,000 users and placed around $1.5 billion worth of cryptocurrency bets over eight months, according to state media. Local police have arrested six suspects from whom $1.5 million was confiscated. China has so far arrested 540 suspects and frozen around $39 million to stem illegal WC betting.

text: Six-time English champions Chelsea have appointed former international banker Maurizio Sarri as their new manager. text: SunRisers Hyderabad mentor VVS Laxman has revealed that his children cried when they got to know that David Warner was banned from Indian Premier League 2018 over the ball-tampering scandal. text: After Congress MP Shashi Tharoor was summoned by a Kolkata court for his "Hindu Pakistan" remark, BJP MP Subramanian Swamy said, "I think condemnation from the 'people's court' is more important." "If the Congress is not willing to...expel him, we should ask all the people to condemn him and ask him to resign [from] his Lok Sabha seat," he added.

text: New York-headquartered co-working startup WeWork told its 6,000 global staff it won't pay for or allow any kind of meat at staff events. Co-founder Miguel McKelvey cited a research saying it could reduce their environmental impact "more than switching to a hybrid car." WeWork estimates the move will save 15 million animals and 445 million pounds CO2 emissions by 2023.

text: A 34-year-old man was found to be alive during his funeral in Karnataka's Kalaburagi after a relative lying across his chest realised that he was breathing. He was rushed to a hospital after his eyes opened slightly minutes before he was to be buried. His family demanded action against a doctor associated with a private hospital for declaring him dead.

text: The Rajasthan High Court asked CM Vasundhara Raje to choose one of the two bungalows retained by her as her residence, adding that the other should be used for official purposes. One bungalow was allotted to Raje in 2008 after she served as CM, while the other was given to her in 2013 after she was voted back to power.

text: Maharashtra Congress chief Sanjay Nirupam and former MLA Baba Siddique on Saturday repaired a pothole in Mumbai's Bandra in protest against the poor condition of roads. Nirupam later tweeted, "#BMC's Deadline to fill up Potholes in Mumbai is over. We are filling up some." This comes after the death of at least four people in pothole-related accidents across Maharashtra.

text: A German TV show replaced pictures of US President Donald Trump with those of a balloon depicting him as a baby. text: Amazon Prime Video has launched a new Prime Original show-Comicstaan where top Indian comics will judge and mentor new talent in a one-of-a-kind reality show. Each episode deals with one genre of stand-up comedy and one judge mentors the comedians on that genre. Hosted by Abish Mathew & Sumukhi Suresh, the show features Tanmay Bhat and Kenny Sebastian among others.

text: Coach Ekaphol Chantawong was stuck in a Thai cave with twelve of his players for 18 days, and was among the last to be rescued. A former Buddhist monk, the coach advised the boys to meditate and not move around much to conserve energy. A government spokesperson described his presence as a source of comfort to the boys.

text: After being criticised for calling Vijay Mallya "smart" for employing intelligent people and 'buying bankers and politicians', Union Minister Jual Oram said, "I accidentally took Vijay Mallya's name. I should've taken someone else's name." Oram, while giving Mallya's example, had asked tribal communities, "Who asked Adivasis not to influence the system? Who prevented you from influencing bankers?"
