text: After posting 86 tweets in June to counter critiques amid attempts to reach Tesla's production targets, CEO Elon Musk said "most of the time I do say nothing. I should probably say nothing more often." "I never attacked anyone who did not attack me first," Musk said on his Twitter spree adding "that is my mistake. I will correct it."

text: South Africa has unveiled the 64-dish MeerKAT radio telescope, slated to be the world's largest and most powerful telescope on its completion in 2030. Built for $330 million, MeerKAT will be integrated into an array of 3,000 dishes spread in a square-kilometre area. It is said to have 50 times better resolution than NASA's Hubble Space Telescope when fully operational.

text: China and UK-based researchers undertook the largest study looking for components of dietÃ¢ÂÂfat, carbohydrates or proteinÃ¢ÂÂthat caused weight gain in mice. The mice were fed 30 different diets for three months, equivalent to nine years in humans. Based on similarities in metabolism, researchers concluded fat consumption could be the sole cause of weight gain in humans too.

text: Dinesh Singh Bisht, a fifteen-year-old class 10 student, was burnt alive in the middle of the road in Uttarakhand, by unidentified boys when he had gone out for a morning walk. Bisht, who succumbed to his injuries later, was found with severe burn injuries around 200 metres from his home and a few metres away from the road.

text: The Assam Police on Friday posted a warning on micro-blogging site Twitter against sharing rumours and hate messages online, with the caption, "What does your weekend look like? Because we may have to plan ours, if it's with us!" This comes after various incidents of mob lynching were reported in Assam based on rumours about child-kidnappers on WhatsApp.

text: Gujarat BJP Vice President Jayanti Bhanushali has resigned from his post after a 21-year-old woman accused him of rape. In his resignation letter, Bhanushali denied the allegations, calling it a conspiracy to malign his image. The woman had written to the police alleging Bhanushali raped her several times on the pretext of securing her admission into a fashion designing college.
summary: बलात्कार के आरोपों के बाद गुजरात बीजेपी उपाध्यक्ष ने दिया इस्तीफा

text: Madras High Court has ruled that mentioning father's name in birth certificates is optional. The court was hearing a petition by a woman, who gave birth to a baby through intrauterine insemination, against Trichy Municipal Corporation (TMC) who had issued her a birth certificate with the sperm donor's name as the father. The court ordered TMC to correct the error.
summary: जन्म प्रमाण पत्र में पिता का नाम वैकल्पिक: मद्रास एच.सी.

text: A local BJP leader in Agra has been booked for allegedly sexually harassing a police inspector's wife. The victim, a school teacher, was also allegedly thrashed by the accused's relatives after she approached the police and has suffered partial hearing loss and fracture to an arm. text: Scientists have detected high-energy neutrinos, which travelled from nearly 3.7 billion light years away, in the ice below Antarctica's surface. The particles are nicknamed 'ghost particles' as they are uncharged, causing their paths and trajectories to remain unaffected by magnetic fields. The particles are said to have originated from an elliptical galaxy with a massive black hole at its core.

Earlier, people were required to take permission for photography.

text: A picture has surfaced online which shows a man taking a selfie with three accident victims lying on the road in the background. While the man taking the selfie remains to be unidentified, police say had the onlookers helped the victims on time, they would have survived.

text: The water pumps draining the flooded cave in Thailand, where a football team of 12 boys and their coach were trapped for 18 days, failed just hours after the last boy was evacuated. Over 100 rescuers were deep inside the cave when the main pump failed, causing water levels to rise and forcing rescuers to rush to higher ground.

text: Australian doctor Richard Harris with 30 years' diving experience cut short his vacation in Thailand to rescue 12 kids trapped in a cave. The Adelaide-based anaesthetist stayed with the boys for 3 days and was reportedly the last person to leave. The experienced diver and underwater photographer is internationally renowned for his cave-rescue expertise, having participated in several aid missions.
summary: डॉक्टर रिचर्ड हैरिस कौन है, जो गुफा में थाई बच्चों के साथ रहा?

text: BSNL on Wednesday became the country's first telephone network to launch 'internet telephony' service, which makes landline work like mobile. BSNL users will be able to call on any network's number by installing BSNL's app 'Wings' on their devices including smartphone, tablet or laptop. Until now, phone calls on mobile apps were possible only within users of a particular app.

text: Rajkummar Rao, while speaking about working with Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in 'Fanney Khan', said, "People are saying there's a new couple in town in the form of both of us and I'm completely okay with it." "The chemistry between Aishwarya Rai and me is being appreciated," he added. 'Fanney Khan' will star Aishwarya in the role of a singer.

text: The 12 boys rescued from a cave in Thailand on Tuesday, lost an average of two kilograms in weight while they were trapped inside for over 2 weeks. They had not eaten anything in the first nine days and drank water dripping inside. All rescued were in a "very good mental state" and showed no signs of stress, officials said.

text: The first video of the boys rescued from a flooded cave in Thailand showed them making victory signs from their hospital beds on Wednesday. text: Juventus' online store crashed just hours after the Italian football club put on sale jerseys bearing the name and jersey number (7) of their new signing Cristiano Ronaldo. text: BJP's IT cell chief Amit Malviya on Wednesday tweeted a scene from 'Sacred Games', a web series starring Nawazuddin Siddiqui and Saif Ali Khan, to mock the Congress. text: For the first time, Rajya Sabha members can speak in any of the 22 languages listed in the eighth schedule of the Constitution, Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu has decided. text: The government might withdraw the 'Institute of Eminence' status for the Jio Institute if it is "not found to be performing up to the mark" within three years, Higher Education Secretary R Subrahmanyam said. text: Roofing distributor ABC Supply's Chairman Diane Hendricks has topped the Forbes list of America's Richest Self-Made Women for 2018 with a net worth of $4.9 billion. text: Veteran investor Mark Mobius has said the world will see a "financial crisis sooner or later" because it's coming off from "period of cheap money". text: England football team players threw around rubber chickens to warm up during their training session ahead of their 2018 FIFA World Cup semi-final match against Croatia. text: Over 20 children fell ill on Wednesday and were rushed to the hospital after consuming the midday meal at a Delhi school, the police said. The students claimed they found a lizard in the meal. text: New Delhi's Connaught Place is the ninth most expensive location globally to set up or rent an office, with an annual rent of Ã¢ÂÂ¹10,512 per square feet, according to American property consultant CBRE. text: A BSF chopper carrying top CRPF officials deployed for anti-Naxal operations had to make an emergency landing in Bihar's Aurangabad after it developed a technical problem. text: A research scholar was arrested after allegedly assaulting a Dalit professor and making casteist remarks at him in Lucknow's Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University after the latter did not select him for a fellowship. text: Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz has issued a royal decree pardoning all soldiers who are serving in Yemen's ongoing civil war. The police added the notes were written by Lalit Bhatia, one of the two dead sons.

text: Congress workers in Chhattisgarh are wearing t-shirts with the caption 'Udd Gayi Vikas Ki Chidiya', in an apparent jibe at the BJP. text: A study by UK's University of Surrey has revealed average black carbon concentration on roads in New Delhi was up to five times higher compared to Europe or North America. text: India will lose all special privileges provided by Iran if it cuts oil imports from the country, Iran's ambassador to India Massoud Rezvanian Rahaghi said. text: Adultery must remain a punishable offence so the sanctity of marriage can be protected, the Centre told the Supreme Court. text: US President Donald Trump has suggested that NATO members should reimburse his country for its military expenditures. text: Sex addiction has been recognised as a mental health disorder by the World Health Organisation in its International Classification of Diseases list. text: Twelve boys of a Thai football team and their coach have been rescued from a flooded cave after being trapped for over two weeks. text: Andhra Pradesh has topped the ease of doing business 2016-17 rankings released by Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion (DIPP) on Tuesday for the second year in a row with a score of 98.42%. text: Section 377, the law criminalising consensual gay sex, violates the fundamental right of Indians and societal perceptions can't be used as an excuse for its existence, petitioners have told the Supreme Court. text: People living in Chhattisgarh's Naxal-affected Churegaon village finally got a concrete bridge after 71 years of struggle. Edison later publicly electrocuted an elephant to depict AC's dangers.

text: An Iranian woman who removed her compulsory Islamic headscarf out of protest has been sentenced to two years in prison and 18 years of probation. text: The IRCTC has ordered enquiry into a complaint by a passenger of Yesvantpur-Howrah Duronto Express about quality of food served to him in the train. Citing that at least 23 passengers of the same train tweeted that food quality was good, an IRCTC official said, "The gentleman may not have liked the taste, but the food served...was definitely not stale."
summary: IRCTC ने दुरंतो एक्सप्रेस के खाने की शिकायत पर जांच के आदेश दिए

text: Union minister Maneka Gandhi has urged Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal to amend the law to ensure that income generated from an asset gifted to a wife is not added to the husband's taxable income. Adding that the provision was formulated after assuming that women don't have taxable income, Maneka said it deters husbands from transferring assets to their wives.
summary: पत्नियों को संपत्ति देने के लिए पुरुषों पर कर न लगाएं: मेनका टू सेंटर

text: The US and Afghan forces have seized the Islamic State's de facto capital in the eastern Nangarhar province of Afghanistan. The operation to liberate the region, which lies on the border with Pakistan's Orokzai tribal area began in April. Nearly 170 Islamic State militants were killed in the over two-month-long operation.
summary: अफगानिस्तान में आईएसआईएस की राजधानी अमेरिका समर्थित बलों द्वारा जब्त कर ली गई

text: Scientists have discovered the oldest known colours, 1.1 billion-year-old bright pink pigments extracted from rocks beneath Africa's Sahara desert. The pigments are fossils of chlorophyll produced by organisms which inhabited an ancient ocean, said a researcher from Australian National University. The fossils range from blood red to deep purple in concentrated form, and bright pink when diluted.
summary: चमकीले गुलाबी को दुनिया के सबसे पुराने रंग के रूप में खोजा गया

text: Karan Johar has revealed that Shah Rukh Khan "finds it very difficult to laugh naturally on-screen". "Ask him to laugh in a scene and he can't do it," Johar added. Talking about a scene in 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' in which Khan had to laugh, he further said, "We had many takes...It [got] so exhausting that he laughed...out of exhaustion."
summary: शाहरुख खान स्वाभाविक रूप से पर्दे पर नहीं हंस सकते: करण जौहर

text: Sonali Bendre, who has been diagnosed with cancer, shared a post in which she wrote, "All is not lost...Someone, somewhere understands what you're going through." She added, "The only thing I'm trying to be consistent about is maintaining a positive outlook." Sonali thanked people who shared stories of their experiences in dealing with cancer and said that gave her strength.
summary: सब हारा नहीं है: सोनाली बेंद्रे को कैंसर होने का पता चला

text: Television actress Kritika Kamra, while speaking about being trolled for posting a picture of herself in a bikini, said, "I don't have time to deal with rubbish." "It's my Instagram page and I can put up whatever I want," she added. Kritika further questioned, "Why should certain comments or people stop you from posting what you want to?"
summary: बकवास का समय नहीं: बिकनी तस्वीर के लिए कृतिका को ट्रोल किया गया

text: Swiss tennis star Roger Federer played a defensive cricket shot during his match against Adrian Mannarino at Wimbledon, after which Wimbledon's official Twitter account asked ICC about rating Federer's shot. ICC replied with an image of Federer's name ranked as the top Test batsman in its batsmen rankings. ICC later also added a meme featuring Sachin Tendulkar and Federer.
summary: फेडरर विंबलडन में क्रिकेट शॉट खेलते हैं, ICC उन्हें रैंक 1 देता है

text: Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tej Pratap took bath at a Dalit family's house in his constituency Mahua in Bihar and shared pictures of the same on Twitter, calling it a "sweet experience". The RJD leader also held a 'Tea with Tej' campaign in the constituency, where the residents were invited over tea to share their problem with him.

text: Within less than six months into its India launch, Beijing-based bicycle sharing startup Ofo has reportedly fired a majority of its employees in India operations. The Alibaba-backed company has stopped operating in all cities except Pune, the report added. Ofo, which offers station-free bikes operated via an app, claimed to have completed 1.1 million rides within four months in India.

text: Researchers led by US-based Tufts University have developed a bandage designed to actively monitor the condition of chronic wounds and deliver appropriate treatments to improve healing rates. A chip accompanying the bandage can trigger drug release in response to embedded pH and temperature sensors that track infection and inflammation. The bandage is aimed to prevent infections and amputations.
summary: स्मार्ट पट्टी जो घाव और दवाइयों की निगरानी कर सकती है

text: Houses built under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) in Madhya Pradesh will have tiles with PM Narendra Modi and CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's picture on them. According to a government order, there'll be two such tiles measuring 450x600 mm in each house, with one tile fixed at the main gate and the other in the kitchen.
summary: PMAY के तहत MP में मकान, PM मोदी, टाइल्स पर CM की तस्वीर

text: The Delhi State Consumer Dispute Redressal Commission has ordered a hospital to pay Ã¢ÂÂ¹10 lakh to a man on whom doctors carried out a heart procedure without properly revealing the risks involved. The court observed the patient consent forms were not informative. The man had to undergo an open heart surgery due to blockage in his heart following the treatment.
summary: दिल्ली अस्पताल ने इलाज के जोखिम को न बताने के लिए आदमी को ¢ to10L का भुगतान किया

text: Madras High Court on Tuesday ordered the CBSE to award extra 196 marks to all candidates who took the all-India medical entrance exam NEET in Tamil as the question paper contained errors. It further asked the CBSE to release the list of revised ranks within two weeks. The counselling sessions for medical courses have been suspended till then.
summary: उन लोगों के लिए अतिरिक्त 196 अंक, जिन्होंने NEET In Tamil: HC से CBSE लिया था

text: While hearing a PIL seeking ban on 'khatna' or female genital mutilation practised among Muslims of the Dawoodi Bohra Community, the Supreme Court said, "How can you touch anybody's genitals?" "Bodily integrity of a woman cannot be infringed without her consent," the court observed. The court has set July 16 for a detailed hearing in the case.
summary: आप किसी के जननांगों को कैसे छू सकते हैं: उत्परिवर्तन अभ्यास पर एससी

text: After the Supreme Court upheld the death penalty awarded to the convicts in the 2012 Nirbhaya gangrape case, Delhi Police officials who probed the case said that they kept the promise they made to the victim. "She was a brave girl and whenever she spoke about the accused, she kept reiterating 'don't leave them'," an officer recalled taking her statement.

text: The leaders of Ethiopia and Eritrea on Monday signed a declaration to fully implement a peace deal reached in 2000, ending the 20-year war between the two countries. Both the nations also agreed to re-establish trade and diplomatic ties. Eritrea seceded from Ethiopia in 1993, and the two countries fought a border war from 1998 to 2000.

text: A 5-month-old baby was left buried under a pile of sticks and debris in Montana, US for at least nine hours before being discovered by police officials. text: Mexico placed its capital and 10 states on alert after thieves stole a vehicle carrying a container full of radioactive materials. The country's civil protection agency said the stolen substance presents a "low risk" but can cause cancer and other permanent health damage. Earlier this year, seven Mexican states were put on alert after a nuclear densometer was stolen.

text: US President Donald Trump called some of his aides "stupid people" during a phone call with Vladimir Putin after the Russian President's electoral victory earlier this year, The New York Times reported. Trump reportedly made the remark after the Russian President told him that the aides had tried to prevent the call from happening.
summary: ट्रम्प ने पुतिन को बताया कि उनके कुछ सहयोगी बेवकूफ लोग हैं: रिपोर्ट

text: After the NCLT dismissed Cyrus Mistry's plea challenging his removal as Tata Sons Chairman in 2016, Ratan Tata said, "Judgement...is a vindication of the actions that Tata Sons felt obliged to take in October 2016". "It's a reinforcement of principles and forthrightness that prevails in our judicial system," he added. The court said Tata's board was "competent" to remove Mistry.

text: USA's 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams said that she hopes her daughter Alexis Olympia does not play tennis while also stating that "ice skating could be fun". Serena revealed that her elder sister Venus has said that she would coach Alexis but "she just didn't want to travel". The 36-year-old had won the Australia Open 2017 while being pregnant.

text: Former England captain Nasser Hussain trolled former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly for posting a selfie from the Lord's balcony, where Ganguly had celebrated shirtless after winning against Hussain-led England in the NatWest Trophy final in 2002. text: A 15-year-old boy drowned on Saturday after jumping into a trench in Mumbai to show his friends his swimming skills. The trench, which was 15-20 feet deep, was overflowing with rainwater and he misjudged the water level, the police said. The victim's body was fished out several hours later and a case of accidental death was registered.

text: A three-year-old girl was crushed to death under her school bus on Monday after she fell off the vehicle in Haryana. Following the accident, he rushed his daughter to a hospital, where she was declared brought dead.

text: Speaking about his decision to order a mandatory dope test for all government employees, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said such tests are also conducted for Army personnel as a precautionary measure. text: Talking about the plea in the Supreme Court against Section 377 which criminalises homosexuality, BJP leader Subramanian Swamy on Tuesday said, "It is not a normal thing. text: BJP MP Subramanian Swamy has said a law should be formulated "to make the rapist undergo surgery after which he cannot rape anyone in future". text: The Department of Telecommunications has approved merger of Vodafone India and Idea Cellular that will create India's largest telecom operator, according to reports. However, both companies will have to meet certain conditions for final approval, reports added. text: When deciding the right term insurance plan, checking the Claims Paid Percentage of the insurance company is the right thing to do. Higher the number better is the credibility of a company to pay policyholder's claims. Max Life Insurance, which clocked 98.26% claims percentage in 2017-18, has been delivering healthy Claims Paid Percentage for 4 years in a row.

text: Former Indian cricket team captain Sunil Gavaskar acted in a Marathi movie titled 'Savli Premachi', which released in 1980. Gavaskar, who turns 69 today, was asked by umpire Piloo Reporter to act with his sister Madhumati in the film. Gavaskar also featured in another Marathi movie 'Zakol' before making a guest appearance in Naseeruddin Shah's 1988 Hindi comedy 'Malamaal'.

text: Singer Justin Bieber took to Instagram to confirm that he got engaged to model Hailey Baldwin on Saturday. text: Former cricketer Sunil Gavaskar, who turns 69 today, was almost exchanged at birth after a nurse accidentally placed him next to a fisherwoman in the hospital. Gavaskar's uncle had noticed a birthmark near his ear and when he didn't see it in the other child, he brought the matter to the notice, following which Gavaskar was returned to his parents.

text: Sunil Gavaskar, who turns 69 today, got his hair trimmed from umpire Dickie Bird while batting in a Test against England in 1974. Gavaskar, who wasn't wearing a helmet, asked Bird to cut his hair as they were getting in his eyes. Bird chopped Gavaskar's hair with a pair of scissors he had kept to cut threads from ball's seam.

text: Lithuanian couple, Vytautas Kirkliauskas and Neringa Kirkliauskiene, won the world wife-carrying championship title after beating 53 other couples participating in the hour-long race in Finland on Saturday. text: Electric scooter rental startup Lime announced it has raised $335 million from investors including Uber, whose app will promote Lime. The deal, led by Google parent Alphabet, values Lime at $1.1 billion.

text: A video has surfaced online, wherein a Hyderabad man could be seen flinging his 3-year-old son and banging him against an auto-rickshaw reportedly after a fight with his wife. text: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday said the government employees found positive in dope test wouldn't be sacked or punished and would be provided treatment instead. The CM had ordered a mandatory dope test for all state government employees including police personnel from the time of recruitment.

text: US President Donald Trump's former personal driver of more than 20 years has filed a lawsuit against the Trump Organisation alleging that he was forced to work "thousands of hours" of overtime without fair compensation. text: British Prime Minister Theresa May on Monday appointed Jeremy Hunt as Foreign Secretary after Boris Johnson resigned in protest at the government's Brexit plan. "Brexit should be a chance to maximise the particular advantages of the UK as an open, outward-looking global economy," he added.

text: Interim Finance Minister Piyush Goyal has said proposal for single GST rate slab was a "ridiculous suggestion". Goyal said it'll be a burden on the poor if items of daily use were taxed at 18%. Spain had sacked Lopetegui two days before their opening game of the tournament as he had signed for Real Madrid while still being Spain's coach.

text: The Indian women's T20I team captain Harmanpreet Kaur has reportedly been removed from the post of DSP in Punjab Police after her graduation degree was found to be fake during the verification phase. text: Amid reports of differences between BJP and JD(U) over the allocation of Lok Sabha seats, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said, "There is no problem between the two parties." He said the rumours were "all hot air", adding, "All the issues relating to the 2019 Lok Sabha elections will be sorted out in the due course of time."
summary: सभी गर्म हवा: नीतीश कुमार ने भाजपा, जद (यू) के बीच समस्याओं से इनकार किया

text: Amid rumours of BJP trying to poach some PDP MLAs, former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah demanded the dissolution of the state assembly. text: South Korean President Moon Jae-in paid a visit to the Swaminarayan Akshardham Temple in Delhi on Sunday. Jae-in, who is on a four-day visit to India, said the two countries may have different cultures but share common values such as peace, harmony and unity in diversity. He will visit the Gandhi Smriti along with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday.
summary: एस कोरियाई राष्ट्रपति मून जे-इन ने अक्षरधाम मंदिर का दौरा किया

text: The Supreme Court has refused to delay hearing of petitions challenging Section 377 which criminalises homosexuality and rejected the Centre's plea requesting four more weeks to file its reply in the matter. The SC said the hearing will commence on July 10 as scheduled. As many as 12 individuals, including Lalit hotels owner Keshav Suri, filed petitions challenging Section 377.
summary: SC ने धारा 377 में देरी से इनकार किया, सरकार की याचिका खारिज कर दी

text: The bodies of three out of five children aged between 12 to 15 years have been recovered after they drowned while bathing in the Ganga barrage in Kanpur, police said. The bodies of the other two children are yet to be located. When one child started drowning, the others got trapped in deep waters trying to save him, witnesses said.
summary: गंगा बैराज में नहाते समय तीन बच्चे डूब गए

text: A 40-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped by four men in the forest area of Madhya Pradesh's Betul district on Saturday. A case has been registered under sections 376 (punishment for rape) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code and Atrocities Act. This is the sixth rape incident reported from the state within a fortnight, according to reports.
summary: मध्य प्रदेश में 40 वर्षीय महिला ने 4 पुरुषों से गैंगरेप किया

text: The Union Environment Ministry has set noise standards for airports across the country, excluding defence aircraft, and those that are landing and taking off. A civil airport with more than 50,000 aircraft movements per year should not exceed noise levels beyond 75 dB(A) Leq (decibels) during the daytime and 65 dBA during the night, according to the rules.

text: Two terrorists allegedly barged into the house of a PDP worker in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora on Sunday to abduct him and slit his wife's throat while she was trying to rescue him. The woman later succumbed to her injuries at a hospital in Srinagar. Meanwhile, the terrorists managed to escape after attacking the woman.

text: Jaskirat Singh Sidhu, a 29-year-old Indian-origin truck driver in Canada, has been arrested for a bus crash that killed 16 people, mostly members of a junior hockey team. It is believed to be one of the worst disasters in Canada's sporting community. Sidhu is facing several counts of dangerous driving causing death, which carries a maximum sentence of 14 years.

text: A former Congress worker has alleged that Congress party's president Rahul Gandhi did not act on her sexual harassment complaint against her senior. Shamsul, who disappeared from the Kashmir University in May, is the brother of 2012 batch Assam-Meghalaya cadre IPS officer Inamul Haq, who is posted in Guwahati.

text: The principal and professors of Delhi University's Bharati College paid a student's admission fee after she told them she was unable to afford it. Earlier, his wife had held a press conference, accusing the Special Task Force (STF) of planning a fake encounter to murder him.

text: A groom married a relative at the Srikanteshwara temple in Karnataka's Mysuru after the bride, Nandhini, eloped with her lover on the day of the wedding. text: Team India opener Rohit Sharma has become the first Indian cricketer to smash three centuries in T20I cricket. text: India defeated England in the third T20I on Sunday to win the three-match series 2-1 and register their sixth successive T20I series victory. text: Former Team India captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni took five catches in the third T20I against England, setting two world records. Dhoni also became the first-ever wicketkeeper to reach 50 T20I catches, taking his tally to 54.

text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) will continue being a part of NDA alliance for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, JD(U) General Secretary Sanjay Kumar Jha announced after the party's national executive meeting on Sunday. text: Russian forward Fedor Smolov, who missed a penalty in the shootout against Croatia in 2018 FIFA World Cup quarter-final, sat alone in the middle of the pitch after his team crashed out of the tournament. text: Patidar leader Hardik Patel on Sunday announced that he will sit on an indefinite fast from August 25 to seek reservations in government jobs and education for the Patidar community, adding that it will be his "last fight." text: Talking about the early challenges faced while building the e-commerce firm, Jabong Co-founder Manu Jain said that people's perception towards fashion e-commerce was one of the challenging aspects. text: Fitness trackers made by the defunct wearables startup Jawbone remained on sale even after its companion app was shut down earlier this year, according to consumer watchdog Which. text: Maharashtra Police has arrested the main accused in the lynching of five men in Dhule, taking the tally of arrested people to 26. The incident was triggered by social media rumours about the presence of child abductors in the area.

text: Indian economist and Nobel laureate Amartya Sen said India has taken a "quantum jump in the wrong direction" since 2014. Stating that the nation is "getting backwards in the fastest-growing economy", he said India is the second-worst among six South Asian countries. Slamming the central government, Sen said, "At this time, the whole issue of Opposition unity is so important."

text: Former Vice President Hamid Ansari has said PM Narendra Modi's remarks during his farewell in 2017 were considered to be "a departure from accepted practice". text: The world's biggest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance, has pledged $1 million for the victims of the floods in Japan. text: Two of the boys from a 12-member teenage football team trapped in a Thailand cave for two weeks were successfully rescued on Sunday, a rescue official said. text: Over 100 chimneys are being drilled into a mountainside to rescue the 12-member teenage football team and their coach trapped inside a cave in Thailand. "Some chimneys are as deep as 400 metres... but they still cannot find their location," said the mission's head.

text: The relatives of the family whose 11 members were found dead at their house in Burari have appealed to Delhi Police for a fresh probe citing several missing links. text: A Karnataka court on Saturday sentenced a 75-year-old man to life imprisonment for murdering his wife, 11 days after he committed the crime. text: Cellular body COAI has opposed telecom regulator TRAI's public WiFi model saying it'll "compromise national security". text: Senior Samajwadi Party leader Ram Gopal Yadav on Sunday said the party is in favour of conducting 'one nation, one election', adding it should be implemented from 2019. text: The Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) on Sunday passed a resolution in favour of one nation one election, or simultaneous elections. Meanwhile, the DMK opposed the idea saying it "goes against the basic tenets of our Constitution".

text: Indian National Lok Dal MP Dushyant Chautala has filed a defamation case against Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij for allegedly calling him a drug addict. text: The National Board of Wildlife has recommended that states use Section 144, which prohibits the assembly of four or more people, during wildlife emergencies. text: The UK has launched new visas that will be open to overseas scientists and researchers, including Indians, to encourage growth of the country's research sector. text: Croatia registered a 4-3 victory on penalties in the fourth quarter-final on Saturday to knock hosts Russia out of the 2018 FIFA World Cup. text: A 40-year-old man has been sentenced to death by a court in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Saturday for raping a nine-year-old girl. The investigation into the May 21 incident was completed in 72 hours and hearing within 46 days. This is believed to be the first verdict since the new bill was passed by the state government in December.

text: A 53-year-old Canadian national fell to death while attempting to scale the world's second highest peak, 8,611-metre K2, on Saturday. text: Former Finance Minister Yashwant Sinha on Saturday slammed his son union minister Jayant Sinha for garlanding eight men convicted in Ramgarh mob lynching case after the Jharkhand High Court released them on bail. text: A panel set up by Delhi L-G Anil Baijal has said Delhi government's flagship CCTV project will not be controlled by the AAP government but will be under the L-G via Delhi Police. text: A day after refusing India's plea to deport controversial Islamic preacher Zakir Naik, Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad met him on Saturday. text: The BJP has asked journalists to furnish their personal details including Aadhaar number or Voter ID in order to obtain a pass for party President Amit Shah's event in Chennai scheduled for Monday. text: The CBI has filed a chargesheet against five men including BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's brother Atul Singh Sengar, for murdering a gangrape victim's father in police custody in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. text: A 32-year-old employee of Christy Friedgram jumped off the first floor of a building during an Income Tax raid and questioning in Tamil Nadu's Tiruchengode. text: At least 64 people have been killed and 44 others have been missing in flooding and landslides caused by torrential rain in western and central Japan. text: French investigators have said the 2016 EgyptAir crash that killed 66 was likely caused by cockpit fire, contradicting Egyptian authorities who claimed the plane had been bombed. They said onboard recorders suggested the fire spread quickly through the plane, causing the loss of control of the aircraft. The plane was flying from Paris to Cairo before crashing into the Mediterranean.
summary: 2016 मिस्र की आग से हुई दुर्घटना, बम नहीं: फ्रांसीसी जांच

text: Following US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's visit to the country, North Korea has accused the US of making "cancerous" demands in talks over its nuclear program. However, Pompeo had said his two days of talks had been "productive".

Sonakshi and Katrina are seen lying on their backs on a training mat, exercising with their arms tangled together. In the video, Sonakshi jokingly said, "If anyone is seeing this, we need help!"
summary: कटरीना के साथ स्वास्थ्य के लिए खतरनाक: सोनाक्षी ने शेयर किया वीडियो

text: Reacting to Indian batsman Shikhar Dhawan's catch at the long leg boundary to dismiss English captain Eoin Morgan, former South African cricketer Jonty Rhodes tweeted, "@SDhawan25 what a catch - Kabaddi could do with your skills!!". Notably, Dhawan's celebration after taking a catch has been inspired by the sport of kabaddi, with players doing it after a successful raid.
summary: कबड्डी अपने कौशल के साथ कर सकता था: धवन के कैच पर जॉन्टी

text: Twenty-three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has revealed that she missed her daughter Olympia's first steps because she was practising for her next Wimbledon match. Serena became a mother in September 2017 and missed last year's Wimbledon because of pregnancy. She is competing for her eighth Wimbledon title and will face Russia's Evgeniya Rodina in Round of 16 on Monday.
summary: मैं रोया: बेटी के पहले कदमों के गायब होने पर सेरेना विलियम्स

text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra wished former Indian cricket team captain MS Dhoni on his 37th birthday calling him a "worthy role model". "Happy birthday & in addition I hope that we will see the birth of many more sportspersons like him," Mahindra tweeted. "It's not his talent alone that is enviable... it's his demeanour," he added.
summary: एक योग्य रोल मॉडल: महिंद्रा धोनी को उनके जन्मदिन पर शुभकामनाएं देता है

text: Reacting to an image of former Indian cricketer S Sreesanth from the gym, a user tweeted, "#Sreesanth can now play the role of #Hulk. No vfx required". Other users reacted with tweets like, "Good god. Sreesanth has turned into Kevin Nash [WWE wrestler]" and "Did ... did Sreesanth eat Salman Khan's character from 'Suryavanshi'?"
summary: श्रीसंत अब हल्क, ट्वीट्स उपयोगकर्ता की भूमिका निभा सकते हैं

text: Google has denied the reports claiming it is testing its human-sounding AI assistant 'Duplex' for enterprises to replace humans at call centres. The company claimed it "is designed to operate in specific use cases... where we can help people get things done". Earlier, reports claimed an insurance company was investigating ways to use Duplex in call centres for customer service.
summary: Google इनकार करता है कि उसका AI कॉल सेंटरों में इंसानों की जगह लेगा

text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said she is willing to ally with Congress to ensure that BJP is not elected in the 2019 elections, adding that BJP leaders behave like a "hundred Hitlers". Stating that she shares "very good" relations with Congress leader Sonia Gandhi, CM Mamata described Congress President Rahul Gandhi as "much junior".
summary: भाजपा के सौ हिटलरों को हटाने के लिए कांग्रेस के साथ सहयोगी: ममता

text: A 57-year-old man attempted to commit suicide by jumping in front of a metro which was approaching the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium station in Delhi on Saturday. Officials said that the man was later rescued and is receiving treatment at a hospital. An investigation has been launched into the incident.
summary: दिल्ली मेट्रो के सामने कूदने के बाद 57 वर्षीय वृद्ध को बचाया गया

text: Talking about rising rape incidents in Uttar Pradesh, BJP MLA Surendra Narayan Singh on Saturday said, "I can say this with full confidence that even Lord Ram will not be able to prevent such instances." "It is people's responsibility to treat others as their family, as their sisters. We can only control it through values, not the constitution," Singh added.
summary: यहां तक कि भगवान राम भी बलात्कार की घटनाओं को नहीं रोक पाएंगे: भाजपा विधायक

text: The Gujarat Police has booked Patidar leader Hardik Patel and MLAs Jignesh Mevani and Alpesh Thakor for allegedly 'raiding' a woman's house on suspicions that a 'liquor den' was being operated at the site. Stating that the accused and their 12 supporters barged into her residence, the woman added that they planted two liquor pouches in her home.
summary: हार्दिक, जिग्नेश ने महिला के घर पर शराब विरोधी छापे के लिए बुक किया

text: A mob in Bihar's Nalanda on Friday threw a man accused of murder and a policeman from the first-floor balcony of a building. The man had allegedly shot another person dead, after which the mob resorted to violence and hurt 11 policemen. The policeman who was thrown off the balcony had gone to save the murder-accused.
summary: भीड़ ने आरोपी की हत्या कर दी, बिहार में पहली मंजिल से गिर गया

text: Addressing students at the Goa University, President Ram Nath Kovind on Saturday said access to higher education is still a privilege in India. Asserting that India has the third-largest education system in the world, President Kovind said, "Expansion of quantity has to be complemented with quality." Quality should be visible in the educational content and methods of teaching, he added.
summary: भारत में उच्च शिक्षा का विशेषाधिकार: प्रीज़ कोविंद

text: England defeated Sweden in the quarters on Saturday to reach the FIFA World Cup semi-finals for the first time since 1990. This is the third time in their 15 World Cup appearances that England have reached the last four of the quadrennial tournament. England will next face the winners of the match between Croatia and hosts Russia on Wednesday.
summary: इंग्लैंड 1990 के बाद पहली बार विश्व कप के सेमीफाइनल में पहुंचा

text: As many as eight out of 10 millennials are in favour of inter-caste marriages in India, Inshorts' 'Pulse of the Nation' poll has revealed. Further, only 16% males get married under societal pressure, while the number is slightly higher for females, at 25%. The poll captured the views of 1.3 lakh netizens in the age group of 18-35 years.
summary: 10 में से 8 भारतीय अंतर-जातीय विवाह का समर्थन करते हैं: इनशॉर्ट्स पोल

text: Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj has said that she thinks Priyanka Chopra will be a great choice to portray her in her biopic while adding, "Our personalities match a lot." However, Mithali said she is happy to leave the final decision to the makers. She further said, "I'd love the experts to do their job."n
summary: बायोपिक में मिताली राज: प्रियंका मुझे निभाएंगी

text: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni took to Instagram to share a video of himself celebrating his 37th birthday with his family and teammates in Bristol. "This is what happens when u keeping bossing around for the whole year and finally youngsters get a chance to give it back.thanks guys for making the day special," he captioned the video.
summary: धोनी ने परिवार, टीम के साथियों के साथ अपना 37 वां जन्मदिन मनाया

text: Tech billionaire Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted he was working with experts to create an escape pod to rescue the 12 Thai schoolboys and their coach, who have been stuck in a cave for 14 days. Musk also revealed he was building an inflatable tube with airlocks. Engineers from The Boring Company and SpaceX are aiding rescue efforts.
summary: गुफा में फंसे बच्चों को बचाने के लिए एलोन मस्क एस्केप पॉड बना रहा है

text: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh-led BJP government has defeated the no-confidence motion that the Congress moved against it in the state assembly. The debate, which started at 12 noon on Friday, ran for more than 14 hours and ended with BJP government winning the motion at 2:10 am on Saturday. Several issues including a sex CD case were raised.
summary: छत्तीसगढ़ के सीएम ने उनके खिलाफ अविश्वास प्रस्ताव को हराया

text: Homes run by Mother Teresa's Missionaries of Charity in Jharkhand's Ranchi have not been able to produce records of births given by 280 women, the police said on Saturday. Police said around 450 pregnant women were admitted in the homes between 2015 and 2018, but records were only available for 170 births.
summary: मदर टेरेसा के चैरिटी घरों में 280 जन्मों का कोई रिकॉर्ड नहीं है

text: Manipur is facing unrest after a pillar on the India-Myanmar border was allegedly shifted 3 kms into the Indian territory. Following the unrest, prohibitory orders under section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code were imposed in some areas of the state for the next six months. The issue of the shifted border was raised by residents last month.
summary: सीमा स्तंभ के बाद मणिपुर में अशांति भारत में 3 कि.मी.

text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated 13 infrastructure projects worth Ã¢ÂÂ¹2,100 crore in Rajasthan. These include water supply and sewerage projects in several cities like Sikar and Mount Abu, and an elevated road project in Ajmer. "There are some who don't like anything we do...but BJP believes only in vikas, vikas and vikas," he said at a rally in Jaipur.
summary: पीएम मोदी ने राजस्थान में ¢ 1002,100 करोड़ मूल्य की 13 परियोजनाओं का उद्घाटन किया

text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar, while scolding a reporter, said that he should first learn "etiquettes of media". The reporter asked about delay in addressal of grievances received on the digital platform 'CM Window Haryana'. Responding to this, Khattar said the media's job is to ask questions and not accuse the government. He further said "media is only a medium".
summary: पहले शिष्टाचार सीखें: हरियाणा के सीएम खट्टर ने डांटा रिपोर्टर

text: Maharashtra's Vidhan Bhavan in Nagpur was flooded on Friday as liquor bottles and plastic were found to have choked drains. Both houses of the state legislature were adjourned for the day after power supply was cut following flooding of the transformer room, the first instance in 57 years. Nagpur was hosting the monsoon session for the fourth time in history.
summary: बीयर की बोतल चोक होने के बाद महाराष्ट्र विधानसभा में पानी भर गया
